title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Here at Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That's why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We’re looking for a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm team in a hybrid role and help us shape the future of billing!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a great platform to prove that great business grows from great relationships. This is a flexible hybrid role based in Stockholm, with no relocation assistance offered.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Standardize & Scale: Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* Tackle Tech Debt: Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* Create Real Value: Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients and their customers will love.
* Lead & Collaborate: Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas, guide technical decisions, and keep our platform moving forward.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

 We want someone humble, hungry, and happy: eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Language Expertise: At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP or Python (ideally both, but strong in one with openness to learn the other works too), ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* Adaptability: An openness to learning new tools in our stack (think AWS, databases, and more).
* Product Mindset: Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.
* Problem-Solver: A knack for breaking down complex challenges into clean, maintainable solutions.


 Bonus Skills
   

  

* B2B & B2C Background: Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* Scaling Know-How: Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.
* Payments Experience: A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.


 Why Work with Us?
   

  

 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
   

  

 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
   

  

 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
   

  

 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Software Engineer - Language Systems
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a
 **Software Engineer for Language Systems** 
 , you will join a team that develops innovative mobile and desktop applications in a complex, cross-platform environment. Our work is centered on improving assistive communication tools, ensuring that individuals with disabilities can effectively express themselves. You will contribute to the evolution of our language models, improve our software architecture, and work with experts in linguistics, speech-language pathology, and machine learning to refine and advance our solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design, develop, and deploy products across multiple operating systems.
* Contribute to the development and improvement of application language models.
* Explore, evaluate, recommend, and process language data sources.
* Assist in implementing and optimizing natural language data processing tools.
* Work closely with linguists and speech-language pathologists to enhance communication technologies.
* Modularize architectural components to maximize scalability and minimize code duplication.
* Contribute to architectural and API improvements.
* Debug and analyze code issues using static analysis and platform-specific debugging tools.
* Implement clear and well-documented APIs for use in higher-level code.
* Follow and advocate for best coding practices within the team.


**What We're Looking For:**
* A B.S. in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience (1-3 years in software engineering).
* A strong background in linguistics, natural language processing (NLP), or a related field.
* Preferably 1+ years of experience working with C#, Python, and SQL.
* Proficiency in object-oriented languages such as C#, C++, Java, or Objective-C.
* Familiarity with NLP and machine learning libraries (NLTK, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, etc.).
* Experience working in Linux environments, particularly with a command-line interface (CLI) and shell scripting.
* Working knowledge of regular expressions.
* Prior experience with localization processes.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data management.


 If you are passionate about language, technology, and empowering individuals through communication, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Full Stack .NET with cloud | Stockholm
description:
Are you a
 **Full Stack .NET Developer** 
 passionate about cutting-edge automotive technology? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment where your skills can make a real impact? If so, the team in Stockholm is looking for you!
 



  





 The ALTEN Sweden, Stockholm office is home to a dynamic, highly skilled team of engineers and developers from all over the world who specialize in delivering tailored solutions across sectors like automotive, telecommunications, life sciences, and IT. Known for their collaborative spirit, the team combines deep technical expertise with a proactive, problem-solving approach, fostering an environment where creativity and efficiency meet to drive impactful results for clients. With a strong focus on professional development and a supportive culture, the Stockholm team is dedicated to both individual growth and collective success, making it an exciting and empowering place to be a part of.
 



  





**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 



* A supportive and inclusive workplace with a focus on personal and professional growth.
* Opportunities to expand your skill set with access to ALTEN’s global network of experts.
* Individual education budget.
* Work-life balance days: three extra days off per year.
* Collective agreement, Pension, insurances, and wellness grants.



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 You will develop and implement full stack solutions using the .NET framework and modern front-end technologies, working on exciting, high-impact projects while collaborating closely with automotive engineers and product teams to deliver solutions that excel in performance, scalability, and safety. You will innovate and optimize software systems for advanced automotive applications such as infotainment systems, autonomous driving, and connected vehicles, taking part in the full development lifecycle from concept and design through testing, deployment, and continuous improvement. By sharing your expertise and staying ahead of the latest industry trends, you will contribute to a culture of excellence and drive the future of automotive software development.
 



  





 We are looking for a mid-senior level developer with at least 4 years of professional experience who is motivated, passionate about automotive technology, and has hands-on experience in full stack development.
 



  





 Skills and experience:
 


* A degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Strong experience with .NET framework (.NET/.NET Core) and C#.
* Knowledge of front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
* Experience with clouds (AWS, Azure or GCP), and CI/CD pipelines
* Meritorious: strong understanding of software architecture principles and best practices for writing high-quality code.



  





**ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe's largest engineering and IT consulting companies, with over 57,000 employees in approximately 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain for leading companies in a variety of industries, such as Automotive, Defense & Security, Energy, Industrial Equipment, Public Service, and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we have around 1,300 dedicated employees with nine offices in nine cities – from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



  





 For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers who offer unique career and development opportunities.
 



  





  





 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Backend Software Engineer** 




**Esports & Streaming | Build from the ground up** 




 We’re building the next generation of esports streaming — and we’re looking for a
 **Senior Backend Software Engineer** 
 to help shape the technical backbone of the platform.
 



 This is a hands-on, high-impact role in a small, experienced team where your decisions will directly influence the product, architecture, and technical direction. If you enjoy ownership, fast iteration, and building scalable systems in a startup environment, you’ll feel right at home.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Design, build, and operate scalable backend systems and APIs
* Own backend architecture, data models, and system integrations
* Work with real-time and near-real-time data for matches, tournaments, and user activity
* Build event-driven services and internal tools that power core product features
* Ensure high performance, reliability, and security in production
* Collaborate closely with product, frontend, and design to ship fast
* Drive technical decisions and help define engineering best practices
* Review code, mentor teammates, and raise the engineering bar
* Balance speed and quality in a fast-moving startup environment



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




**Backend & Systems** 



* 5+ years of professional backend software development experience
* Strong proficiency in
 **Go or Kotlin**
* Experience designing and building REST and/or GraphQL APIs
* Strong understanding of backend architecture and data modeling and previous experience having worked with Kubernetes
* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS or GCP)
* Hands-on experience building and operating distributed systems
* Experience with MongoDB is a plus



**Engineering Practices** 



* Comfortable owning services end-to-end (design → deployment → production)
* Experience with CI/CD, automated testing, and monitoring
* Used to working with Git, pull requests, and collaborative code reviews
* Ability to identify, implement, and own AI-driven workflows



  





  





**Nice to Have** 



* Startup or early-stage product experience
* Background in gaming, esports, streaming, or media platforms
* Experience with video streaming technologies
* Real-time technologies (Kafka, pub/sub, WebSockets, etc.)
* Interest in data, analytics, or large-scale event processing



  





**Who You Are** 



* A builder who enjoys creating systems from scratch — and improving them over time
* Comfortable making decisions with incomplete information
* Product-minded and focused on real user value
* Self-driven, pragmatic, and hands-on
* Passionate about technology (bonus points if you love gaming or esports)



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Early impact in a fast-growing industry
* Real ownership of backend architecture and technical direction
* Small team, high trust, minimal bureaucracy
* Modern tech stack with freedom to influence tools and processes
* Flexible hybrid work setup (Ideally 1–2 days per week in the Stockholm office)

title: Embedded Developer
description:
🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as an Embedded Developer 🚀
   

  

**About The Role**

 **Embedded Developer** 
 to work close to hardware and contribute to next-generation automotive products. You will join a skilled team that values technical curiosity, quality, and structured ways of working.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop embedded software close to hardware
* Design real-time, non-blocking, event-driven systems
* Optimize code for performance, energy, and resource usage
* Analyze and solve complex hardware/software issues
* Review, improve, and refactor legacy code
* Collaborate in a structured, quality-focused development environment


**Required Skills & Experience**
* Several years of embedded software development experience
* Strong C programming skills
* Bare-metal development using datasheets and reference manuals
* Deep knowledge of ARM Cortex-M microcontrollers (Microchip)
* Real-time systems: timing, latency, deterministic behavior
* Low-level concepts: interrupts, registers, timers, watchdogs

 Meriting Experience
   

  

* RTOS
* Assembly language
* CAN and Ethernet (OSI layers 1–4)

title: Software Engineer Technical Lead
description:

title: Summer Trainee, Platform Engineering
description:
**Summer Trainee, Platform Engineering - Impactful Summer 2026**
 Are you ready to power the future with a summer job at the heart of the energy industry? Apply now and join us for an impactful summer 2026!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Fortum’s Platform Engineering team is looking for a Summer Trainee who wants to work together with our platform engineers and architects. As Fortum’s internal platform group, we build and run the internal developer platform (IDP) and cloud foundations used by teams across the company-covering Azure and AWS, container platforms (e.g., Kubernetes), CI/CD, observability, security controls, and developer experience.
   

  

 You will take part in our projects and help specialists in their day‑to‑day work. Tasks can be customized based on your experience and interests, ranging from Infrastructure‑as‑Code (Terraform), pipeline automation (GitHub Actions), CloudOps, and policy‑as‑code to developer portal UX and reliability engineering.
   

  

**About You**
 We hope that you apply for the position if you are:
   

  

* A recent graduate or a student in the final stages of your education in computer/software engineering, information technology, or a related field.
* Fluent in written and spoken English, our language for internal communication. Knowledge of Finnish or Swedish is an advantage.
* Comfortable with programming/scripting (e.g., Python, Go, TypeScript or Bash) and have hands‑on interest in cloud, CI/CD or Infrastructure‑as‑Code - through studies or well‑documented personal projects.


**We offer you**
 We offer you a perfect opportunity to start your career in platform engineering. Our group combines talented juniors and experienced specialists, so you’ll have plenty of guidance. Technically, you’ll see a wide range of platform services, a sophisticated and constantly evolving engineering stack, and real production environments.
   

  

**During the summer you will:**
* Receive a structured introduction and be supported by your team.
* Work on interesting tasks with real responsibility and visible impact.
* Enjoy a hybrid work model with flexible hours, balancing remote and in‑office work.
* Learn about Fortum, the energy industry, and the sustainable solutions we’re advancing.
* Network with other trainees and with platform, security, and application teams.
* Gain valuable experience that can lead to a future with us - many trainees continue after the summer (part‑time during studies or as thesis workers).


 Read more about Summer Energy, our recruitment process and previous trainees’ experiences on our Careers page.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, send your CV through our recruitment tool by 8th of February.
   

  

 For further information about the role, please contact Petri Miettinen, Director, Platform Engineering, petri.miettinen@fortum.com.
   

  

 We encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We start reviewing applications already during the application period, and the job ad will close as soon as the right candidate is found.
   

  

 Our recruitment process may vary depending on the role, but here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Please apply only with your CV/Resume.
* We use screening questions in the application to ensure must‑have requirements.
* Many roles include an early digital assessment (Assessio) to keep the process fair and unbiased.
* Selected applicants are invited to interviews via Teams or in person - this includes at least one interview with the hiring manager.


 The summer trainee period typically runs from May to September.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must undergo background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. Our power generation has one of the lowest specific CO₂‑emissions in Europe and our actions are guided by ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise efficient, low‑carbon power generation from renewable and nuclear sources, as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Kundo är ett SaaS-bolag som erbjuder Sveriges främsta kundservice­system för alla digitala kanaler. Kundservice är en bransch i snabb förändring där AI har medfört stora möjligheter till effektivisering. Det innebär att vi har en ambitiös och spännande resa framför oss där vi fortsätter att bygga ut vår produkt och skapa en plattform som stöttar innovation.
 



 På vår fortsatta tillväxtresa letar vi efter dig som vill ansluta till vårt fantastiska utvecklingsteam som Senior Frontend Developer.
 



 Som utvecklare hos oss ingår du i ett av våra tvärfunktionella team där ni tar gemensamt ägande för hela tech stacken. Huvudfokus i teamen är att utveckla och vidareutveckla våra tjänster. I tätt samarbete med andra roller som product managers, designers, AI engineers etc arbetar du i hela flödet från att identifiera våra kunders behov, välja bästa väg framåt och implementera en lösning, samt inte minst att följa upp och förbättra den över tid.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 För att trivas i rollen här har du antagligen dessa egenskaper:
 


* Minst 5 år erfarenhet av frontendutveckling
* Djupa kunskaper i HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Gedigen erfarenhet av React och Typescript
* Kunskap om WCAG och hur man bygger gränssnitt med hög tillgänglighet
* Grundläggande erfarenhet och förståelse för backendutveckling och arkitektur



  





 Du är en nyfiken och ansvarstagande lagspelare som gärna testar nya tillvägagångssätt och tycker om att jobba kundnära. Du gillar produktutveckling och är van att bidra i tidiga faser med fokus på innovation. Du är van vid att leda dig själv och räds inte att ta egna initiativ.
 



  





**Om vår produkt** 




 Med vår produkt får våra kunder ett modernt och kraftfullt kundserviceverktyg att samarbeta i för att svara på alla ärenden som de får in. Med hjälp av vår produkt levererar organisationer i Norden en bättre kundserviceupplevelse till tiotusentals kunder varje dag. Flera miljoner meddelanden passerar genom våra system varje månad - och den siffran ökar hela tiden.
 



 Enkelheten i att använda våra tjänster är mycket uppskattat av våra kunder och något vi är stolta över.
 



  





 Undrar du vilka tekniker vi arbetar med? Här är de tekniker du kommer att arbeta med:
 


* TypeScript
* React
* Sass
* Python / Django
* Github
* Kubernetes
* AWS



  





 Har du några frågor? Vi berättar gärna mer! Hör av dig till Jonatan Larsson på 070-5124424 eller jonatan@kundo.se. Till rekryteringsbyråer: vi har redan en samarbetspartner för rekryteringen av denna roll.

title: Move to New Zealand - Senior Software Developer
description:
Work with our innovative team based in Auckland, New Zealand! We are seeking talented individuals excited about the opportunity to learn, expand their skillset and support our company in its evolution to a Rust code base.
   

  

 We welcome applications from individuals located internationally seeking remote engagements, or those looking to relocate to Auckland, New Zealand.
   

  

 This listing is for applicants interested in relocating to New Zealand, however if you wish to express interest in working with us remotely from outside New Zealand, please apply via any of our remote listings.
   

  

 Propellerhead hires exceptional talent from all around the globe and many of our people have relocated to New Zealand to join our team. We've created this website packed full of information about moving to New Zealand to work for Propellerhead, if you're interested in making the move to our wonderful country.
   

  

 The Role:
   

  

 As a Senior Software Developer in our core delivery team, you'll help craft interesting, challenging systems that are beyond routine feature work, alongside a team of highly skilled peers who value software craftsmanship and autonomy.
   

  

 You’ll work in an environment that prioritises technical excellence, curiosity, and forward-thinking design. We are looking for someone who is excited by emerging technologies and wants to make a tangible difference in the way people interact with digital systems.
   

  

 We offer a culture built on trust, continuous learning, and meaningful impact. You'll join a team that values integrity over ego, and clarity over complexity.
   

  

 Propellerhead operates a hybrid working model (work from our office and from your own home). While we prefer our NZ-based team to be located in Auckland, we are also welcoming applications from international developers who would like to relocate to Auckland.
   

  

 If you are ready to work on real problems with real impact, and help lay the groundwork for what comes next - we would like to hear from you.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities:**
* Active participation in all aspects of software solution design, including code structure, deployment architecture, DevOps, automated testing and integration of third party systems in line with our technical strategies.
* Collaborating with client stakeholders and with fellow Propellerhead Developers, Analysts, and Solution Architects, to create a shared understanding of the solution design and roadmap delivery in line with agreed budgets.
* Constructing software at every layer of the stack, from user interfaces, back end services, data repositories, interoperability, infrastructure-as-code, deployment pipelines, automated testing and system monitoring.
* Providing second-line support of the systems you build and actively seeking ways to keep your software secure, performant and reliable.
* Passing on your learning of new technologies or techniques to the broader organisation as part of our knowledge sharing programme.
* As a core team member you will be responsible for directing the development approach and reviewing components delivered by implementation partners to ensure quality measures such as security, reliability, maintainability, performance and functional fit for purpose.
* Actively moving forward the evolution of our code base from C# to Rust.


**Skills and Experience Required:**
* 7+ years experience as a Software Developer, including experience working with enterprise-level complexity.
* You must have proficiency in TypeScript and at least one modern web application framework, preferably React.
* Must have experience in C# and up-to-date .NET frameworks to the extent you can maintain some existing code.
* Hands-on experience deploying to Azure and/or AWS, including participation in building CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure-as-code using tools such as Terraform.
* You must have experience with asynchronous services and/or stream processing.
* Experience with Kubernetes and container-based deployments.
* Some experience with Rust is desirable. You will be moving heavily towards this programming language with us.
* Previous experience with Go or C++, is a bonus.
* We are particularly looking for developers with experience or demonstrable interest in any of the following: digital identity, verifiable credentials, open banking, AI agent authorization, edge or device-based software deployment.
* Experience using techniques such as user stories to express the work to be done as business outcomes.
* You can produce clear and concise design documents.
* You have excellent written and verbal communication skills to translate between requirements and technical tasks.


**About Propellerhead:**
 Propellerhead is a leading software services company that designs, delivers, and maintains large-scale, custom-built digital platforms across a range of technologies. We place emphasis on producing technology which is meaningful, has value, and can make a difference in the world. We foster long lasting and trusting relationships with all our clients, and we have worked with a diverse range of commercial, non-profit, and government organisations over our 20 years in the market.
   

  

**How We Build Software:**
 We build software by structuring solutions in a product-centric manner and focusing on continuously delivering improvements from a backlog of features. These features are taken from real stakeholder needs linked to clear objectives. As a result, our digital platforms are a mixture of custom components and external services which produce a powerful and engaging experience when combined.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* Contribute to interesting, diverse, and commercially minded work for well-respected clients.
* Join a Developer-led organisation full of world-class colleagues.
* Join a culture of learning and collaboration.
* Fortnightly Developer knowledge sharing session with lunch provided.
* Work both within our beautifully designed office and from the comfort of your home (hybrid work environment)
* Propellerhead is an equal opportunity workplace which is free from discrimination.


**Cover Letter:**
* Please note - only applications with a cover letter will be reviewed.\*


 It's very important to us that you include a cover letter with your application - it's your chance to tell us more about who you are and what you value.
   

  

*At Propellerhead, we use AI thoughtfully as part of our delivery practices - considered integration helps us stay at the forefront of technology and create innovative, valuable solutions for our clients.*
*In recruitment, however, AI isn’t used to assess skills, experience or suitability for a role. Every application is reviewed by a real person to ensure a fair, engaged and thoughtfully human process.*
*Therefore we kindly ask that you refrain from using it in your application. We're excited to learn about your unique experiences and ideas, so please apply as your authentic self!*
**More:**
 Candidates that progress may be asked to agree to a police background check, credit history check, other assessments and provide evidence of qualifications.

title: Golang Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Golang Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is Go, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Golang Developer with at least 4+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience using Golang
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Skills and experience from additional tech stacks and tools are appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
 



  





**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





**The Website** 




 The ComeOn.com platform is a service-oriented web application where stability, high performance, and user experience are our top priorities. Our frontend is architected as a
 **modern, responsive multi-device solution** 
 , leveraging the latest reactive frameworks and sophisticated client-side state management.
 



 On the backend, our business logic relies on a robust, proprietary system supported by leading open-source frameworks and secure integration modules. Our data layer consists of
 **high-availability distributed clusters** 
 and dedicated warehousing solutions. We are continuously exploring emerging technologies and
 **innovative architectural patterns** 
 to deliver the most efficient and competitive gaming experience to our customers.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




 We are looking for a Java developer to help us build the best gambling site on the Internet. You will work with all parts of the system and all stages of the development process in a team-oriented environment. This includes integrations with external systems, the development of internal components and subsystems, and potentially also frontend development for mobile and desktop devices. You as a developer will work closely together with the business side of the organization to develop and implement new features. You will be working with modern technologies such as Java, Kafka, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, React, Springboot, deployed as a Debian package, or in Kubernetes. The role also involves reading code written over 15 years, by around 60 developers, and finding manageable paths to modernize it in risk-adverse increments.
 



  





**About you:** 




 Your Core Skills & Mindset:
 


* Deep experience in using Java.
* You understand that reading code is more difficult than writing code.
* You should have about 6+ years of previous work experience.
* Experience with web application/service development.
* SQL Knowledge.
* You know how to get legacy code under test.
* You need to be curious and willing to discuss and exchange knowledge with team members.
* You need to be a communicative member of an agile delivery team consisting of Devs, QAs and PO.
* It would be advantageous if you have experience with some of the other technologies that we use; Tomcat, Maven, Spring, MongoDB, Guava, Guice, MySQL, Nginx, Linux, Jenkins, and GIT, docker, Kubernetes, gcloud.
* You must be fluent in written and spoken English.



  





**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?** 



* A competitive remuneration package! :moneybag:
* Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events :sunglasses:
* A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we’re truly Hybrid!)
* On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
* 30 paid vacation days a year
* Generous pension and insurance benefits
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
* Generous health subsidy benefit
* Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers



 At ComeOn, we have adapted a Hybrid Work model which means that we offer our employees an option to pick their workstation for the day. Want to work from the office a few days a week and some days from home? That’s totally fine with us! ComeOn is known for their inviting and vibrant offices that offer creative areas for collaboration and desk set-ups designed for a Hybrid Work model. When you visit one of our offices you will always be welcomed by a friendly face that will take good care of you. It’s our curiosity that drives our innovative business forward and we work hard in a run together spirit and we always make sure to top it up by having fun! You will not regret picking ComeOn as your next place of work.
 



  





 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assess candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant
 



 for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
 



  





 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
 



  





 LinkedIn
 



 Instagram
 



 Facebook

title: F# utvecklare till Svea Bank
description:
Vi söker nu efter en nyfiken och lösningsfokuserad F# utvecklare som vill vara del av vår unika resa där vi bygger den bästa möjliga företagsbanken. Gillar du att arbeta med lösningar i fokus, driva kvalitativ utveckling och har ett stort intresse för funktionell programmering?
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vi letar efter en erfaren F# utvecklare, men om du är en senior C# utvecklare eller utvecklare inom funktionell programmering med bredd, så tror vi att du också kan vara en match. Hos oss kommer du tillhöra en engagerad grupp av utvecklare som brinner för funktionell programmering och vi letar efter någon med samma mindset. Du kommer tillhöra ett utvecklingsteam med flera olika kompetenser såsom frontend, backend, test, design och produkt. Systemen vi bygger fokuserar mycket på att optimera automatiserade arbetsflöden, och våra användare är både interna och externa.
 



  





 Våra team ansvarar för att bygga och underhålla flera avancerade system inom Banking Services, vilka är byggda i F# på Microsoft SQL server. Vi arbetar med eventdrivna system på ett domändrivet sätt. Teamet har en hög autonomitet och en stor frihet kring hur de väljer att lösa problem. Teamet har även en hög grad av involvering från designfasen hela vägen till produktionssättning.
 



  





**Erfarenheter och kvalifikationer** 



* 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Erfarenhet av arbete med F# (eller annat funktionellt språk såsom Haskell, Scala, ML, Elm eller Erlang) eller ett stort intresse av att utvecklas inom F# tillsammans med en stabil grund inom programmering
* Mycket god kunskap inom .Net, alternativt grundläggande kunskap om du är en erfaren utvecklare med annan bredd
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande, alternativt motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Mycket god kunskap om SQL
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur
* Kunskper i Fable/Elmish eller React
* Svenska & engelska flytande i tal och skrift



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom utveckling och förmågan att skapa enkel, tydlig och hållbar kod även i komplexa miljöer. Vidare är du en engagerad och coachande lagspelare som trivs med att vara en del av en helhet och motiveras av gemensamma framgångar. Du är kommunikativ och van att samarbeta med flera olika interna kontaktytor, samt tycker om att dela med dig av din kunskap och bidra till andras utveckling inom organisationen.
 



 Du har ett stort intresse för backendutveckling och funktionell programmering, men är också nyfiken på affären och det faktiska värde och syfte som applikationerna skapar. Din vana att ta ansvar för att driva utveckling framåt och din goda genomförandeförmåga matchas med ett lösningsorienterat mindset. Du ser möjligheter snarare än hinder och har en god förmåga att självständigt planera och driva ditt arbete framåt – samtidigt som du uppskattar samarbete, dialog och kunskapsutbyte i teamet.
 



  





**Om Svea** 




*Svea är en finansiell koncern med över 2000 anställda och verksamhet i flertalet europeiska länder. Med mer än 40 års erfarenhet är vi stolta över att erbjuda innovativa och hållbara finansiella lösningar till våra kunder. Svea präglas av en familjär företagskultur där varje medarbetare bidrar med sin unika kompetens och engagemang. Vår företagskultur betonar gemenskap, handlingskraft, och balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Välkommen att följa med oss på vår spännande resa!* 




  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi har tyvärr inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar att tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
 



  





 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Rekryterare Sanna Löfgren på
 
 sanna.lofgren@svea.com

title: Agentic AI Developer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Full Stack Agentic AI Solution Developer you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying end-to-end agentic AI systems that are intelligent, autonomous solutions. This role combines AI engineering, software development, and system integration expertise to build scalable, production-ready solutions leveraging LLMs, vector databases, orchestration frameworks, and modern web technologies.
   

  

 You will work closely with data scientists, backend engineers, and product teams to create self-directed AI agents capable of handling complex tasks such as workflow automation, knowledge retrieval, and multi-step reasoning.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* GenAI & Multi-Agent Engineering: Architect and implement multi-agent orchestration frameworks using GenAI models (e.g., Gemini, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral). Develop agent roles, memory systems, and inter-agent communication protocols.Integrate open-source orchestration platforms (LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen) or Google
* Working with Cloud tools (Vertex AI, Agent Builder) and optimize agent workflows for reasoning, planning, and tool use.
* Prompt Engineering: Design and iterate high-quality prompts for agentic tasks. Implement prompt templates, context windows, and RAG pipelines using vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate). Evaluate prompt performance and fine-tune for accuracy, latency, and cost.
* Backend Web Development: Build and maintain backend services and RESTful APIs to support agent orchestration and user interfaces. Develop microservices using Python (FastAPI, Flask) or Node.js, and deploy on GCP (Cloud Run, App Engine, Kubernetes).
* Ensure backend scalability, security, and integration with cloud-native services (BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Firestore).
* Cloud & DevOps: Deploy and monitor GenAI applications on Google Cloud Platform using CI/CD pipelines. Manage infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Cloud Build) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). Implement logging, tracing, and performance monitoring for agent systems.


**Your profile**
* Experience in the programming languages SQL & Python
* Experience with GenAI frameworks (LangChain, LangGraphHugging Face, OpenAI API).
* Solid understanding of LLM orchestration, prompt engineering, and agentic workflows.
* Experience with backend frameworks (FastAPI, Flask, Node.js) and cloud deployment
* Experience with Vertex AI, Agent Builder, Google ADK and Google Cloud Functions.
* Understanding of frontend frameworks (React, Next.js) and backend frameworks (FastAPI, Flask, Node.js) and cloud deployment.
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS Sagemaker, Azure AI, or GCP Vertex AI).


*If you also have familiarity with vector databases, RAG, and LLM evaluation techniques, that’s even better!*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies in line with your ambitions.


**Application**
*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Senior Frontend-focused Fullstack Developer
description:
**Are you a senior Frontend Developer with a passion for web technologies and a love for building smart, robust solutions, and for helping others grow along the way?**
 We are looking for a senior, frontend-focused developer with 8+ years of professional experience to help us develop the market-leading PR platform in the Nordics, reaching thousands of users and customers every day.
   

  

 What is it like to work at Mynewsdesk?
   

  

 At Mynewsdesk, we believe you do your best work when you enjoy what you do. No one excels when given an infinite backlog of boring Jira tickets.
   

  

 We do our very best to make sure you work on what excites you the most, as long as it aligns with our company goals. You will be surrounded by dedicated, experienced developers in an environment where collaboration, knowledge sharing, and learning from each other are highly valued.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who not only wants to write great code, but also enjoys coaching, mentoring, and raising the overall quality of the team through thoughtful discussions and constructive feedback.
   

  

 Our stack
   

  

 Our frontend tech stack includes React, Apollo GraphQL, Styled Components/CSS, and Next.js. On the backend, we mainly use Ruby, with some Node.js, and PostgreSQL as our primary database.
   

  

 While this is a frontend-focused role, we see it as a strong advantage if you are open to working with backend technologies and frameworks, including Ruby and GraphQL, to contribute to full-stack solutions. We are used to teaching Ruby to new developers, so prior experience is not required. We use standard tools for collaboration and development, such as GitHub, Jira, Slack, and G-Suite.
   

  

 What will you do?
   

  

* Develop and maintain frontend solutions using React, Apollo GraphQL, and Styled Components, including feature development and our design system
* Collaborate closely with developers, designers, and product leads in a cross-functional team
* Take an active role in code reviews, technical discussions, and architectural decisions
* Mentor and coach other developers, sharing knowledge and best practices in modern frontend development
* Contribute to backend development when needed, including designing GraphQL schemas and implementing resolvers in Ruby


 Who are you?
   

  

* You are a senior frontend developer with 8+ years of professional experience and a strong background in React
* You enjoy helping others grow and see mentorship, coaching, and code reviews as a natural part of your role
* You value collaboration and communication and understand that great software is built by strong teams, not individuals
* You have an interest in working with backend technologies such as Ruby or Node.js
* You take pride in your work and know how to balance quality with timely delivery
* You thrive in an agile environment and enjoy taking responsibility for technical design, implementation, and maintenance
* You actively participate in discussions, discovery, and planning processes
* You have a passion for product development and enjoy seeing your solutions deployed to production
* You communicate fluently in English and have strong language skills in Swedish or Norwegian


 Practical information
   

  

 We do not offer relocation for this role. Applicants must have permanent right to work in Sweden.
   

  

**Apply now and let’s grow together🚀**
 Questions? Contact VP Engineering:
   

  

 peter.nycander@mynewsdesk.com
   

  

 Mynewsdesk is a true pioneer, providing communicators with a modern digital PR service. With just one click, you can give the right audiences direct access to relevant press releases, blog posts, social media feeds, high-resolution images and graphics, videos, and more – at the right time. Influencers can start following your newsroom, engage with content, and become part of a network of influencers.

title: Business Developer
description:
**Location:** 

 Remote
 




**Start Date:** 

 End of March 2026
 




**Seniority Level:** 

 Mid to Senior
 




**Contract Type:** 

 Freelance Contract
 





**Work hours:** 

 Need to overlap at least 6 hours between 13:00 - 21:00 CET including a mandatory availability of 18:00 - 20:00 CET.
 




  




**About the Role** 

  






 We are looking for a proactive and driven
 
**Business Developer** 

 to help grow Envar Studio’s client base and strengthen long-term partnerships within the gaming industry.
 





 In this role, you will take ownership of identifying new business opportunities, preparing high-quality pitches, and representing Envar externally. You will work closely with production and leadership teams to ensure smooth handovers from sales to delivery, and to maintain excellent client experiences throughout the collaboration.
 





 This role suits someone with a strong sense of ownership, a solid understanding of the game development landscape, and the ability to balance relationship-building with structured, detail-oriented execution.
 




  




**Responsibilities** 

  




* Identify and develop new client opportunities through various outbound channels
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis, as well as prepare tailored game plan proposals
* Build, maintain, and grow strong client relationships by understanding client needs and challenges
* Represent Envar at industry events, studio visits, and client meetings, both virtually and in person
* Prepare project estimates and pitches aligned with Envar’s cost structure and service offerings
* Maintain a clean, accurate, and up-to-date pipeline in the CRM system
* Work closely with production teams to ensure timely, efficient, and well-documented handovers
* Adapt to established workflows while ensuring clear communication across all relevant stakeholders



  




**Qualifications** 

  




* Minimum 2 years of experience working as a Business Developer in the video game industry
* Good understanding of the art production pipeline for video games
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills, with the ability to professionally represent Envar’s brand and values
* Strong research, planning, and organizational skills, with the ability to work independently and maintain a high level of execution
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Willingness to occasionally work off-hours and balance this with flex time
* Willingness and availability to travel internationally for industry events



  




**Bonus Points** 

  




* Experience within the AA and/or AAA game market
* Previous experience attending or representing studios at game industry events
* Professional working proficiency in languages other than English
* A genuine passion for games and the game development industry



  




**Why Join Envar?** 

  






 At Envar, you’ll have real ownership, trust, and the opportunity to shape how the studio grows. You’ll work closely with talented teams, represent the studio on a global stage, and play a key role in building long-term partnerships that lead to great games. If you enjoy autonomy, responsibility, and meaningful impact, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Software Engineer – Reverse Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Visa’s Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce.   We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people.   While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  





 The Opportunity
   

  





 We are looking for talented, curious, and energetic Software Engineers who embrace solving complex challenges on a global scale.  As a Visa Software Engineer, you will be an integral part of a cross-functional development team inventing, designing, building, and testing software products that reach a truly global customer base. While building components of cutting-edge payment technology, you will get to see your efforts shaping the digital future of monetary transactions.
   

  





 The Work itself
   

  




* Design code and systems that touch 40% of the world population while influencing Visa’s internal standards for scalability, security, and reusability
* Collaborate cross-functionally to create design artifacts and develop best-in-class software solutions for multiple Visa technical offerings
* Actively contribute to product quality improvements, value added service technology, and new business flows in diverse agile squads
* Develop robust and scalable products intended for a myriad of customers including end-user merchants, b2b, and business to government solutions
* Leverage innovative technologies to build the next generation of Payment Services, Transaction Platforms, Real-Time Payments, and Buy Now Pay Later Technology
* Opportunities to make a difference on a global or local scale through mentorship and continued learning opportunities



 Specific Requirements
   

  




* Maintain and troubleshoot iOS-based RE connections, primarily in jailbroken environments.
* Use and enhance internal RE toolkit and external tools (e.g., palera1n for jailbreaks, frida for bypassing security, Charles Proxy for traffic analysis).
* Reverse engineer iOS apps using interactive disassemblers (HexRays IDA, Ghidra, Hopper), injector tools (frida.re), and traffic proxies (Charles Proxy, Wireshark).
* Collaborate cross-functionally to document knowledge and improve workflows.
* Proactively detect, diagnose, and resolve disruptions in RE connections, often under time pressure and with limited documentation.
* Contribute to compliance with internal audits and security standards.



 Essential Functions
   

  




* Works alongside others to implement modifications to existing software code that complies with design specifications and meets security best practices.
* Assists with improvements to systems and tools and supports development and implementation of new automation, asking questions as necessary.
* Engages with team members and manager during code/design reviews, participates in on-call rotations and incident responses throughout product development and operations cycles.
* Leverages working knowledge of systems/platforms and telemetry analyses to identify basic issues in code, processes, and designs when they are inconsistent with customer/business objectives.
* Leverage expertise in iOS reverse engineering and telemetry analysis to identify and resolve issues in code, processes, and designs.
* Mentor and support less experienced engineers, contributing to a culture of learning and operational excellence.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  




* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field, OR Bachelor’s degree in a related field and directly related experience.



 Preferred Qualifications
   

  




* Knowledge of and ability to develop back-end (e.g. Python, Java, C++, PHP) code in support of package and product development. This includes the extension of capabilities of packages and products.
* The ability to develop and utilize Application Program Interfaces (APIs), a set of routines, protocols, and tools for building software applications that specify how software components should interact and are used when programming graphical user interface (GUI) components. An API may be for a web-based system, operating system, database system, computer hardware, or software library.
* Knowledge of and the ability to use database software (e.g., applications, web-based applications, information systems) to maintain, modify, and output data.
* Knowledge of systems integration process in which separately produced components or subsystems are combined and problems in their interactions are addressed.
* Knowledge of data structures, which consist of data organization, management, and storage formats that enable efficient access and modifications. This includes a collection of data values, the relationships among them, and the functions or operations that can be applied to the data.



  

  

 The Skills You Bring
   

  




* Energy and Experience: A growth mindset, curiosity, and passion for reverse engineering and security.
* Challenge the Status Quo: Comfort in “hacking” beyond traditional solutions, especially in undocumented or rapidly changing environments.
* Technical Expertise: Proven experience with iOS reverse engineering, jailbroken devices, and tools such as HexRays IDA, Ghidra, Hopper, frida.re, Charles Proxy, and Wireshark.
* Programming: Strong skills in Java, Swift, Objective-C, and experience with AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, and Datadog.
* Builder: Experience building and deploying modern services, with a focus on quality, scalability, and operational resilience.
* Learner: Constant drive to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving technical and regulatory landscapes.
* Partnership: Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Product, Test, DevOps, and Agile/Scrum teams.
* Communication: Strong documentation, mentoring, and communication skills.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Junior Sales Representative
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Proxify is a leading global network of top-tier, vetted remote software, data, and AI professionals, designed to help businesses scale their tech teams with world-class talent, delivering the perfect match within two days on average. Only 1% of applicants, from over 20,000 applications each month, are accepted into the network to ensure unmatched quality. Our service offers the speed, quality, and flexibility that innovative companies demand, with true technical experts to assist at each step enabling you to seamlessly augment your existing team or build a new one without the administrative burden and risk of traditional employment.
 



  





**About the role** 




  





 Are you a true relationship builder with a strong grasp of tech with a wish to develop within sales? This is your chance to invest in your personal development and make a real impact.
 



  





 As a
 **Junior Sales Representative** 
 , you’ll be part of the client teams and perform the sales activities assigned to you.
 



  




* **Account growth & retention** 
 : Take on opportunities to upsell or cross-sell, be a part of contract negotiations, and secure long-term client loyalty by delivering value.
* **Project coordination** 
 : Work closely with Account Managers to meet client needs, keep deadlines, and ensure deliverables align with expectations.
* **Performance monitoring & reporting** 
 : Track account performance, prepare clear reports, and provide actionable recommendations.
* **Matching** 
 : Use your tech know-how to match the right developer to customer needs, collaborating with the account manager and a client engineer for support.



  





**Client Focus:** 
 Global Enterprise Clients ( > 2 000 employees).
 



  





**Why you’ll love this opportunity at Proxify:** 




  





 🌐 Help tech teams close skill gaps and create job opportunities for developers worldwide.
 



 ❤️ Be part of a humble, supportive, and tech-savvy team.
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships.
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth.
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international team of 39 countries, with occasional in-person meetups.
 



  





**Was du mitbringst, um in dieser Rolle erfolgreich zu sein:** 




  




* Ein starkes Verantwortungsbewusstsein mit einer ausgeprägten Hands-on-Mentalität und hohem Qualitätsanspruch.
* Die Fähigkeit, Verantwortung mit Dringlichkeit zu übernehmen, um Effizienz sicherzustellen und gleichzeitig eine hohe Qualität zu wahren.
* Ein gutes Verständnis dafür, wie man Kund:innen optimal unterstützt und sie durch die gesamte Customer Journey begleitet.
* Von Natur aus kontaktfreudig, neugierig und zielorientiert.
* Ein bodenständiger Teamplayer, der sich in einem leistungsorientierten Umfeld wohlfühlt.
* Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau sowie sehr gute Englischkenntnisse



  





**Bonus points** 
 : hands-on experience with technology, such as working as a technical project manager, product manager, developer, or a similar role (ideally within tech or SaaS).
 



  





**Why it may not be your match:** 




  





 ❌ You like every day to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep things agile.
 



 ❌ You lack any exposure to or understanding of tech and its applications.

title: Senior Game Developer - Mob Control
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±2h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Mob Control** 
 .
   

  

 With Mob Control, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Game Developer, passionate about delivering unforgettable player experiences.
   

  

 You will craft highly polished, satisfying, and responsive features that elevate how players
 *feel* 
 the game, from moment-to-moment gameplay to UI/UX and overall flow.
   

  

 You will work closely with Designers, Artists, and other Developers to bring ideas to life with precision and care. You will own features end-to-end, ensuring every interaction feels great to play.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Build and iterate on player-facing features across gameplay, metagame, and UI
* Write robust, maintainable and extensible code, used by millions of players worldwide
* Polish and refine systems with a strong focus on feel, clarity, and delight
* Work hand-in-hand with design and art teams to bring ideas from concept to final implementation
* Maintain smooth performance and high-quality experiences across a wide range of devices
* Contribute to the overall quality bar of the game, ensuring every player touchpoint feels great.


 With this role, you will have a strong impact on the company, contributing daily to key decisions alongside a senior, multidisciplinary team of passionate and talented people.
   

  

 You will refine every detail of gameplay and feedback loops, ensuring every moment feels great to play.
   

  

 If you live for the small details, the perfect animation timing, the satisfying click of a button, the spark of joy when everything just flows, this is your place.
   

  

 Thanks to your creativity, care, and teamwork, together we’ll entertain millions of players with truly unforgettable experiences.
   

  

 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in Unity (or equivalent engine)
* Strong sense of gameplay feel and great attention to detail
* Excellent programming skills, clean coding practices, and a strong ability to contribute to scalable architectures
* Proven track record of shipping high-quality mobile games with strong player experience focus
* Experience with shaders and VFX
* Fluent in English, with great collaboration and communication skills


 Nice-to-have
   

  

* Familiarity with mobile performance optimization
* Background in responsive controls and satisfying interactions


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Business Developer Online
description:
**Är du affärsorienterad, digitalt kunnig och trivs i en dynamisk miljö samtidigt som du vill vara med och bidra till en fossilfri framtid?** 
 Vi söker nu efter vår nästa kommersiella stjärna inom digital försäljning!
   

  

 Som
 **Business Developer Online** 
 hos oss har du en viktig roll där du bidrar till ökad försäljningstillväxt av Vattenfalls elavtal för privatkonsumenter och småföretag genom att driva digitala initiativ och affärsutveckling. Du kommer bland annat att arbeta med att identifiera och utvärdera nya affärsmöjligheter i digitala kanaler. Du kommer att stötta pågående initiativ inom Online Growth, exempelvis konverteringsoptimering och kommersiella partnerskap. Arbete med dataanalys och insikter för att förbättra kundresan och utvärdera försäljningsinitiativ är en viktig del i rollen. Utforska nya försäljningskanaler och kundsegment ingår också. Du bygger upp business case och skapar underlag till olika affärsbeslut.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Några års erfarenhet inom digital försäljning
* Några års erfarenhet från en digitalt driven verksamhet
* God förståelse för digitala affärsmodeller: trafikanskaffning, konverteringsflöden, kundresor samt analys
* Relevant utbildning inom ekonomi, marknadsföring eller liknande område
* Erfarenhet av affärsutveckling eller försäljning är meriterande, från en konsultroll eller linjeroll


 Som person letar vi efter dig som tar stort eget ansvar och har handlingskraft att både identifiera och verkställa initiativ som levererar affärsvärde. Med ett framåtlutat driv ser du möjligheter där andra ser hinder och du har ett beprövat affärsmannaskap. Samtidigt är du kommunikativ och samarbetsvillig. Kommunikationskunskaper på svenska och engelska är ett krav.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
*Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.*
**Placeringsort:** 
 Solna, Stockholm
   

  

**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Cecilia Sandström, cecilia.sandstroem@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Kajsa Loman, kajsa.loman@vattenfall.com.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00. Patrik Andersson (Akademikerna), Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna), Jan Svensson (SEKO) and Simon Salomonsson (Unionen).
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 8 februari 2026.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.
   

  

 På Vattenfall värdesätter vi att vara aktiva, positiva, öppna och säkerhetsmedvetna. Vi söker medarbetare som delar vår vision och kan bidra till att stärka vår företagskultur. Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsvariation. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

*Att arbeta inom Vattenfall innebär att arbeta med samhällsviktig infrastruktur. Därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade och du kan komma att bli krigsplacerad. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. En eventuell krigsplacering sker med stöd i anställningsavtalet och lagen om totalförsvarsplikt.*
**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid.

title: Scrummaster med C++ och QT
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 är ett IT- och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, mjukvaruutveckling, SAP, inköp, elektronik och mekanisk konstruktion. Vi samarbetar med erfarna seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och analytiskt krävande projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och tydliga, mätbara resultat.
   

  

 Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.
   

  

 Ansök gärna redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Vi söker nu en
 **erfaren mjukvarukonsult** 
 till ett spännande uppdrag i Solna där du kombinerar rollen som
 **Embedded Software Developer med Scrum Master** 
 -ansvar. Uppdraget är placerat i en tekniskt avancerad miljö med fokus på utveckling av inbyggda system, och du kommer att arbeta nära ett tvärfunktionellt team i en agil kontext.
   

  

 Närvaro på kontoret i Solna förväntas cirka tre dagar per vecka.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden
   

  

 Utveckling av mjukvara för inbyggda system i Linux-miljö
   

  

 Programmering i C++ och Qt för applikationer med höga krav på stabilitet och prestanda
   

  

 Ansvara för och driva agila ceremonier i rollen som Scrum Master
   

  

 Stödja teamet i agila arbetssätt och kontinuerlig förbättring
   

  

 Samarbete med produktägare, UX-designers, systemarkitekter och testare
   

  

 Bidra till god kodkvalitet genom kodgranskning och bästa praxis
   

  

**Kravprofil**
 Minst 5+ års erfarenhet som mjukvaruutvecklare i Linux-miljö
   

  

 Gedigen erfarenhet av embedded systems-utveckling
   

  

 Stark kompetens inom C++ och Qt
   

  

 Minst 3+ års erfarenhet som Scrum Master samt god förståelse för agila principer och metoder
   

  

 Erfarenhet av versionshantering med Git och GitLab
   

  

 Resultatorienterad och samarbetsinriktad lagspelare
   

  

 God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och/eller engelska
   

  

 Kandidatexamen inom datavetenskap eller motsvarande
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arbete i tvärfunktionella team
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Erfarenhet från Medtech eller liknande reglerad bransch
   

  

**Övrigt**
**Uppdragsstart:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Distansarbete:** 
 Nej
   

  

**Uppdragslängd:** 
 6 månader med möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Område:** 
 Sweden\Stockholms län, \Solna (SOLNA)
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2026-01-27
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV
 **(** 
 vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Senior Patent Engineer
description:
**Are you looking to take part in exciting projects where your skills are constantly challenged and where your personal development is a priority?**
 Valmet’s
 **Pulp, Energy and Circularity** 
 (PEC) business area is at the forefront of delivering advanced technologies and services for the global pulp, bioenergy, and circular economy sectors. We enable our customers to optimize performance, reduce environmental impact, and drive long-term value through innovative, resource-efficient solutions. Join a team where industrial expertise meets strategic sustainability and contributes to transforming the way industries operate.
   

  

 As a
 **S** 
****e** 
 nior Patent Engineer** 
 , your job is to drive and handle the protection of our technology and commercial offerings globally. You will assume responsibility for advising certain business and technology units on Intellectual Property (IP) matters and manage their portfolios in line with the IP strategy. This includes giving recommendations on how to create business value from our IP and how to reduce risks, identifying and evaluating inventions, steering and coordinating external patent agents in drafting and prosecution, and possibly drafting and prosecuting some patent applications yourself. Your work also includes technology follow-ups and investigations of competitors' patents, oppositions and freedom-to-operate analyses.
   

  

 You will work closely with R&D and Product management, but also with Sales and Service to contribute to the development of new technical solutions and products, and to support enforcement of our Intellectual Property.
   

  

 Your preferred location would be
 **Gothenburg** 
 however we are accepting applications from other areas in Sweden, such as Karlstad, Stockholm or Sundsvall.
   

  

**Who Is The Candidate We Are Looking For**
 To succeed in this position, you need to have
   

  

* A relevant University education, preferably a MSc. in chemical or mechanical engineering, or similar
* Years of experience from independently handling patent matters relevant to the job, including patent prosecution and portfolio management. Experience from similar inhouse positions is an advantage.


 Since Valmet is a global company, you need to have good communication skills in English.
   

  

 As a person, we would like you to have an engaging, independent and proactive way of working. At the same time, you are a team player and can collaborate well with other people. You have a keen commercial interest and understand the business implications of IP in different contexts. You are systematic, have good analytical skills and communicate in a clear way.
   

  

**We offer**
 We offer a collaborative and dynamic work environment with meaningful projects that support industrial efficiency. The global presence fosters cultural exchange, professional growth, and a shared commitment to excellence. You will also benefit from competitive compensation, bonus plan, health insurance, flexible work arrangements, continuous learning opportunities and many other wellness and leisure benefits.
