You’ll work primarily in **Figma**, designing user flows, low-fidelity wireframes, prototypes, and design systems that ensure clarity, usability, and consistency. You’ll collaborate closely with our Head of Design, UI Designers, and Development teams to translate complex requirements into structured, user-centred experiences.


This position is **remote-based within the EMEA region** and reports directly to our **Head of Design**.

### **Responsibilities**

* Define and maintain UX structures, user flows, and interaction logic across projects
* Own and evolve **Figma-based UX systems**, components, and libraries
* Design low-fidelity wireframes and clickable prototypes to validate flows and concepts
* Ensure consistency, usability, and scalability across all digital products
* Translate business and technical requirements into clear UX solutions
* Collaborate with UI Designers to ensure smooth handoff from UX structure to visual design
* Work closely with developers to ensure UX intent is accurately implemented
* Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and UX-related workshops
* Continuously identify UX improvements and optimization opportunities

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in a **UX-focused role** (UX Architect, UX Designer, Product UX, or similar)
* **Strong, hands-on expertise in Figma** — this is our primary and only design tool
* Solid experience designing **user flows, wireframes, and interactive prototypes**
* Ability to think in systems, not just screens
* Strong understanding of user-centred design principles and usability best practices
* Familiarity with **Agile / Scrum** workflows and cross-functional collaboration
* Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills
* Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

### **Nice to Have**

* Experience working with **design systems** at scale
* Familiarity with UX documentation and design handoff best practices
* Experience collaborating closely with frontend and backend development teams
* Product or platform experience in complex or data-driven environments
* Ability to challenge assumptions and **think outside the box** when solving UX problems

**Benefits**

* Competitive compensation package
* Fully remote work within EMEA region
* Flexible working hours with a strong focus on outcomes
* Transparent and inclusive culture built on trust and accountability
* A friendly, high-performance digital workspace
* Clear technical guidance and mentorship from senior team members
* Opportunities for growth into senior or leadership roles
* Access to training, development, and mentoring programs

title: Product Designer
description:
**About SCRL**
--------------


SCRL is a mobile-first creative tool that millions of professionals use to create and share content on social media.


From the beginning, we’ve been obsessed with craft. Not as an abstract idea, but in the small, concrete details, how elements align, how interactions snap into place, how motion guides the eye and how the product feels after hours of use.


We’re founder-led and fully self-funded, which lets us move with focus and intent. We ship continuously, work tightly across design and engineering and improve the product by watching how it’s actually used, not by guessing or debating hypotheticals.


We’re a team of 31 working side by side in Stockholm, building one product and holding ourselves to a very high bar. We care deeply about quality, clarity and the kind of polish that makes a tool feel reliable, intentional and worth coming back to.

**The role**
------------


We’re looking for a Product Designer to work hands on with SCRL’s core editor and creative experience. This is a very practical, UI-focused role where you’ll spend most of your time shaping how things look, feel and behave, from layouts and interactions to the small details that define a true sense of quality.


You’ll care deeply about:

* Visual rhythm and balance
* Interaction details, motion, and feedback that make actions feel responsive
* Clarity in complex tools, even as features grow
* The subtle finishing touches that make a product feel reliable and well crafted

**Your day to day work**
------------------------

* Designing flows, interactions and interfaces for SCRL’s editor and creation tools
* Bringing clarity and structure to messy, open-ended problems through thoughtful UI
* Defining states, edge cases and interaction behavior, not just “happy paths”
* Working closely with engineers and product owners to get details right in the final product
* Exploring, iterating and documenting solutions in Figma, Notion and Linear
* Helping evolve our design system as the product grows
* Raising the bar for clarity, consistency and visual quality across the app and company

**Who we think you are**
------------------------

* ~3–4 years experience designing digital products
* You’ve designed mobile consumer apps and care about how they feel to use
* Strong visual design skills and a clear sense of taste
* You notice when something is off and want to fix it
* Solid UX fundamentals and the ability to think in systems, not just screens
* Comfortable working end-to-end in Figma
* You collaborate well with engineers and enjoy sweating the details together
* You have a portfolio that shows care, polish and thoughtful execution

**Nice to have (but not required)**
-----------------------------------

* Experience with creative tools, editors or content creation workflows
* Interest in interaction design and tool-like interfaces
* Familiarity with iOS patterns and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
* Curiosity and a desire to keep improving your craft

**Why SCRL?**
-------------


We care a lot about doing things well and working with people who feel the same.

* Your work will be used by millions of people world wide
* Real ownership and visible impact in a small team
* One product, built with care
* Self-funded, long-term focused, quality-driven team
* Tight collaboration between design and engineering
* In-person work from our Stockholm office but flexible when needed
* Competitive salary, benefits and room to grow


If this sounds like the kind of place where you’d enjoy doing your best work, we’d love to hear from you.

title: UX-designer – Jönköping
description:
Vi söker nu en **Interaktionsdesigner (UX-designer)** till en kund inom **statlig/offentlig verksamhet** med placering i Jönköping.


I rollen som UX-designer kommer du främst att arbeta med design och vidareutveckling av **digitala tjänster och interna verksamhetssystem**. Kunden utvecklar allt från enklare e-tjänster till mer komplexa systemstöd. En stor del av uppdraget innebär att modernisera befintliga system genom ny design och uppdaterad teknik.


I uppdraget ingår bland annat att:

* Tillsammans med kravanalytiker och representanter från verksamheten identifiera och säkerställa behov och krav. Vid behov visualisera komplexa regelverk och kravbilder i workshops och arbetsmöten.
* Samarbeta tätt med UX-skribent, fullstackutvecklare, testare och arkitekter.
* Planera och genomföra användar- och insiktsarbete.
* Ta fram designkoncept och prototyper i **Figma**, som löpande förankras med verksamhet, UX-skribent, kravanalytiker och utvecklingsteam.
* Planera, boka och leda användningstester.
* Granska och kvalitetssäkra utvecklad design genom UI-tester.
* Delta i regelbundna avstämningar tillsammans med övriga UX-designers inom organisationen och bidra med erfarenheter och lärdomar.


Fokus ligger på att skapa **enkla, tillgängliga och begripliga designlösningar** för olika typer av användare, exempelvis externa användare samt interna medarbetare.


Kunden arbetar med ett eget **komponentbibliotek och gemensamma interaktionsmönster**, vilket innebär att du som designer behöver kunna använda och vidareutveckla dessa för att skapa enhetliga och hållbara digitala tjänster.

 **Arbetsform och omfattning**


Uppdraget är på cirka **50 %** och utförs huvudsakligen **på plats i Jönköping**, med möjlighet till **deltidsdistans**. Arbetsspråket är svenska.


Organisationen bedriver en omfattande utvecklingsverksamhet med flera parallella initiativ. Beroende på behov kan även andra uppdrag inom samma organisation bli aktuella över tid.

 **Kompetensnivå**

**Nivå 3**

* Kunskap: Hög kompetens inom aktuell roll
* Erfarenhet: Flerårig erfarenhet av liknande uppdrag (normalt 4–8 år)
* Ledning: Tar ansvar för eget delområde
* Självständighet: Arbetar med stor självständighet och fungerar som förebild för mer juniora konsulter

 **Skallkrav**

* Relevant utbildning inom interaktionsdesign, UX-design, kognitionsvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av att designa digitala tjänster såsom e-tjänster och interna verksamhetssystem.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med **tillgänglighetsanpassad design**.
* Erfarenhet av att planera och genomföra användningstester.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i **Figma**.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig tydligt i tal och skrift på **svenska**.
* Genomförd utbildning som uppfyller kraven för digital tillgänglighet enligt **EN 301 549** innan uppdragsstart.

 **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av UX-design inom statlig eller annan offentlig verksamhet.
* Erfarenhet av UX-research.
* Kunskaper i **HTML och CSS**.

 **Personliga egenskaper**


Vi söker dig som är:

* **Kommunikativ** – kan tydligt förmedla idéer, argumentera och skapa förtroende.
* **Samarbetsorienterad** – prestigelös och lösningsfokuserad med teamets gemensamma mål i fokus.
* **Analytisk** – kan hantera komplex information och se både helhet och långsiktiga samband.

 **Övrigt**


Vid behov kan kunden komma att genomföra referenstagning efter intervju för att verifiera konsultens kompetens och tidigare uppdrag. Leverantören ansvarar för att tillhandahålla relevant referens vid förfrågan.


﻿


Tillträde och ansökan:


Startdatum: 02 feb 2026


Slutdatum: 30 jun 2026


Sista ansökningsdagen: 26 jan 2026


Ort: Jönköping


Urval och intervjuer sker löpande!

  

Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Engineering Manager – SaaS, Lund
description:
Job Title
Engineering Manager – SaaS, Lund
Job Description*Are you passionate about leading full-stack software as a service development and driving both technical and business success? If you thrive on inspiring teams toward a common goal and have a strategic, action-oriented mindset, we have the perfect role for you!*  

Your Future Team  

At Axis, we’re constantly innovating to make the world safer and smarter. From our powerful Linux-based operating system, AXIS OS, to cloud-based applications and services, our software solutions span the entire stack, with our cutting-edge edge devices at the core. Everything we build is rooted in openness, transparency, and cybersecurity.  

As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be leading a full-stack team of 10–20 software engineers, all based in Sweden. The team works in an agile DevOps setup and delivers SaaS solutions. It’s a mix of engineers who are already on the team and new hires that you’ll be responsible for recruiting and onboarding yourself. Your team takes core technologies, everything from networking and connectivity to streaming, storage, AI, and event management and turns them into intuitive, reliable experiences that users really enjoy.  

You’ll be involved in every stage of development, from brainstorming ideas to delivering impactful software solutions. At Axis, you’ll have access to the tools, infrastructure, and support you need to grow—both as a leader and as part of a team making a real difference.  

What will you do?
As a Software Manager, you’ll lead a team developing software components across the entire stack. Your key responsibilities will include:* Leading, inspiring, and growing your team.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions.
* Ensuring your team has the skills and resources to tackle current and future challenges.
* Fostering a culture of trust, openness, and pride in our work.
* Working closely with product managers, UX and stakeholders to align on priorities.
* Handling leadership tasks like performance reviews, salary discussions, recruitment, budgeting, and team development.

  

Who are you?
You’re a technically driven leader with experience managing strategic and technical initiatives. You excel at creating a safe and supportive environment, coaching your team, giving constructive feedback, and fostering collaboration. Taking initiative and driving projects to completion comes naturally to you.
You balance listening with decision-making, creating enthusiasm and engagement within your team. Open-minded, empathetic, and cooperative, you thrive in leadership roles and build strong relationships with colleagues, customers, and external partners.
Required skills and experience:* Proven experience building and leading Agile software development teams delivering Saas Solutions.
* Passion for software development and a solid understanding of software architecture.
* A genuine interest in great user experience.
* A commitment to personal growth as a leader and manager.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish.
* A degree in Computer Science or a related field.

  

Bonus Points For:* Experience with hybrid solutions combining edge technologies and cloud services.

  

What Axis has to offer  

We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle. To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to act?
Are you thrilled about the job description and found a personal match? Send in your application! If you have any questions, get in touch with hiring manager Vladimir Karadzic at +46 46 272 1800. *We review applications continuously so do not wait to send in your application!**This recruitment is handled solely by Axis Communications AB, and we politely but firmly decline all calls from recruitment and consulting companies.*
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-02-13*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: User Interface Designer Internship (Unpaid)
description:
About the job
 



  





 UI/UX Design Internship (Unpaid)
 



  





 Do you come from a specialized Design System or Design Ops course/bootcamp, and are looking to apply what you’ve just learned in a real MVP-building startup environment? We’re looking for someone to help us maintain consistency across our product and support the ongoing development of our Design System.
 



  





 Role Overview
 



 You’ll play a key role in supporting scalable design solutions, identifying inconsistencies, and contributing to the evolution of a robust system. If you’re passionate about systems thinking, documentation, and UI consistency—and ready to grow into a Design Systems specialist—this is the role for you.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Support the development and maintenance of our Design System
* Build and organize components in Figma, following best practices and atomic design principles
* Apply and manage design tokens to ensure consistency across products
* Identify inconsistencies in the product UI and propose system-level improvements
* Assist with design reviews and help enforce system-wide visual standards
* Stay curious and proactive in improving both the system and the documentation process
* Remain open to feedback, iterate based on input, and grow in a fast-paced environment



  





 Please Note
 



 This is an unpaid internship, and our startup is in its early stages. This role is perfect for someone eager to gain real-world experience in a fast-paced, creative environment.
 



  





 Why Join Us?
 


* Real-World Impact: Shape the user experience of innovative web applications.
* Hands-On Learning: Gain practical skills in UI/UX design, prototyping, and user testing.
* Creative Freedom: Contribute ideas and see your designs come to life.
* Portfolio Growth: Build a strong portfolio with real projects to showcase your talent.



  





 If you’re excited about designing seamless digital experiences and want to be part of a growing startup, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 Apply now and help us create products users love!

title: Product Designer
description:
**About SCRL** 




 SCRL is a mobile-first creative tool that millions of professionals use to create and share content on social media.
 



  





 From the beginning, we’ve been obsessed with craft. Not as an abstract idea, but in the small, concrete details, how elements align, how interactions snap into place, how motion guides the eye and how the product feels after hours of use.
 



  





 We’re founder-led and fully self-funded, which lets us move with focus and intent. We ship continuously, work tightly across design and engineering and improve the product by watching how it’s actually used, not by guessing or debating hypotheticals.
 



  





 We’re a team of 31 working side by side in Stockholm, building one product and holding ourselves to a very high bar. We care deeply about quality, clarity and the kind of polish that makes a tool feel reliable, intentional and worth coming back to.
 



  





**The role** 




 We’re looking for a Product Designer to work hands on with SCRL’s core editor and creative experience. This is a very practical, UI-focused role where you’ll spend most of your time shaping how things look, feel and behave, from layouts and interactions to the small details that define a true sense of quality.
 



  





 You’ll care deeply about:
 


* Visual rhythm and balance
* Interaction details, motion, and feedback that make actions feel responsive
* Clarity in complex tools, even as features grow
* The subtle finishing touches that make a product feel reliable and well crafted



  





**Your day to day work** 



* Designing flows, interactions and interfaces for SCRL’s editor and creation tools
* Bringing clarity and structure to messy, open-ended problems through thoughtful UI
* Defining states, edge cases and interaction behavior, not just “happy paths”
* Working closely with engineers and product owners to get details right in the final product
* Exploring, iterating and documenting solutions in Figma, Notion and Linear
* Helping evolve our design system as the product grows
* Raising the bar for clarity, consistency and visual quality across the app and company



  





**Who we think you are** 



* ~3–4 years experience designing digital products
* You’ve designed mobile consumer apps and care about how they feel to use
* Strong visual design skills and a clear sense of taste
* You notice when something is off and want to fix it
* Solid UX fundamentals and the ability to think in systems, not just screens
* Comfortable working end-to-end in Figma
* You collaborate well with engineers and enjoy sweating the details together
* You have a portfolio that shows care, polish and thoughtful execution



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience with creative tools, editors or content creation workflows
* Interest in interaction design and tool-like interfaces
* Familiarity with iOS patterns and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
* Curiosity and a desire to keep improving your craft



  





**Why SCRL?** 




 We care a lot about doing things well and working with people who feel the same.
 



  




* Your work will be used by millions of people world wide
* Real ownership and visible impact in a small team
* One product, built with care
* Self-funded, long-term focused, quality-driven team
* Tight collaboration between design and engineering
* In-person work from our Stockholm office but flexible when needed
* Competitive salary, benefits and room to grow



  





 If this sounds like the kind of place where you’d enjoy doing your best work, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Social Media Content Creator
description:
Scandinavian Markets is looking for a creator. We need a hands-on Social Media & Content Creator who is happier inside After Effects and Photoshop than they are in a spreadsheet.
 



  





 In this hybrid role, you will be the engine behind our social channels. You won’t just plan the posts; you will design, film, edit, and publish them. You are a graphic designer and video editor first, who understands how to build a community through high-quality visuals.
 



  





**The Role (Heavy Production Focus)** 




*Create Visual Assets:* 
 Design high-end static graphics, carousels, and banners for Instagram, LinkedIn, and X (Twitter) using Photoshop/Illustrator.
 



  





*Video Production:* 
 Take ownership of video content from start to finish. You will edit reels, TikToks, and YouTube content (interviews, market updates, explainers) using Premiere Pro or After Effects.
 



  





*Social Media Management:* 
 You own the "Publish" button. You will schedule content, write captions, manage the calendar, and engage with our community daily.
 



  





*Ad Creatives:* 
 Produce high-converting visual assets for our paid advertising campaigns.
 



  





  





**Who You Are** 




*A Designer/Editor First:* 
 You have an extensive portfolio showing strong graphic design and video editing skills. (Please attach a portfolio link to apply).
 



  





*Tool Expert:* 
 You have deep proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator) and Figma.
 



  





*Social Native:* 
 You know the difference between a LinkedIn aesthetic and a TikTok trend. You know how to format video and graphics for every specific platform.
 



  





*Independent:* 
 You can take a rough idea ("We need a post about the EUR/USD drop") and turn it into a polished graphic or video without hand-holding.
 



  





 Language: Fluent English (Written and Spoken).

title: Senior UX/Webbdesigner
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, tal och skrift
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att driva webbutvecklingsprojekt där målgruppernas behov står i centrum. Minst 1 projekt genomfört under senaste året.
* Erfarenhet av UX- och designarbete för större publika webbplatser eller intranät för minst 2 olika verksamheter inom offentlig sektor, helst myndigheter, under de senaste 5 åren.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling och testning av informationsstrukturer för större publika webbplatser eller intranät för minst 2 olika verksamheter inom offentlig sektor de senaste 5 åren.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram specifikationer för frontend- och SiteVisionutvecklare i t.ex. Figma eller motsvarande verktyg.


**Meriterande**
* Arbetat på statlig svensk myndighet, minst ett uppdrag senaste 5 åren.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 28-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Product Manager
description:
Over the past eight years we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the financial health of our users - one credit at the time.
   

  

 So far, we’ve helped millions of users by refinancing expensive consumer loans. But we aim higher; new markets, new products and new ways of improving financial lives in an innovative way. As a Product Manager you will be responsible for our core offering joining a diverse scaleup environment with co-workers who are motivated, adaptable and committed to creating fantastic (we mean amazing) products.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We believe that everyone should get the interest rate they deserve, meaning that assisting our users with debt management will always be at the core of what we do. You’ll play a key role in shaping our core product (refinancing) while helping to explore and build new fintech solutions that people truly need. Together with a team of engineers, designers and other specialists, you’ll drive projects forward with focus, speed and a clear sense of ownership.
   

  

**Your Work Will Cover Things Like**
* Turning user needs into product opportunities and features.
* Supporting strategy by connecting product outcomes to business goals.
* Using data and insights to make smart decisions and run experiments.
* Coordinating with your team to keep roadmaps realistic, transparent and on track.
* Communicating progress and learnings across the company.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who can make complex things simple, and who enjoys working hands-on in a fast-moving environment. You don’t need to have led large product organizations – what matters is that you’ve worked closely with engineers and designers and know how to bring an idea from concept to launch.
   

  

**We Believe You’ll Bring**
* Around 3+ years of experience in product management (or equivalent).
* Experience in building and improving digital products (web and/or app).
* Knowledge of product methodologies, user research and roadmapping.
* A strong sense of urgency and the ability to prioritize what really matters.
* A curious, commercial mindset and interest in what drives customer engagement.


 Fintech experience is a plus but not a must – we’ll help you get up to speed. What counts most is your drive to learn, execute and grow with us.
   

  

 In short we are looking for a pragmatic product generalist with a mix of business development and doer mentality. If you are still reading this we hope that sounds like a good fit? So let's get to the good stuff…
   

  

**We offer you**
 The chance to be part of something truly amazing. We aspire for a level of ambition that matches the scale of our mission. If you're ready to be a part of this transformation we want to hear from you. If you have high grit, an unwavering sense of urgency, and an unyielding commitment to excellence, we want you to be the driving force behind reshaping the financial world. This isn't just a job; it's a mission.
   

  

 We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues. At Anyfin, we hire great people and create the conditions for them to have real autonomy and impact, especially in product management. While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time.
   

  

 For now begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

*PS Please note that we are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role.*
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Artist / Web Designer
description:
**Artist / Web Designer – AI-fashion Startup, Stockholm** 

  






 We’re a stealth startup building an AI-powered consumer platform that rethinks how people discover, try, and shop fashion online.
 




  






 By combining computer vision, personalization, and thoughtful design, we’re creating a product that helps users make smarter, more confident, and more sustainable choices — and drastically reduces friction and returns in e-commerce.
 




  






 We’re now looking for a designer who can start as soon as possible to work side-by-side with our engineer and founding team to shape the product from the ground up.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Set and own the visual and product design direction of the platform
* Design a consumer-facing app with strong emphasis on usability, aesthetics, and trust
* Work closely with our senior engineer to turn ideas into polished, shippable features
* Translate complex AI-driven functionality into simple, intuitive user experiences
* Help define and evolve our design system as the product scales



  




**Who you are** 
* You have retail and/or fashion experience (e-commerce, DTC, marketplaces, or similar)
* You’re confident setting a visual direction and making opinionated design decisions
* You’ve worked on B2C products or app development before (bonus if mobile-first)
* You’re hands-on, pragmatic, and comfortable in an early-stage environment
* You enjoy collaborating closely with engineers and founders



  





**Why join us:** 



* Work on a
 
**cutting-edge shopping experience** 

 that blends fashion and technology.
* Collaborate with a small, passionate team building a product that delights users.
* Shape the visual language and user experience of a complex, high-impact app.
* A
 
**great central office right at Östermalmstorg** 

 — surrounded by cafés, lunch spots, and excellent transport.



  






 If you’re a designer who loves
 
**solving visual and UX challenges** 

 , and wants to help shape the future of online shopping, we want to hear from you.
 




**Apply now** 

 with your portfolio and a short note about why this role excites you!
 




  




**Practical details** 
* 📍
 
**Location:** 

 Humlegårdsgatan 4, Stockholm
* 🏢
 **Setup:** 

 Hybrid — office-first with flexibility to work from home
* ⏱
 **Start:** 

 As soon as possible
* 🚀
 **Stage:** 

 Early, fast-moving, and highly impactful



  




**Compensation** 
* Market-level salary, based on experience
* Equity / option program for the right candidate — we want you to build and own this with us

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
We are looking for a Digital Content Specialist to join our e‑commerce and digital experience team. This role is well suited for someone early in their career who is detail‑oriented, curious about digital systems, and excited to learn how content is managed, automated, and published at scale across global markets.
 




  





**About POC** 




 Born and based in Stockholm, Sweden, we are a safety and performance pioneer on a global mission: protect lives and reduce the consequences of accidents for athletes and anyone inspired to be one. At the core of everything we believe and do lies data, research, and rigorous testing. Whether on the mountains, trails, or winding roads, a ride with POC is a ride protected by science.
 



  





**The Job** 




 As Digital Content Specialist, you will support the day‑to‑day execution of digital content across POC’s websites and platforms in EU, NA, and APAC. Working closely with the Digital Content & Site Manager and senior team members, you will help ensure content is published accurately, follows established processes, and supports and develop efficient content workflows.
 



  





 This is a hands‑on, entry‑level role that offers strong learning opportunities within CMS operations, content and workflow automation, and e‑commerce publishing.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* *Content Operations & Automation Support:* 
 Assist with maintaining and developing automations and templates, reusable components, and structured content within the CMS. Follow established publishing workflows and support automation‑enabled processes that reduce manual work.



  




* *Content Publishing & CMS Support:* 
 Publish and update content across POC.com and related digital platforms using CMS and e‑commerce tools. Ensure content is correctly structured, formatted, and aligned with brand guidelines. Support updates to product pages, campaigns, landing pages, and editorial content.



  




* Quality Assurance: Perform content checks before and after publishing to ensure accuracy and consistency. Help identify outdated or incorrect content and support clean‑up activities. Support adherence to content standards and publishing best practices.



  




* Performance & Optimization Support: Assist in monitoring content performance using reporting tools and dashboards. Implement simple updates based on SEO, UX, or performance feedback from the team.



  




* Collaboration & Team Support: Work closely with marketing, e‑commerce, and customer service teams to support launches and campaigns. Provide operational support for seasonal releases, product launches, and regional rollouts.



  





**To be successful in this role, you are likely to have:** 



* A bachelor’s degree in marketing, Communications, Digital Media, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 1–2 years of experience in digital content, publishing, e‑commerce, or a related field
* Background in development, scripting, or automation (academic, professional, or personal projects) is a strong plus.
* Strong attention to detail and a quality‑focused mindset.
* Organized and comfortable working with repeatable processes.
* Curiosity about how systems connect (CMS, PIM, DAM, marketing platforms).
* Basic understanding of SEO, analytics, or UX principles (training provided).
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines with guidance.
* Clear communicator and collaborative team member



  





**Why you should join POC** 




 At POC, you will gain hands‑on experience in a global e‑commerce environment and learn how high‑quality content is managed and published at scale. You will work closely with experienced colleagues who support learning, collaboration, and continuous improvement. The impact of your work will be tangible, moving fast from idea to execution to results. We are a collaborative, passionate team, where digital marketing needs to be closely connected to the entire business. You will work alongside skilled colleagues who are just as eager to share knowledge as they are to push boundaries.
 



  





 While we take our work seriously, we believe in balance. Whether it's lunch rides, outdoor training sessions, or product testing, we embrace an active lifestyle. Plus, with a generous health allowance, insurance, and discounts on our award-winning products, you will experience POC’s mission firsthand - protecting lives and enabling performance.
 



  





**What now?** 





 If you feel you are a great fit for this role, send your CV and cover letter to application@poc.com. We will review applications on an ongoing basis, although fully close the application window on 1st of March.

title: Senior Product Designer, Visa Open Banking (Fixed-Term Contract)
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments technology, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories, dedicated to uplifting everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 At Visa, you'll have the opportunity to create impact at scale — tackling meaningful challenges, growing your skills and seeing your contributions impact lives around the world. Join Visa and do work that matters — to you, to your community, and to the world.
   

  





 Progress starts with you.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink was founded in 2012, with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. Tink has built Europe’s most robust Open Banking Platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of financial data. Tink became part of Visa in 2022. Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
   

  





 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Product Designer to join the Visa Open Banking team.
   

  





 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in creating best-in-class user interfaces and experiences, ensuring that users enjoy a seamless and engaging journey throughout the entire product flow. This role demands a keen eye for detail, creativity, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles to consistently deliver exceptional and intuitive user experiences.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Deliver outstanding user experiences to customers through initial designs and iterative updates.
* Design from concept to implementation, considering usability, accessibility, localization, scalability, and — where relevant — crafting clear, concise interface copy that’s in line with UX writing best practices.
* Conduct user research studies to gather qualitative and quantitative data (usability testing, user interviews, A/B testing, etc) to understand customer needs, validate design decisions, and refine user experience.
* Collaborate effectively with diverse teams, ensuring smooth communication and high-quality design execution.
* Ensure all deliverables align with requirements and the established design system.
* Contribute to Visa’s Global Open Banking Platform design system in partnership with designers and developers ensuring it meets scalability, efficiency, and brand alignment requirements.
* Engage in constructive design critique with designers and cross-disciplinary partners.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager. ​
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* Experience in product design for mobile and web platforms, with a portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design work.
* Proven experience collaborating with cross-functional teams
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Ability to clearly present and explain design decisions to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong prototyping skills with a focus on clear and effective visual communication.
* Experience or strong interest in UX Writing and content strategy, with the ability to create clear, concise, and user-focused interface copy.
* Excellent command of visual design, UI patterns, and user-centered design principles.
* Solid experience in user research and usability testing.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in industry-standard design tools, particularly Figma.
* Experience in the payments or financial services industry is a plus.
* Advanced proficiency in English.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human–Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, User Experience, or a related field.
* This is a temporary position for 15 months, with no extension, starting from April 2026 to July 2027.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Internal Communication Specialist
description:
*At Aceve, we empower the builders of society and transform the construction and skilled trades industry—one of the least digitalized sectors in Europe. As a united SaaS powerhouse, we bring together leading products into a single pioneering platform dedicated to making a difference.
   

  

 With over 900 passionate employees and more than €100 million in revenue, we blend tradition and innovation to reshape our industry’s future. Our cloud-based, AI-driven software solutions deliver actionable insights and drive improvements for construction companies and skilled tradespeople, enhancing project management, installations, maintenance, and services.
   

  

 On our ambitious growth journey, we are committed to winning together and accelerating digital transformation. With Aceve’s tools, our customers can boost their performance, productivity, and profitability, ensuring they thrive in a rapidly changing landscape.
   

  

 Join us in revolutionizing the industry and building a brighter future together!*
 If you are comfortable using digital tools, platforms, and AI to help turn strategy and culture into clear, engaging internal communications, this role as
 **Internal Communications Specialist** 
 could be a great fit for you!
   

  

 Aceve is growing rapidly. Internal communication is critical to keeping employees informed, engaged, and connected across our European markets.
   

  

 This role will be based in our
 **Stockholm headquarters** 
 and report into our Head of Communications. We value teamwork, openness, and diverse perspectives. If this resonates with you, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 The Internal Communications Specialist plays a key role in enabling clear, consistent, and scalable internal communication across Aceve. You will be responsible for the day-to-day production, optimisation, and continuous improvement of our internal communication channels and content.
   

  

 You will help turn strategy, leadership messaging, and business priorities into high-quality, well-structured internal communications that land effectively across the organisation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Own and develop Aceve’s intranet (SharePoint), including content structure, publishing standards, and usability.
* Create and publish engaging internal communications across channels such as SharePoint, Slack, and email.
* Bring Aceve’s culture, values and strategy to life through clear, engaging internal communications and storytelling.
* Translate business and technical updates into concise, employee-friendly content in collaboration with key stakeholders.
* Use AI tools and communication technology to support efficient, scalable content creation and channel management.
* Support leadership and coordinate company-wide communications, including monthly All-Hands and executive updates.
* Track engagement and continuously improve internal communications content and channels.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with fluency in English.
* Experience with, or strong interest in learning, SharePoint or similar intranet platforms.
* Tech-forward mindset, with curiosity about using AI and digital tools to improve communication delivery.
* Skilled at creating clear, visually engaging presentations. Basic image/video editing a plus.
* Well organised and comfortable managing multiple pieces of content at once.
* Confident working with a range of stakeholders across the organisation and building relationships.
* Experience in internal or digital communications is an advantage, but not essential.
* University degree in Communications, Marketing or a relevant field desirable.
* Minimum 3 years experience.


**Why Aceve?**
* Real opportunity to shape how information flows and culture is communicated across the company.
* Opportunities for development and learning within a highly-motivated team.
* Make a direct impact on engagement, alignment, and connection across a 900+ employee organisation.
* Be part of an international team with colleagues across Europe.


**Not ticking every box?** 
 No worries! We value potential and drive, so apply anyway or connect with us- you might be just what we're looking for in our growing organisation! Join Aceve and take your expertise to the next level, together we are redefining what’s possible in craft and construction solutions!
   

  

*Aceve is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our selection process is conducted continuously and without discrimination, ensuring an equal opportunity for all candidates.*
 Aceve is in business to back the builders of society. With over 900 employees, 100 million € in revenue and extensive experience in the field, we combine tradition and tech to provide a pioneering platform that helps our customers to achieve more.

title: Software Engineering Intern - iOS Mobile
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 At PayPal, we're reinventing how the world pays and gets paid. As the world's leading payments company, we connect people to shop, send money, and transact securely using today's technology. Join our vibrant community where innovation, collaboration, inclusion, and wellness drive everything we do. Ready to help us change the world? As an iOS Software Engineering Intern working in POS App Experience team, you will have the opportunity to work on our Point-of-Sale App, to deliver a product that helps our merchants run their business. You will work next to, and learn from, senior Software Engineers that are passionate about writing software that is running in user’s hands, allowing users to take care of business and get paid every day.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and develop iOS solutions.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices and coding standards.
* Assist in the testing and debugging of mobile applications to ensure high-quality and performance.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Familiarity with either Swift/Objective-C (iOS).
* Good understanding of mobile UI/UX design principles.
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs and JSON.
* Experience in multi-threaded, asynchronous code
* Experience with iOS UI frameworks UIKit/SwiftUI
* Good understanding of databases and persistence in mobile apps. Preferably familiar with CoreData and SQLite


**Internship Program Information and Requirements:**
* This is a Summer 2026 Internship program. Spring and Fall 2026 internships are not available.

 : Stokholm, Sweden
   

  

**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
**Fluent English required for the role**

 13th April 2026

 6 months

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
