 Responsibility: You will be given responsibility for leading the technical transformation, overseeing the end-to-end planning, execution, and delivery of technical projects, and coordinating cross-functional teams.
   

  

*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of driving technical transformation and delivering innovative solutions. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with developers, engineers, designers, and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead end-to-end planning, execution, and delivery of technical projects while managing timelines, scope, budgets, and risk mitigation.
* Coordinate cross-functional teams of developers, engineers, designers, and business stakeholders, translating business requirements into clear technical solutions.
* Track progress using Agile, Scrum, or hybrid methodologies and communicate updates, blockers, and milestones to all stakeholders.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
**This Is What We Imagine You Bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual, passionate about spearheading technical transformations and delivering cutting-edge solutions. You are proactive, pragmatic, and excel at building relationships and connections. As a cooperative, result-oriented problem solver with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, you thrive in dynamic environments and are committed to making a significant impact.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* 10+ years managing technical projects with strong technical skills and experience working closely with developers and engineers.
* Full professional proficiency in English, with Swedish language skills considered a plus.
* Solid understanding of project management tools (Jira, Trello, MS Planner) and ability to handle multiple projects and priorities in fast-paced environments.
* Certifications such as PMP, Prince2, or Certified Scrum Master (CSM) are a plus.
* Consultancy background is a plus


**What can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Filippa.
* First interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik.
* Cognitive & Personality Assessment test.
* Second interview with colleagues.
* Final in-person interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik and Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström.
* Professional References.


***Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support.***
**Read More About How To Become a Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Filippa Olivecrona via e-mail: filippa.olivecrona@dustin.com
 **.**

title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Knowledge graph consultant, you will help our clients make better data-driven decisions by modeling and building robust data flows, creating an efficient data transporter, and building data architecture for Machine Learning solutions and BI solutions. You will also work with the development of computer science solutions stars on graph technology.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Assisting our clients in their work, as they exploit the capabilities of the W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases and ontology modelling tools, or tech stack like Neo4j, Cypher or Labeled Property Graph implementations.
* Combining knowledge graphs with Natural Language Processing – a perfect opportunity for someone with a background as linguist combined with a great interest in knowledge graphs.
* Working with a variation of clients located across Northern Europe. In a hybrid working model, you might be asked to travel while on other occasions you will be working remotely.
* Bringing success in the role, by thriving in an international environment, where you generously share your domain knowledge within Graph technology.


**Your profile**
* You have worked in the public or private sector, where you have used your domain experience in knowledge graph technologies. You enjoy solving complex modeling problems
* Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts
* ETL processes with various graph databases and experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages
* Information and Data Management
* Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python, Java or .Net)
* Semantic technologies: Utilize (W3C) Standards of the Semantic Stack. Knowledge regarding several databases (or excellent on at least one) and modelling knowledge with ontologies using various tools.
* Skills for LPG: Knowledge regarding several databases or excellent on at least one.
* You live in Stockholm Greater area of Sweden.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We work closely with Neo4J on both a local and European level.


**Application**
 Welcome to apply!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Solution Sales Specialist
description:
*Would you like to become a Solution sales specialist – a lighthouse within complex and secure network solutions?*
**About Your Role and The Team**
 We are looking for a Solution Sales Specialist with a strong commercial mindset to support and drive sales within complex network solutions and cybersecurity, in collaboration with the key account managers.
   

  

 Inviting you to be a part of an international organization, with business within the Nordics, Finland, and Germany and part of a newly established Pan-Nordic team, within our B2B business unit, GlobalConnect is investing in a strengthened network and security position to enable further growth in our portfolio of connectivity products, as a managed service provider.
   

  

 GlobalConnect is owned by EQT where we continuously deliver on high growth ambitions, acting as a challenger and acting as a frontrunner within being a managed service provider. Furthermore, we offer a dynamic work environment in a Pan-Nordic matrix organization.
   

  

 In this role, you will work closely with our sales teams to enhance their ability to sell complex network solutions with starting point in SD-WAN and Managed LAN and Wi-Fi, combined with security products and services. Furthermore, you will play a key role in shaping our cybersecurity sales strategy and be a valued and important stakeholder in our product development.
   

  

**Here are some examples of key responsibilities during a typical day:**
* Act as a trusted advisor for the sales team, providing expertise within network solutions and ensure the sales team can confidently pitch GlobalConnects network and security products.
* Creating pipeline and maturing customer leads by being highly frequent participating in customer meetings where you will be a driving force and act as technical and commercial lighthouse in customer meetings
* Develop and conceptualize GlobalConnects way of selling cybersecurity and complex network solutions as a service.
* Support the creation of customer proposals, presentations, and high-level solution designs in collaboration with pre-sales teams.
* Engage with customers to understand their security challenges and business needs, helping to tailor the right solutions – and how to tailor the message.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and emerging security technologies to provide strategic guidance.


**Who We Are Looking For**
 The ideal candidate for this role has commercial firepower and deep product knowledge within LAN, WAN, Wi-Fi, DDOS, Firewall, SOC and NAC – and can navigate within a multi-vendor setup.
   

  

 With flair and comfort throughout the sales process, you drive meetings with a communication range, going from being a storytelling ‘network-evangelist’ to answering technical security questions specific to GlobalConnect network products.
   

  

 You use your knowledge within large account solutions to support sales by enabling them with expert guidance, driving customer meetings and support in complex sales situations.
   

  

 You excel at translating technical customer needs into clear, compelling messages that resonate with customers – from C-level to network managers. As a collaborative team player, you take pride in coaching and developing sales teams, ensuring they have the confidence and knowledge to position GlobalConnect’s solutions effectively.
   

  

 Building strong relationships comes naturally to you, both within the organization and with external customers. Your strategic mindset allows them to position our connectivity solutions within a broader IT infrastructure perspective, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs.
   

  

 You might have a background from a large vendor or a Service Integrator, but other backgrounds are highly relevant as well.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
* Proven industry experience within sales, pre-sales, or solution consulting.
* Structured mind, making sure to plan for sufficient activity levels and being capable of prioritizing sales effort to be efficient.
* Open minded to enter a Managed Service Provider with multi-vendor setup (e.g., Versa, Aruba, Cisco, Fortinet, etc.) and ideally experience with these.
* Experience working with sales teams and a desire to enhance their network and cybersecurity knowledge and capabilities.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills in English and ideally one or more of the Scandinavian languages.


 If you find it compelling to serve as trusted advisors to customers and internal sales teams, we offer a key role in shaping the future of GlobalConnects sales approach where you will be the one bridging technical solutions with business value.
   

  

**No need for a personal letter** 
 – just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile!
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Konsult: Enterprise- och Applikationsarkitet 50 %
description:
**Vi söker för kunds räkning en erfaren Enterprise- och applikationsarkitekt i Stockholm med fokus på helhet och systemsamband.**
 I detta uppdrag kliver du in i en central arkitektroll där du arbetar på övergripande nivå med att förstå, analysera och vidareutveckla ett omfattande applikations- och systemlandskap. Fokus ligger på helhet, struktur och framdrift snarare än operativ utveckling. Uppdraget passar dig som är generalist, trygg på enterprise-nivå och van att driva arkitekturfrågor framåt i samverkan med både verksamhet och IT. Uppdraget startar snarast och pågår initialt i tre månader med möjlighet till förlängning. Omfattningen är 50 %.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Ett strategiskt arkitektuppdrag med tydligt mandat
* Möjlighet att påverka långsiktiga arkitekturella vägval
* Arbete i en komplex och samhällsnära verksamhet
* Samarbete med seniora intressenter inom både IT och verksamhet
* Hybridarbete med hög grad av flexibilitet


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Analyserar och dokumenterar applikations- och systemsamband på enterprise-nivå
* Utvärderar befintliga applikationer, beroenden och arkitekturprinciper
* Tar fram beslutsunderlag, målarkitekturer och rekommendationer
* Säkerställer helhetsperspektiv mellan verksamhet, system och teknik
* Driver arkitekturfrågor framåt i forum och dialoger
* Samverkar med interna team och externa leverantörer i arkitekturfrågor


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du arbetar nära verksamhet, IT-ledning och andra arkitekter i ett uppdrag där arkitektur används som verktyg för styrning och utveckling. Uppdraget genomförs i en miljö med outsourcad IT och flera parallella system och leverantörer. Placering i Stockholmsområdet med möjlighet till distansarbete.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
* Flera års erfarenhet av arkitektroller inom IT, exempelvis enterprise-, applikations- eller verksamhetsarkitektur
* Dokumenterad förmåga att förstå, analysera och beskriva komplexa systemsamband på övergripande nivå
* Erfarenhet av att utvärdera applikationslandskap, beroenden och arkitekturella konsekvenser
* Vana att arbeta strategiskt, skapa struktur och driva arkitekturfrågor framåt
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga samt stor vana att samverka med och hantera olika intressenter


**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
 Hos Saab blir du en del av ett nyskapande team som utvecklar och driftar en modern, affärskritisk plattform för att framtidssäkra vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Site Reliability Engineer inom Group-IT arbetar du nära både utvecklings- och plattformsteam i ett tekniskt initiativ där du har stort utrymme att påverka hur lösningar byggs, automatiseras och förbättras. Rollen kombinerar utveckling, drift och säkerhet, med fokus på stabilitet, prestanda och smart automation.
   

  

 Vi arbetar främst remote med virtuella samarbetsverktyg och parprogrammering, och ses fysiskt 2–3 sammanhängande dagar per kvartal. Du har även möjlighet att arbeta från en Saab-hub på någon av våra orter runt om i landet, antingen i Stockholm, Linköping, Malmö eller Göteborg.
   

  

**Det här kommer du att göra**
* Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet genom monitoring, observability och proaktiv felsökning
* Automatisera infrastruktur och deployments med moderna verktyg och arbetssätt
* Arbeta med incidenthantering, kapacitetsplanering och kontinuerliga förbättringar
* Vara med och forma säkra, skalbara lösningar i linje med DevSecOps


 Här får du arbeta i ett team som värdesätter kreativitet, tekniskt djup och samarbete och där du får vara med och bygga lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du har några års erfarenhet (cirka 3+ år) av plattforms-, cloud- eller DevOps-nära arbete och ett starkt intresse för tillförlitliga system. Du är nyfiken, självgående och trivs i miljöer där det finns frihet att tänka nytt och ta ansvar.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av cloud- och plattformsteknik, inklusive virtualisering, containerisering och orkestrering, gärna i privata molnmiljöer
* Vana av automation och scripting, exempelvis Python, Bash, Terraform eller Ansible
* Erfarenhet av monitoring- och larmverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana eller liknande
* Stark förmåga att felsöka och lösa komplexa tekniska problem


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerorkestrering
* God förståelse för DevOps- och DevSecOps-principer
* Bidrag till open source-projekt


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.

title: Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure
description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines.
   

  

 We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
   

  

 We have a number of openings ranging anywhere from junior to senior level. We will help you identify a suitable position depending on your experience and interests. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.
   

  

 Location: This role can be filled in European, Middle East and African time zones.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 The data platform team is responsible for the automation of data platform operations. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of features of data platforms, not analysing the data in them.
   

  

* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
* Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly
* Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python
* Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems
* Have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
 You might also bring a subset of experience from the following, which will determine the exact role and level we consider you for:
   

  

* Experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, OpenSearch, Kafka, Yugabyte, Trino, Superset, Atlas, Ranger, and Redis
* Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
* Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack
* Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Banking Data Consultant
description:
There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that is why we love it here! This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career at
 **Accenture Banking Technology Unit** 
 . Working in highly collaborative cross-border teams for world-leading clients, we will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity.
   

  

 Whatever you are passionate about, make the most of it in a career with Accenture. Whether you are a strategic thinker, a digital innovator, a tech wizard, or a business problem solver, you will find an exciting career path on the cutting edge. We would love to get to know your unique blend of talents and help you explore and grow them further.
   

  

 Accenture Banking Technology Unit is part of the Accenture’s global capability network and we serve several clients in Nordics and globally. Banking Technology is in the intersection of business and technology, and we have pure techies and more business oriented people in the team. You’ll get access to Accenture’s vast knowledge base and experienced collegues to help you to grow to next level on your professional career.
   

  

 We are now looking for
 **Banking Data Consultants of all levels.** 
 As a Banking Technology Consultant, you will be part of teams or leading teams in our client engagements. Your main goal is to help our clients to succeed in their initiatives. Your detailed work description and responsibilities will be determined by your engagement.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
- Ensure technical transformation is aligned with business goals and processes

- Banking data expert in client engagements

- Problem and issue solving, analysis and functional expertise

**Professional Requirements:**
- Bachelor’s or Master's degree from a technical or business school

- Ideally you would have at least 3 years of experience working in banking doing data related job

- Strong business acumen & technical knowledge on the banking data models and sources. We expect a strong understanding of data from a business perspective, beyond seeing data as just technical attributes.

- We appreciate experience on the legacy data warehousing, data lake or modern cloud solutions. Databricks experience is seen as benefit.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

- High drive, entrepreneurial attitude and good interpersonal skills

- Excellent verbal and written communications skills in Swedish and English

- Resident in Sweden

**What Is In It For You**
- We believe in bringing the best to our clients through continuous learning & improvement – from basic skills to industry-specific content

- Mentoring and continuous evaluation that ensure your career continues to progress

- We offer a performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities

- Flexible work arrangements for maintaining work-life balance

- Extensive wellbeing program, MyHealth that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy and ability to work in a sustainable way

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks

- International and cross-border expert teams guiding you in client engagements

**Interested?** 
 Make your move – apply online and attach your CV and letter of application in English. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Lead engineer Power Grid
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.
   

  

 We are now looking for a consultant for a
 **Lead Engineering** 
 role for completing engineering-based power grid projects for a major customer in the energy sector.
   

  

**Assignment**
* Develops, communicates, and executes operational plans for engineering based projects.
* Prepares designs, project controls, specifications, schedules, and cost estimates.
* Manages activities related to production, transportation, installation, testing, and commissioning of new infrastructure, facilities, or equipment.
* Monitors project progress and performance, addressing issues proactively to reduce delays.
* Identifies, secures, and organizes the resources needed to complete the project.
* May create engineering standards, detailed work specifications, project schedules, budgets, and forecasts.
* Supports decisions on selecting materials, equipment, project team members, and external contractors.
* Applies advanced expertise gained through higher-level education and significant work experience.
* Manages projects or processes with a high degree of independence and minimal supervision.
* Provides coaching, guidance, and review of work performed by junior professionals.
* Tackles challenging and occasionally complex problems requiring specialized judgment.


**Candidate profile**
* Well documented (10+ years) experience in relevant Engineering field
* On a national level unique competence relevant to TCO qualifications and requirements for the assignment.
* Other factors which can qualify is a post-graduate degree (Doctor degree) in a relevant area or other documented credentials.
* Tasks and qualifications required extended beyond Senior and Principal Engineer.


**Övrigt**
 Swedish is mandatory
   

  

 Remote possible but needs to be at least in the office 3 day a week and needs to travel to sites of both customer in Sweden and suppliers abroad.
   

  

**Uppdragsstart:** 
 2026-02-27
   

  

**Distansarbete:** 
 Nej
   

  

**Uppdragslängd:** 
 6 MO
   

  

**Område:** 
 Sweden\Västerås (VÄSTERÅS)
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 2026-01-28
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.
   

  

**Offer continuously:** 
 Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Produktspecialist
description:
**Var med och forma framtidens IT‑arbetsplats för drygt 2000 medarbetare!**
**Är du en person som brinner för att skapa en smidig, säker och modern digital arbetsplats?**
 Hos oss får du möjligheten att påverka hur tusentals kollegor arbetar – varje dag.
   

  

**Gillar du att lösa problem på djupet och förbättra användarupplevelser?**
 Du blir den som säkerställer att vår IT‑arbetsplats fungerar felfritt, utvecklas kontinuerligt och gör vardagen enklare för hela HSB.
   

  

**Trivs du i Microsoft‑miljöer och vill jobba med modern teknik?**
 Här får du arbeta i en modern, molnbaserad IT‑miljö, där innovation, säkerhet och smarta lösningar är centrala delar av vardagen.
   

  

**Känner du igen dig? Då vill vi gärna att du läser vidare!**
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
* Många spännande möjligheter att välja bland – du får vara med och påverka allt från drift och utveckling till strategiska beslut.
* En modern, dynamisk IT‑miljö där innovation verkligen uppmuntras.
* Ett engagerat team som samarbetar tätt och bygger en kultur av lärande och förbättring.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Microsoft 365, Intune, AVD/VDI, säkerhet och automatisering.
* Agila arbetsformer enligt SAFe – där du är delaktig i planering, prioritering och teamwork.
* En trygg arbetsgivare med schyssta villkor och ett modernt kontor i Hagastaden.


**Din vardag hos oss**
 Du ansvarar för att bevaka, prioritera och hantera teamets inkommande ärenden och incidenter. Du arbetar med djupare felsökning, problemlösning och dokumentation av lösningar i vår kunskapsdatabas.
   

  

 Du samarbetar även med interna och externa parter för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och en användarupplevelse i toppklass.
   

  

 Kort sagt: Du är en av nyckelpersonerna som gör HSB:s digitala arbetsplats stabil, effektiv och modern.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en serviceinriktad och nyfiken person som alltid sätter användaren i centrum.
   

  

 Du är noggrann, gillar att dokumentera och delar gärna med dig av kunskap för att stärka teamet. Du trivs i samarbete men tar också ansvar och initiativ på egen hand.
   

  

 Du är helt enkelt en lagspelare som vill göra skillnad – och som gör det genom att leverera en arbetsplats som fungerar på riktigt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har god kunskap inom**
* Active Directory & Entra ID
* Microsoft 365-plattformen
* Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) / VDI-lösningar
* Intune
* PowerShell
* Klient- och applikationshantering i Windows, macOS, iOS och Android
* Felsökning, användarsupport och incidenthantering


**Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av**
* Agilt arbetssätt (gärna SAFe)
* Microsoft‑certifieringar
* Telia Touchpoint Plus
* Safe
* ServiceNow
* Jira & Confluence


**Välkommen till HSB!** 
 Vi intervjuar löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av vårt team som gör skillnad på riktigt! Sista ansökningsdag
 **xxx**
**HSB Riksförbund**
 HSB är Sveriges ledande bostadskooperation med fastighetsförvaltning och bostadsutveckling som kärnaffär. HSB Riksförbund ska stärka vår idé och skapa värde för HSB-föreningarna och dess medlemmar, utveckla HSBs gemensamma varumärke samt stärka HSBs roll i samhället. Hos oss får du stort eget ansvar, möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas, samt arbeta i en organisation med korta beslutsvägar och högt i tak. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetsformer, goda anställningsvillkor och en kultur där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi befinner oss på en otroligt spännande resa där varje individ har en viktig roll – vill du vara med och göra skillnad? Sök tjänsten redan idag!
   

  

*Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.*
 Vill du veta mer, kontakta rekryterande chef, Anna Folkesson, anna.folkesson@hsb.se, 010-442 05 03 eller HR, Frida Markell, frida.markell@hsb.se, 010-442 03 77

title: LIA/Internship within Tracking & Analytics
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com.
   

  

 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**About The Internship**
 Our Tracking & Analytics team at WPP Media is looking for a detail-oriented intern for spring 2026. This is your chance to work with some of our most ambitious clients and get a real-world look into data-driven marketing.
   

  

 You'll be part of our Media Magagement & Delivery department, a team of about 160 specialists who are experts in advertising technology and data. We're always pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing, and our Tracking & Analytics team is central to that mission. You'll get direct mentorship in a team that is at the heart of digital development. Our office is centrally located at Birger Jarlsgatan 52 in Stockholm.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a Tracking & Analytics Intern, you'll be a key support for the team, learning what it takes to be the hub in the digital wheel. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Assisting the team to ensure our clients' digital campaigns are being measured correctly.
* Learning to work in ad management systems (adservers) and helping with campaign setups according to best practice.
* Supporting the team with ad materials and basic technical troubleshooting.
* Learning how to be a liaison between our client divisions and the specialist teams in Programmatic and Paid Social.
* Helping to compile data and insights for campaign reports.


**Who We're Looking For**
 We're looking for an engaged, development-oriented person with a strong interest in digital marketing and technology. You should be curious, structured, and eager to learn in a fast-paced, client-focused environment.
   

  

**It Would Be a Great Plus If You Have**
* Some familiarity with ad management systems like Google Campaign Manager.
* An understanding of tag management, web analytics, or dynamic ad solutions.


**To join our team as an intern, you need to:**
* Be available for at least 8 weeks. Please specify your availability for your school’s internship period in your application.
* Do your internship through a school (praktik/LIA) or the Swedish Public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen).
* Be available full-time during standard office hours on-site at our Stockholm office.


 Please note that this internship is unpaid.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the internship, contact Martina Lundgren, Activations Director . Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email – please submit your application through Greenhouse.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Digital Marketing Designer
description:
Are you a designer who enjoys getting under the hood with HTML? Or a technical creator who refuses to compromise on aesthetics? At Teachiq, we are looking for a Digital Marketing Designer to take ownership of all marketing visuals.
 



  





**About Teachiq** 




  





 Teachiq is the team behind
 **Exam.net** 
 and
 **KM (Kunskapsmatrisen)** 
 , tools trusted by teachers globally. Since 2015, we’ve grown to over 50 team members without external funding. This independence allows us to prioritize quality and long-term impact over "growth at all costs." 
 



 Our team is a mix of former teachers and driven professionals who share a high level of engagement and a culture built on ownership. We believe that the teaching profession is a cornerstone of a well-functioning society, and we’re looking for someone who shares that view. 
 



 We are based in
 **Danderyd, Stockholm** 
 , where we work together to build relationships across our product, sales, and customer success teams.
 



  





**The Role - What you will actually do** 




  





 In this hands-on role, you will be part of our small marketing team, where you will help form the visual expression of our brands. You won’t be doing it alone, your colleagues are always here to help, and you will work in close sync with our product designers to ensure a cohesive experience across everything we do.
 



  




* **Design & Branding (Figma/ Adobe /Affinity.):** 
 Your focus will be on maintaining and refining our existing visual identity. You will ensure the design is consistent across every touchpoint, from web layouts and digital ads to physical product sheets.



  




* **The Technical Build (HTML/CSS):** 
 Build responsive web pages in WordPress and email campaigns, ensuring everything we ship is of the highest quality.



  




* **Content Creation:** 
 Produce engaging visual content for social channels and newsletters that feels genuine and adds value.



  




* **Global Localization:** 
 Manage our websites, and the eight languages we support via Weglot.



  




* **Events & Execution:** 
 We attend conferences worldwide. You will design our exhibition walls and, when necessary, take a lead role in organizing a fair or two to ensure our physical presence matches our digital one.



  





**Who you are** 




  





 We welcome everyone from recent design graduates to those with a few years of industry experience. We are specifically looking for a candidate with a structured drive and a passion for taking ownership of their work. We value your "can-do" attitude and your sharp eye for detail.
 



  





**Read more and apply here:** 




 https://www.romneyrudberg.se/digital-marketing-designer-examnet-och-kunskapsmatrisen-teachiq

title: Technical Process Developer
description:
Join us in shaping the future of IT service excellence at Dustin—where your expertise in ITIL processes and smart automation will drive efficiency and innovation across the organization. If you’re passionate about continuous improvement and collaboration, this is your opportunity to make a real impact
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Technical Process Developer unique**
* Drive organizational agility by coaching leaders and teams to embrace iterative delivery and transparency
* Facilitate impactful workshops like retrospectives and value stream mapping to align priorities and optimize flow
* Champion a culture of continuous improvement that accelerates collaboration and business outcomes


 My name is Fredrik Åsberg, and I’m the hiring manager for this role. As a leader, I believe in building trust and giving people ownership of their work. At Dustin, we rely on technology that delivers on its promises—and I hold the same standard for our team: we commit, we deliver, and we grow together.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Technical Process Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing and continuously improving ITIL-based processes and ITSM workflows, ensuring they align with best practices and Dustin’s strategic goals while driving automation and efficiency across the platform.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering robust ITIL processes and ITSM workflows that enable seamless service operations. You’ll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Product Owners, Engineering, Service Delivery, Business Operations, and leadership to ensure clear communication, governance, and continuous improvement
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Design, implement, and continuously improve ITIL-based processes and related workflows, ensuring alignment with ITIL v4 best practices and Dustin’s strategic objectives
* Collaborate with Atlassian Jira/ITSM platform specialists to configure, test, and optimize workflows, automations, and integrations that reduce manual work and enhance efficiency
* Establish and monitor KPIs, dashboards, and performance metrics to track process maturity, support governance forums, and drive service improvement initiatives


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
**This Is What We Imagine You Bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives on improving processes, enabling collaboration, and turning complex requirements into scalable, efficient solution
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* You have 10-15 years of consultancy experience
* You are fluent in English, proficiency in Swedish is a plus
* Experience with ITIL v4 processes and frameworks, including Incident, Problem, Change, Request Fulfillment, Knowledge Management, and CMDB
* Technical skills in ITSM platforms (preferably Atlassian Jira), workflow design, automation, and integration, along with the ability to establish KPIs and dashboards for performance tracking


**What can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA partner Filippa Olivecrona
* 1st interview with Fredrik Åsberg
* Assessment (Personality- and cognitive thinking test)
* 2nd interview with colleagues
* Final in-person interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik and Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Filippa Olivecrona via e-mail: Filippa.olivecrona@dustin.com

title: Senior VMware-konsult
description:
Till ett uppdrag hos vår kund i Stockholm söker vi en Senior VMware-konsult som ska ansvara för att designa, vidareutveckla och säkerställa en stabil, säker och effektiv virtualiserings- och molninfrastruktur. Du arbetar med hela livscykeln för IT-infrastruktur; från arkitektur och implementation till drift, automation och kontinuerlig förbättring.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Rollen passar dig som har minst 5 års djupgående erfarenhet av VMware, kombinerat med flera års tidigare arbete inom IT-infrastruktur, exempelvis inom drift, systemadministration eller datacenter. Du har ett starkt helhetsperspektiv och trivs i miljöer där automation, skalbarhet och stabilitet är affärskritiska.
 



  





 Du ansvarar för VMware-plattformens centrala komponenter och arbetar aktivt med orkestrering, självbetjäning och standardisering genom moderna verktyg och arbetssätt. Du blir en nyckelperson i uppgraderingar, migreringar och vidareutveckling av infrastrukturen, samt samarbetar tätt med nätverk, säkerhet, applikation och andra tekniska team.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Designa, administrera och optimera VMware-miljöer i komplexa IT-landskap
* Arbeta med automation och orkestrering av IT-infrastruktur
* Implementera och vidareutveckla lösningar baserade på VMware Aria Automation och Aria Orchestrator
* Ansvara för virtualiserade nätverkslösningar med VMware NSX-T
* Arbeta med VMware vCloud Director i leverans- och tjänsteorienterade miljöer
* Säkerställa kontinuitet och återställning med VMware SRM / Live Recovery
* Planera och genomföra uppgraderingar, migreringar och förbättringsinitiativ'
* Automatisera drift och leverans med hjälp av script och versionshantering
* Samarbeta med andra team och fungera som teknisk expert och rådgivare



  





**Din profil** 




  





*Krav:* 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med VMware i större eller affärskritiska miljöer
* Tidigare flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-infrastruktur eller systemdrift
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom automation och orkestrering av IT-infrastruktur
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom:



 - VMware Aria Automation
 



 - VMware Aria Orchestrator
 



 - VMware vCloud Director
 



 - VMware NSX-T
 



 - VMware SRM / Live Recovery
 


* Goda kunskaper i Git (GitHub/GitLab)
* Goda kunskaper i PowerShell
* Goda kunskaper i JavaScript
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





*Meriterande:* 



* Erfarenhet av större datacenter- eller molnmiljöer
* Certifieringar inom VMware (t.ex. VCP, VCAP)
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-kopplingar mot infrastruktur
* Vana att arbeta enligt DevOps- eller plattformsprinciper



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.

title: Compliance Officer
Manager, Field Engineering (Pre-Sales) - Strategic Accounts
description:
(FEQ327R114)
   

  

 As a Field Engineering Manager, you will lead a skilled and motivated team of technical pre-sales Solutions Architects and Solutions Engineers based in Stockholm. You will play a key leadership role at the intersection of technology and business, helping the team design value-focused solutions and support growth through effective collaboration with Sales and other partners.
   

  

 You will coach your team to communicate complex ideas clearly and accessibly, supporting strategic sales cycles, and building strong partnerships with customers and stakeholders across large organisations. You will also foster a culture where people with diverse backgrounds feel included, supported, and able to do their best work.
   

  

 The impact you will have
   

  

* Lead, mentor, and develop an inclusive pre-sales team in Stockholm, supporting both performance and long-term career growth.
* Foster a collaborative culture that reflects Databricks’ values of customer focus, teamwork, and diversity of thought.
* Partner with Sales to drive solution- and value-based selling, helping customers understand the business impact of our platform.
* Enhance team effectiveness by establishing and iterating on best practices that improve efficiency and focus on meaningful business outcomes.
* Build trusted relationships with customer executives and strategic partners, acting as a credible advisor on data, analytics, and AI.
* Collaborate across teams—including Marketing, Sales, Product, and Services—to ensure a seamless customer experience and successful implementation.
* Represent Databricks as part of the regional leadership team and contribute to building our brand and presence in Nordic markets.


**What We Look For**
*Note - you do not need to fulfil every single requirement to be a strong candidate. If you are excited about this role and have related experience, we encourage you to apply!*
* Experience managing or leading technical teams in Big Data, Cloud, SaaS, or similarly complex technology environments, or equivalent experience that shows you can quickly learn new technologies.
* A track record of leading, mentoring, and scaling pre-sales, consulting, or technical field organisations, with an emphasis on coaching and inclusive leadership.
* Understanding of consumption-based or subscription business models and how technical decisions influence commercial outcomes.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with Sales and other cross-functional leaders, balancing customer value, technical feasibility, and business priorities.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with fluency in English and Swedish languages.
* Technical background in Data Engineering, Databases, Data Science, or adjacent fields; consulting or customer-facing experience is an advantage.
* Curiosity and passion for data, AI, and cloud technologies, and the ability to articulate their business value in clear, inclusive language.


**Notes**
* This role is based in Stockholm, within a reasonable commuting distance, and follows a hybrid working model.
* If you need any adjustments or accommodations during the application or interview process, please let us know so we can support you.


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Customer Communication Process Specialist
description:
Do you want to improve how customers experience communication – making every message more relevant, timely and impactful?
   

  

 In this role, you will shape and scale customer communication processes across markets, using data, segmentation and personalization to drive stronger relationships, higher retention and better customer satisfaction.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Customer Communication Process Specialist, you will play a key role in building effective and scalable communication processes across markets. Your focus will be on optimizing communication activities, embedding best practices in segmentation and personalization, and using data insights to continuously improve the customer experience.
   

  

 As a vital member of the communication & marketing team, you will collaborate with colleagues across it, insights, and business functions, managing data processes to support campaign execution while also leading long-term process improvements. The role combines analytical thinking with operational impact and offers real opportunity to influence how customer communication is structured and delivered.
   

  

 This role can be based in any of our main offices in Sweden, Finland or Norway.
   

  

*What makes this role exciting:*
* You improve communication experiences at scale across markets
* You influence both strategy and execution of customer communication
* You work with data, segmentation and personalization in a hands-on way
* You drive best practices and process development
* You collaborate across teams and functions


*Key areas of responsibility include:*
* Supporting campaign setup and execution aligned with communication strategies
* Conducting testing and quality assurance to ensure high standards
* Harmonizing processes across markets by documenting and implementing best practices
* Identifying development needs and contributing to process improvement initiatives
* Translating business goals into actionable communication and segmentation strategies


**About You**
 You are structured, analytical and customer-focused, with a strong interest in how communication, data and technology come together to create better experiences. You enjoy improving processes and collaborating across teams.
   

  

*We believe you bring:*
* Experience with advanced technologies in CRM systems and marketing automation platforms.
* A relevant university degree and at least three years of experience in a related field
* Experience in SQL and customer data segmentation
* Strong understanding of segmentation and personalization principles
* Strong collaboration skills and a proactive, team-oriented mindset


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your CV in English by 8th of February 2026 at the latest . We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Sofia Juhlin at sofia.juhlin@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to Swedish union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page** 
**.**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated
   

  

 emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Associate Managing Consultant with marketing background
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Associate Managing Consultant with marketing background
   

  

 Services within Mastercard is responsible for acquiring, engaging, and retaining customers by managing fraud and risk, enhancing cybersecurity, and improving the digital payments experience. We provide value-added services and leverage expertise, data-driven insights, and execution. Our Advisors & Consulting Services team combines traditional management consulting with Mastercard’s rich data assets, proprietary platforms, and technologies to provide clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Our teams work with a diverse global customer base across industries, from banking and payments to retail and restaurants.
   

  

 The Advisors & Consulting Services group has five specializations: Strategy & Transformation, Performance Analytics, Business Experimentation, Marketing, and Program Management. Our Strategy & Transformation consultants lead clients through impactful decision-making as they tackle strategic, tactical, operational, and transformational business challenges. Our Marketing consultants lead the strategy development and implementation of business-critical customer experience and marketing engagements for clients. They use industry, market and customer data to provide deep marketing advisory support across channels, evaluating results and adapting the approach to optimize customer experience and business performance.
   

  

 Positions for different specializations and levels are available in separate job postings. Please review our consulting specializations to learn more about all opportunities and apply for the position that is best suited to your background and experience: https://careers.mastercard.com/us/en/consulting-specializations-at-mastercard
   

  

 Roles and Responsibilities
   

  

 We are looking for an Associate Managing Consultant to join our Nordics & Baltics team to lead client engagement that spans the Marketing, as well as the Strategy & Transformation space.
   

  

 Client Impact
   

  

* Lead client engagements across a range of industries and business challenges
* Contribute to and/or lead strategies and programs for large, regional, and global clients by leveraging data and technology solutions to unlock client value
* Manage working relationship with client managers, and act as trusted and reliable partner


 Team Collaboration & Culture
   

  

* Provide marketing expertise and day-to-day project delivery team leadership, support evolution of solutions with innovation and create a collaborative and inclusive environment for all levels
* Develop sound business recommendations and deliver effective client presentations
* Plan, organize, and structure own work and that of junior project delivery consultants to identify effective analysis structures to address client problems, synthesize analyses into relevant findings, and create impactful storylines
* Lead team and external meetings, and lead or co-lead project management
* Contribute to the firm's intellectual capital and solution development
* Grow from coaching to enable ownership of day-to-day project management across client projects, and mentor junior consultants


**Basic Qualifications**
* Undergraduate degree with 5-10 years of work experience in consulting, corporate strategy, product marketing strategy and/or integrated marketing.
* Experience managing clients or internal stakeholders
* Logical, structured thinking, and affinity for numerical analysis
* Advanced Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills
* Ability to perform multiple tasks with multiple clients in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Ability to communicate effectively in English and Swedish.
* Eligibility to work in the country where you are applying, as well as apply for travel visas as required by travel needs
* Ability to travel to client sites on a semi-regular basis


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Proficiency in additional Nordic or Baltic languages.
* Experience in event management
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
* Experience leading development and implementation of solutions and measuring impact on clients' business
* Experience generating new knowledge or creating innovative solutions for a firm
* MBA or master’s degree


 Our Purpose
   

  

 We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Enterprise Account Executive
description:
**Recruitment Fraud Alert**
 We’ve learned that scammers are impersonating Commvault team members—including HR and leadership—via email or text. These bad actors may conduct fake interviews and ask for personal information, such as your social security number.
   

  

**What To Know**
* Commvault does not conduct interviews by email or text.
* We will never ask you to submit sensitive documents (including banking information, SSN, etc) before your first day.


 If you suspect a recruiting scam, please contact us at wwrecruitingteam@commvault.com
   

  

**About Commvault**
 Commvault (NASDAQ: CVLT) is the gold standard in cyber resilience. The company empowers customers to uncover, take action, and rapidly recover from cyberattacks – keeping data safe and businesses resilient. The company’s unique AI-powered platform combines best-in-class data protection, exceptional data security, advanced data intelligence, and lightning-fast recovery across any workload or cloud at the lowest TCO. For over 25 years, more than 100,000 organizations and a vast partner ecosystem have relied on Commvault to reduce risks, improve governance, and do more with data.
   

  

 The Enterprise Account Executive is responsible for achieving assigned quota by selling Commvault solutions into a defined list of large Swedish enterprise accounts, including both existing customers and high value prospects. The role covers enterprise organisations across Sweden and carries full accountability for account strategy, execution, and results.
   

  

 This is a field based sales position requiring direct engagement with customers and prospects, either independently or in collaboration with partners. The Account Executive plans, organises, and executes balanced sales growth, account penetration, and customer satisfaction on a long term, multi quarter basis. The role may lead cross functional sales teams and is responsible for developing and executing sales initiatives to penetrate and expand assigned accounts.
   

  

 The Account Executive must demonstrate a strong understanding of enterprise customer environments, business drivers, and technical landscapes, and align Commvault solutions to customer needs through clear financial, operational, and strategic value propositions. The role requires experience selling complex software platforms in hybrid cloud, data center, or cloud centric environments rather than narrow point solutions, and prior engagement with large enterprise accounts.
   

  

**How The Role Makes An Impact**
* Achieves quarterly and annual revenue targets by selling to new and existing large, complex enterprise customers across Sweden.
* Develops and executes strategic account plans for target account expansion and new account acquisition, including performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones over one and three year periods.
* Designs and executes structured sales initiatives within target accounts, coordinating executive engagement with customer leadership when appropriate.
* Coordinates internal resources including sales engineering, professional services, partners, support, finance, legal, and management to meet account objectives and customer expectations.
* Leads and manages a matrixed sales team to progress opportunities from early engagement through contract execution.
* Establishes and maintains productive, professional relationships with key stakeholders in assigned customer and prospect accounts.
* Constructs and presents executive level business cases, including financial, technical, and strategic value justification.
* Prepares and delivers sales proposals and executive presentations to new and existing customers.
* Identifies, develops, and maintains strategic partner and alliance relationships that support account access and growth.
* Negotiates and closes complex transactions in accordance with company policies and commercial governance.
* Ensures all orders meet legal, financial, and compliance requirements.
* Maintains a high level of relevant industry, competitive, and Commvault product knowledge.
* Plans, participates in, and coordinates executive briefings and senior customer engagements.
* Uses internal sales tools, processes, and methodologies to manage pipeline, forecasting, and opportunity progression.


**Position Requirements**
* Demonstrated success in enterprise software sales, including experience selling complex software platforms, or data center and hybrid cloud solutions, or cloud based offerings, with a proven record of closing six and seven figure transactions.
* Proven ability to manage long cycle, multi quarter sales processes involving multiple stakeholders.
* Experience selling directly to enterprise customers as well as through partners and alliances.
* Strong communication, presentation, and listening skills with the ability to engage at executive level.
* Solid background in enterprise IT, data center, and cloud architectures.
* Experience with structured sales methodologies such as MEDDICC or equivalent.
* Experience selling cyber resilience, data protection, or adjacent security solutions is an advantage.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


 Commvault is an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are always committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status and we will not discriminate against on the basis of such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we work.
   

  

 Commvault’s goal is to make interviewing inclusive and accessible to all candidates and employees. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to participate in the interview process or apply for a position at Commvault, please email accommodations@commvault.com For any inquiries not related to an accommodation please reach out to wwrecruitingteam@commvault.com.
   

  

 Commvault's Privacy Policy

title: Head of CRM
description:
Do you want to help millions of anglers achieve their fishing dreams? At
 **Fishbrain** 
 , we’re on a mission to deliver an incredible experience for everyone who loves fishing and the outdoors, today and tomorrow.
 



  





 Fishbrain is the world’s most popular fishing app, used by millions of anglers in the US and beyond. CRM is a central part of how we build long-lasting relationships with our users and guide them through every step of their journey. Our lifecycle communication has a direct impact on activation, retention, and subscription growth. and we are now looking for a hands-on leader to run this engine.
 



  





 You will report to the CMO, who defines the broader commercial strategy, and you are the one who brings it to life. As
 **Head of CRM** 
 , you lead the team that executes, optimizes, and experiments. You are a "player-coach" who enjoys the balance between high-level roadmap planning and the day-to-day work inside our tools.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Lead, coach, and support a team of CRM Managers, while actively participating in the day-to-day execution.
* Be responsible for the performance of our lifecycle flows (activation, retention, and monetization) and ensure they align with our commercial goals.
* Partner closely with product teams and collaborate with the wider marketing team to create a cohesive user journey that supports acquisition, engagement and long-term retention.
* Ensure all customer communication is helpful, valuable and aligned with in-app experiences and product developments.
* Use product updates, feature launches and seasonal opportunities to create relevant customer communication that supports the overall user experience.
* Design, launch and improve automated and campaign-based lifecycle flows.
* Work hands-on in Braze to build segmented, personalized, and event-driven journeys.
* Run A/B tests and experiments to find the best cadence and messaging. You don’t just report data, you turn it into immediate action.



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 5+ years of experience in CRM, marketing automation, lifecycle or retention marketing within a B2C digital or subscription-based business.
* You are comfortable working directly in tools like Braze or similar platforms. You enjoy the craft of building flows as much as the logic behind them.
* Proven ability to design and execute lifecycle and CRM initiatives that drive measurable business results.
* Strong understanding of user segmentation, behavioral targeting and multi-channel communication.
* Experience leading teams and working closely with product and cross-functional stakeholders.
* A collaborative leader who enjoys solving customer problems and improving the user journey.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to work confidently with data to guide decisions and improvements.
* You are comfortable taking a lead role in projects, ensuring clarity and follow-through for your team.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience working in a tech scale-up environment.
* An interest in the outdoors or fishing, it helps you understand the "vibe" and needs of our users.



  





**Where you’ll work** 




 We work in a
 **hybrid setup** 
 , and all team members are expected to work from our Stockholm HQ, The Lighthouse, at least two days per week.
 



  





 Please submit applications in
 **ENGLISH** 
 , those that are not will not be reviewed.
 



  





**Our Bait** 




 We’re a product-focused startup, and every individual is important. That means you get to contribute to the direction of the company and the impact we have on millions of anglers. We at Fishbrain work with the latest tech and challenge ourselves every day. We have a work culture that encourages innovation, passion and teamwork. And most importantly, we want you to enjoy coming to work every single day.
 



  





**In addition, Fishbrain also offers:** 




  





**🌴 30 days annual vacation** 




 Each year you’ll get 30 days vacation to use however, whenever
 



  





**🤸 ♀️ Wellness bonus** 




 5000 sek annual allowance to put towards anything in the realm of health and fitness
 



  





**🧑 🎓 Learning & development days** 




 Fishbrain provides five 5 paid Learning & Development days per year to its employees
 



  





**💻📱 Technology of your choice** 




 Mac or PC, you decide
 



  





**🌎 Commitment to sustainability** 




 Our global data set, among the largest in the world, is selectively provided in a managed and controlled manner to scientific research partners in both North America and Europe to better understand and improve fisheries research
 



  





**🤧🫷Flu vaccination** 




 To support your health and well-being, we’ll be offering complimentary flu vaccinations every year
 



  





**🎣 Fishing rods in the office** 




 Grab one and go fishing. We have fishing guides and experts working among us that can help you catch your dream fish
 



  





**🐕 Dog friendly** 




 Feel free to bring your furry friend to the office
 



  





**🥳 Social activities** 




 Quizzes, virtual escape rooms, parties, regular fikas, fishing tournaments and much more!
 



  





**🥪 Breakfast**
