title: ID Center Koordinator – Teknisk och serviceinriktad roll
description:
Stockholm - Stockholms lan - Sweden
   

  

**ID Center Koordinator – Teknisk och serviceinriktad roll**
 Söker du en möjlighet att kombinera ditt intresse för teknik och systemhantering med en roll där kundservice och problemlösning är i fokus? Nu har du chansen att bli en del av ett internationellt företag som ID Center Koordinator! Tveka inte – ansök redan idag då urvalet pågår löpande!
   

  

 Vi söker en driven och tekniskt intresserad kollega som inte bara har en passion för att arbeta med olika system, utan som också värderar att ge högklassig service till både interna och externa kunder. Denna roll är för dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i tekniska system och samtidigt trivs med att kommunicera och lösa problem via telefon och e-post.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en viktig del i vår leverans till kund och arbeta med att hantera passerkort och accesser. Hos oss får du vara med på en spännande resa i ett globalt företag där teknisk kompetens och hög servicenivå går hand i hand.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som ID Center Koordinator kommer du att arbeta med att hantera och säkerställa korrekt hantering av passerkort och accesser. En stor del av arbetet innebär att felsöka tekniska system relaterade till säkerhet och access, samt att ge teknisk support över telefon och e-post. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med både säkerhets- och IT-avdelningar för att upprätthålla säkerhetsrutiner och hantera eventuella systemrelaterade problem.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och uppdatera accesser i våra säkerhetssystem
* Skapa, aktivera och deaktivera passerkort samt hantera tillgång till lokaler
* Felsökning och problemlösning i säkerhetssystem och andra tekniska plattformar
* Kommunicera och ge support till anställda och besökare via telefon och e-post
* Arbeta nära säkerhets- och driftspersonal för att säkerställa att alla säkerhetsrutiner följs


**Vi Söker Dig Som (har/är)**
* Är tekniskt intresserad och har erfarenhet av att arbeta i olika IT-system, gärna relaterade till accesshantering eller säkerhetssystem
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknisk support, systemhantering eller kundtjänst
* Är lösningsorienterad och tycker om att grotta ner dig i tekniska problem för att hitta lösningar
* Har en hög servicenivå och värderar att ge en kundupplevelse utöver det vanliga, även när det handlar om tekniska problem
* Är noggrann, självgående och har en god förmåga att prioritera
* Trivs med att kommunicera och samarbeta med olika avdelningar och externa parter
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med korthanteringssystem
* Erfarenhet inom säkerhetsbranschen eller teknisk support


**Vi Erbjuder**
 En omväxlande tjänst i en global organisation med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Du kommer att arbeta i ett dynamiskt team där samarbete, ansvarstagande och serviceanda står i centrum. Arbetsplatsen är belägen i Kista, med goda kommunikationsmöjligheter och närhet till både kollektivtrafik och service.
   

  

 Hos oss får du vara med på den spännande tillväxtresa och förändringsprocess som företaget för närvarande genomgår. Vi erbjuder dig en spännande möjlighet i en global organisation med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Du kommer att omfattas av vår tjänstepension, våra friskvårdsförmåner och vår Benify-portal mm.
   

  

**CBRE** 
 är ett värderingsstyrt företag som arbetar utifrån våra värdeord
 **RISE** 
 (Respect, Integrity, Service, and Excellence). Dessa värderingar har vi med i alla delar av vårt arbete och vi vill att de ska genomsyra allt vi gör.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på 100% och tillsvidare med placering i Kista utanför Stockholm hos vår kund
   

  

 Start: omgående
   

  

 Känns denna roll intressant, ansök redan idag! Vi arbetar löpande med vårt urval och tjänsten kan därför komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

**CBRE** 
 är världens största kommersiella fastighets- och investeringsföretag. På
 **CBRE** 
 är vår passion att leverera marknadsledande fastighetsrelaterade tjänster som bidrar till våra kunders framgång! Våra ca 115 000 anställda hjälper investerare, fastighetsägare och hyresgäster via våra cirka 530 kontor över hela världen och omsatte år 2022 över 30,8 miljarder dollar.
 **CBRE Global Workplace Solutions** 
 (GWS) är ett affärsområde inom
 **CBRE** 
 som levererar integrerade tjänster inom fastighetsförvaltning, teknisk fastighetsdrift, projektledning, rådgivning samt energieffektivisering.
   

  

**Service line:** 
 GWS Segment

title: 2026 Summer Internship, Machine Learning Engineering (Stockholm)
description:
Spotify is looking for enthusiastic students with a passion for music and an ambition to go far. This isn't just any internship! Our paid internship program will give you the chance to gain in-depth knowledge of what it's like to be a Spotify employee as well as get the opportunity to see the technology side of a fast growing company! Our summer internships will last for approximately 10 weeks this summer and start in mid- June.
   

  

 We’re looking for
 **Machine Learning Interns** 
 who are excited about the fast-moving world of AI and eager to learn by doing. This internship is intentionally exploratory: the specific projects and scope may evolve over time based on team needs, emerging ideas, and your interests.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Experiment with machine learning and modern AI tools, including large language models (LLMs).
* Prototype ideas, proof-of-concepts, or early-stage features using AI techniques.
* Explore new models, libraries, or workflows and share insights with your team.
* Learn how AI systems are evaluated, improved, and prepared for real-world use.
* Collaborate with engineers, researchers, designers, and product partners in a supportive, learning-focused environment.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are pursuing a Bachelor's degree, Master’s degree or coding / AI bootcamp in a related field of study.
* You have a graduation year date of 2026 or 2027.
* You currently have valid work authorization to work in the country in which this role is based that will extend from June to August 2026.
* You are available from June 15th to August 21st, 2026 to participate in the summer internship.
* You’re genuinely curious about AI and enjoy learning through hands-on experimentation.
* You have some experience programming (e.g., Python, Java, or similar) and basic exposure to machine learning concepts through coursework, projects, research, or bootcamp work.
* You’re interested in areas like machine learning, generative AI, or large language models.
* You’re comfortable with ambiguity and excited by the opportunity to help shape what you work on.
* You enjoy collaborating, asking questions, and learning from others.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role will require you to work out of our Stockholm office
* Our internship program has a lot to offer with in office events and networking opportunities. To allow you to be fully immersed in our program and make the most of your time with us, we ask that you come into the office 3 days a week.


 Our paid summer internships last for approximately
 **10 weeks** 
 and start
 **mid- June 2026** 
 . The
 **last day to apply is February 5, 2026 at 6 PM CET** 
 .
   

  

 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Strategic Planner to The Barn - Stockholm, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about transforming insight into impactful creativity? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where strategy fuels bold, brilliant work? At The Barn, Arla’s in-house agency, we are now looking for a Strategic Planner to join our growing Swedish team in Stockholm, Solna.
   

  

 As the first planner on the ground in Sweden you will play a key role in building and embedding strategic planning in our Swedish Barn. Simultaneously you will help shape, build and ensure the success of a range of our brands, from global brands like Lurpak, Castello, and Starbucks to our local icons like Arla Ko, Pucko, and Arla Köket.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 In this role, you will be instrumental in driving strategic excellence across a diverse portfolio of brands. Working closely with account managers, global planners, creatives, and brand teams, you will
   

  

* Lead hands-on strategic development for brand and communications planning across Arla’s global and Swedish brands.
* Build impactful above- and below-the-line strategies that are both insight- and commercially driven.
* Craft insightful briefs and champion creativity that sparks emotional connection between our brands and their audiences.
* Identify new opportunities for brand growth and help guide long-term business planning alongside our brand teams.
* Actively collaborate across The Barn – both in Sweden and with global teams in Århus, Denmark – to develop best-in-class creative output.
* Contribute to cross-agency thinking on consumer behaviour, food inspiration, and creative effectiveness.
* Shape and evolve The Barn Sweden’s strategic planning capabilities, helping to define how we work today – and how we should work tomorrow.


 You’ll be part of an organization where our clients are also our colleagues, giving you rare inside-out and outside-in perspectives and the opportunity to get close to the business while bringing invaluable strategic clarity.
   

  

**What Will Make You Successful**
 You will thrive in this role if you bring a mix of strategic sharpness, creative passion, and collaborative drive. We’re looking for someone who is
   

  

 Functionally strong
   

  

* Able to simplify complexity and communicate it in an inspiring, digestible way.
* Skilled at rallying people around a strategic direction.
* Passionate about outstanding creative work – and the strategy that fuels it.
* Curious about audiences, and comfortable working with qualitative insight, data analysis, and research partners.
* Experienced in working within cross-agency teams.
* Confident in presenting and influencing stakeholders.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, spoken and written.


 Personally exceptional
   

  

* Ambitious and imaginative.
* Inspiring and inclusive.
* Always learning and relentlessly results-focused.


 Your background
   

  

* 3+ years of agency experience.
* A strong track record in creative development and strategic planning.


**What do we offer?**
 The opportunity to join a different kind of agency with full inhouse capabilities covering everything from digital media buying/planning, tech/development, creative, strategy and on-site production facilities. We focus our energy on building the best communications and digital solution for our wonderful range of brands.
   

  

 Arla Foods has collective agreements, and we always ensure to offer good and competitive working conditions. In addition to that, safety and working environment are our top priorities, which is why we, among other things, conduct random drug and alcohol tests.
   

  

 We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. And you’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favourite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.
   

  

**Would you like to join us?**
 We look forward to receiving your application! We process applications on a continuous basis and will close the recruitment once we have identified the right candidate Please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 For additional information or questions, please reach out to Head of Planning Jeppe Fischer-Mogensen at jepfi@arlafoods.com.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications submitted through the link in the job advertisement. Applications sent via email will not be considered.
   

  

**Shape the Future of Dairy**
 Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to enabling good food choices that make life better, providing people with natural, sustainable nourishment, while taking care at every step to ensure Arla is a choice they can feel good about. If you are looking to shape the future with an ambitious global cooperative that truly cares about your growth, where everyone feels valued and empowered, and collaboration is the core of culture, Arla is a choice you can feel good about.
   

  

 Ref.104632

title: Research Engineer in Quantum Computing
description:
**Job Description**
 We seek a research engineer to support teaching and research in quantum computing. In particular, the research engineer will support the teaching activities courses at KTH and further develop methodologies and algorithms for the quantum computer simulators.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* A graduate degree or an advanced level (higher education) in computer science or equivalent competence.
* We prefer that you have a strong background in quantum computing.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Subject-related skills
* Professional skills
* Awareness of diversity and equal opportunity issues, with specific focus on gender equality
* Collaborative abilities
* Independence


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

 Join us at KTH
   

  

 KTH shapes the future through education, research and innovation. As a leading international technical university, we play an active role in advancing the transition towards a sustainable society. At KTH, you have the opportunity to grow and develop in a creative and dynamic environment, with good working conditions and attractive benefits. Equality, diversity and equal opportunities are essential to quality and form an integral part of KTH’s core values as a university and public authority.
   

  

 Learn more about our benefits and what it's like to work and grow at KTH.
   

  

 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

 To apply for the position
   

  

 Log into KTH's recruitment system to apply for this position. You are responsible for ensuring that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Copy of grades from your previous university studies. Translations into English or Swedish if the original documents have not been issued in any of these languages.


 Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The employment is valid for a limited time according to the agreement - for up to 6 months, with access according to agreement.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.*

title: HR Tech Lead
description:
**Are you ready to lead the charge in transforming HR technology at Alleima? As our HR Tech Lead, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our IT systems and processes within the HR organization. This is a strategic and influential role for someone who wants to define, build, and evolve HR technology and AI capabilities -not simply manage existing systems.**
**Join us and be part of a global community of innovators dedicated to redefining the future of materials technology. Your passion and dedication will be celebrated as you contribute to our collective vision. Don’t miss this opportunity to make history with us. Apply today!**
**Placement: Stockholm or Sandviken.**
**About The Role**
 As HR Tech Lead, you will play a key role in developing the organization’s digital HR capabilities and enabling future ways of working. This is a strategic role where you will shape how technology, data, and AI support both people and business growth. You report to and act in close collaboration with Executive Vice President & Head of Human resources, and you’re valued partner in the HR Management team.
   

  

**Your Key Tasks Will Include**
* Define and drive the HR technology & AI strategy, ensuring alignment with HR, IT, and business objectives to support organizational development.
* Act as a strategic thought partner to HR and business leaders, enabling digital innovation and transformation from a people perspective.
* Establish and evolve the HR technology architecture, ensuring scalable, future-proof solutions across the people value chain.
* Lead governance, ways of working, and prioritization for HR technology and AI initiatives to maximize business impact.
* Build strong people analytics and workforce insights capabilities, enabling data-driven decision-making and organizational effectiveness.
* Drive transformation, adoption, and change management to ensure HR tech initiatives deliver real value and a strong digital employee experience.
* Collaborate across IT, Finance, Legal, Communications, and external partners to successfully deliver complex, cross-functional initiatives.


**About You**
 You bring a strong IT or technology background, supported by a degree within IT, computer science, engineering, or an MBA, combined with solid business acumen that enables you to translate HR needs into effective, scalable technology solutions. You have proven experience working with HR in transformation initiatives and a deep understanding of organizational processes, operating models, and business strategy, reflecting an MBA-level mindset.
   

  

 You have led HR Tech and AI roadmaps and execution in an international context, supported by a strong grasp of systems architecture and emerging technologies such as AI, APA, and cloud-based solutions. Demonstrated experience in project and program leadership is essential. Experience across HR systems, integrations, data, analytics, and AI solutions is highly valued.
   

  

 As a person, you are driven, proactive, and confident in challenging the status quo. You bring an analytical, data-driven mindset, translating insights into decisions that create real organizational impact. You are a highly effective communicator and influencer, with proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and manage stakeholders at all levels. With a visionary outlook, you anticipate future needs and design solutions accordingly, while also understanding the importance of user experience and simplified, intuitive processes in systems design. You thrive in ambiguity and are motivated by the opportunity to shape and build, rather than maintain, a role.
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 —At Alleima, your passion and dedication to our cause are not just recognized – they're celebrated. You are part of a larger vision, fostering mutual respect, personal growth, and unwavering support.
   

  

 —Join us as we continue to chart this course toward a future of innovation and sustainable advancement. At Alleima, we're not just making steel – we're making history.
   

  

**—Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package.**
**Other Information:**
*We do not wish to be contacted by recruitment agencies or other sales-oriented consultants regarding this position.* 
*In connection with our hiering process we do drugtesting according to our rutines for workplace safety procedur.*
**For questions regarding the position and the process, please contact:**
 Sara Kühner, primary reqruiter, +46 76 495 02 40
   

  

**Union Contacts**
 Maria Sundqvist, Akademikerföreningen, +46 70 651 73 81
   

  

 Kjell-Åke Klockervold, Ledarna, +46 70 314 24 43
   

  

 Mikael Larsson, Unionen, +46 70 307 30 48
   

  

**Please apply before 2026-02-08**
 At Alleima, our mission is much more than delivering high-quality products, technology, and processes - working together to develop solutions based on our customer’s needs and thus achieve our business goals, is a better way to describe our daily work.With curious employees and safety as our priority, we create a work environment where you can develop both personally and professionally.
   

  

 With a clear direction for our journey ahead, utilizing our position as a technology leader, progressive customer partner, and sustainability driver, we aim to become an even stronger company in our industry.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on this challenge together with us? Join us on our journey! www.alleima.com

title: H&M Summer Internship – Fashion Design
description:
Curious about what it’s like to see the world of Fashion Design at H&M? Are you eager to get hands-on experience and turn your theoretical knowledge into practical skills. If you are intrigued by how the world’s largest fashion brand operates, then this opportunity is for you! Level up your learning journey and gain those essential skills that will benefit
   

  





 As a Fashion Design
 **Intern** 
 at H&M, you will get the opportunity to spend 11 weeks learning about our business and different functions while getting real-life experience working on current projects. Additionally, it’s a great networking opportunity to collaborate with colleagues across the company and connect with interns from other programs to explore the versatility of our business.
   

  





 During the internship, you will get to work next to a Senior Fashion Designer who will play a key role in developing your skills and offer different training opportunities. You will have a network of support from experienced colleagues that will be on hand to help you learn.
   

  





***This is your chance to launch a stellar career and help us transform the fashion world. Let’s shape the future together!***
  

  

  





  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**What you’ll be doing**



* Working alongside our Designers to design and develop commercial fashion collections for our global customers.
* Designing with a variety of software including Adobe Creative Suite, 3D CLO, Shima and more.
* Working with materials, color libraries, trims, and prints.



**What you’ll be learning:**



* Learning about our design process and working method of H&M.
* Learning how to translate trend vision into commercial products and collections.
* Collaborating with an experienced design team.
* Communication skills in a multicultural work environment.



  

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 To be successful in the role as Fashion Design Intern, we believe that you are:
   

  




* A student studying studying Fashion Design in their 2nd year of BA or 1st year of MA studies.
* A creative and curious mindset with a passion for researching upcoming global fashion trends.
* Excited to learn and self-motivated to drive design tasks in an entrepreneurial setting.
* An inspirational team player and have a creative solution orientated approach.
* Passion for style, creativity, and culture.
* Interest in commercial fashion.
* Driven and able to take on own initiatives.
* Collaborative team player who brings diverse and global perspectives.
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal and with excellent communication skills.


**Additional Information**

 This is a
 **full-time internship** 
 located at our Head Office in Stockholm. We are looking for someone to start from 9th June for 11 weeks until 21st August.
   

  

  

  

**Good to know – Application & Practical Information**




 Excited to join us?
   

  

**Please send your application asap including CV and relevant Portfolio work** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading) Portfolio should include vision/mood boards, full design process and final collection/s. All documents should be in English. We would like see work that shows your creative aspirational side and also your sense for commercial fashion.
   

  

  

  

 The last day to apply is 31st January. Due to GDPR we can only handle applications via our career site.
   

  





*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*




**Benefits**




 This is a paid internship program, meaning you will work full-time and receive a market-based salary. Other H&M Group benefits will be shared later in the process. This position requires a valid permit to live and work in Sweden.
   

  





**Recruitment Process & Timeline**




 When you apply for the Fashion Design internship role, we will have the following steps in the process:
   

  





**Screening questions:** 
 when you apply, you will be asked to answer a few short questions to assess your eligibility for the role.
   

  





**Virtual Assessment Center:** 
 if successful, you will be invited to a one-day assessment center, taking place between February 16th and March 3rd, including a behavioral interview and a case & competence interview. Details and preparations will be shared in advance.
   

  





**Final decision:** 
 our goal is to be able to let you know the outcome of the assessment center before March 13th.
   

  





**Inclusion & Diversity**
  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

title: Digital Sales Specialist
description:
Do you want to directly influence online sales and customer journeys across three Nordic markets? In this role, you will drive digital merchandising, optimize product visibility and ensure that campaigns and launches perform at their best – combining data, creativity and commercial thinking to create measurable impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Digital Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for how products and campaigns are presented in digital channels across Finland, Norway and Sweden. Your mission is to ensure strong product visibility, smooth purchase flows and high-performing campaigns that drive conversion and revenue.
   

  

 You will work hands-on in CMS and other digital tools, optimizing content, product presentation and customer journeys based on data and performance insights. The role offers a strong commercial focus and close collaboration with marketing, sales, analytics and local market teams.
   

  

 This role will be based in Sweden at one of our offices in Gothenburg or Solna
   

  

 What makes this role exciting:
   

  

* You influence online sales performance directly
* You work across three Nordic markets
* You combine data, merchandising and customer experience
* You optimize real customer journeys end-to-end
* You see tangible results from your work


 Key areas of responsibility include:
   

  

* Managing digital merchandising and product presentation across channels
* Updating and optimizing product and campaign content in CMS and other digital tools
* Ensuring strong execution of campaigns and product launches
* Monitoring and optimizing KPIs such as traffic, user engagement and campaign performance
* Collaborating with marketing, sales and analytics teams to improve performance
* Building effective content and purchase flows for partners
* Executing personalization tactics in digital channels, following local markets, bringing insight and execute conversion optimization actions.


**About You**
 You are commercially minded, data-driven and enjoy working close to performance and results. You like being hands-on in digital tools and thrive in roles where optimization and continuous improvement are part of everyday work.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* Experience from digital merchandising or Commerce
* Strong skills in CMS, digital commerce platforms and analytics tools
* Experience working with personalization is considered a plus
* Understanding of Nordic or international markets
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to work across teams and markets
* A proactive mindset and ability to adapt to changing priorities


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application in english latest on February 8th. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Mari Silvennoinen at mari.silvennoinen@fortum.com. .
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page** 
**.**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Regional Sales Director, Nordics
description:
Regional Sales Director
   

  

 The Regional Sales Director leads a team of Account Managers who sell our full suite of products including licenses, support, training, and consulting services for the Nordics region. You will use your and our experience with structured sales techniques that span the entire sales cycle: From identification and qualification of opportunities; to business development; and order fulfilment, helping your team over-achieve their sales goals.
   

  

**Our Ideal Candidate**
 We are seeking an experienced Regional Sales Director to develop our Accounts across the Nordic region. You will report to the GVP of UK&I Sales Leader. This will include managing and growing a team of 6+ Accounts Sales Executives. You will generate growth within new and existing customers and have a track record in hyper-growth sales teams. You will manage a team to a bold target with expectations to overachieve.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have experience managing Software Sales teams that are selling complex Integration, Cloud, Big Data, Data Governance and/or SaaS into corporate companies.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 You will develop and execute a strategic and comprehensive business plan for your region. Your focus is to build positive relationships with your direct reports and to develop them to surpass their sales goals. You will take full responsibility for accurate forecasting and quarterly revenue delivery. A significant portion of your will be invested with your team in the field visiting existing customers, and building relations with potential accounts, whilst aligning with strategic partners.
   

  

**Other Responsibilities Include The Following**
* Be an Informatica ambassador within accounts, maximizing our brand recognition and mindshare at all levels, evangelizing our solution and publicizing success stories
* As a Regional Sales Director you will be expected to exceed territory growth, revenue quota, and customer satisfaction goals
* Hire and build out the team
* Lead a customer-focused team of Strategic Accounts Sales Executives to deliver customer business value and develop customer relationships
* Build awareness for Informatica in target accounts across the Region
* Collaborate with other departments to develop an impactful sales strategy for enhancing the company's growth
* Create value selling in multiple negotiations
* Assist in pricing strategy
* Ensure prospecting, up selling/cross selling, and pipeline development
* Maintain implementation of effective sales processes for optimum performance and success of the organization
* Keep a pulse on the market: Know the landscapes and trends that may shift tactical budgets and strategic directions of accounts
* Build relationships with our partners


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of successful enterprise software sales/sales management with personal experience closing high value software deals and a history of exceeding targets
* Knowledge of how software is positioned and sold to line of business, IT and procurement executives
* Previous Sales Methodology training
* Experience building organisations and hiring and training top talent
* Track record of over-achieving quota in past opportunities
* Negotiate mutually agreeable outcomes with customers and internal stakeholders
* University degree or equivalent practical experience

title: Lärarvikarie till Nordic International Essingen
description:
*Observera: Detta är en intresseanmälan för att ingå i vår vikariepool. Vi rekryterar löpande till poolen för att snabbt kunna täcka upp vid behov av korttidsvikarier. Det innebär att du inte nödvändigtvis kommer att bli kontaktad direkt efter att du skickat in din ansökan, utan vi återkommer till dig endast om och när ett behov uppstår som matchar din profil.*
 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 🌟 Som lärarvikarie på vår grundskola kommer du att bidra med ditt engagemang och intresse för att säkerställa att varje elev når sin maximala potential. Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med ett team av hängivna pedagoger för att skapa en inspirerande och inkluderande utbildningsmiljö.
   

  

 🌟 Du ansvarar för att genomföra (och ibland också att planera) undervisning i olika ämnen beroende på behov. Du kommer att behöva vara flexibel och snabbt kunna anpassa dig för att möta elevernas varierande behov och förmågor.
   

  

 🌟 Du kommer att ingå i vår vikariepool och kan kontaktas för framtida uppdrag.
   

  

 För att ansöka vill vi att du har
   

  

 ✔ Erfarenhet från arbete som lärare.
   

  

 ✔ Intresse för att arbeta i en dynamisk och mångkulturell skola.
   

  

 ✔ Grundläggande kunskaper och färdigheter inom IT samt vana att arbeta i olika IT-system.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen vet vi att du är
   

  

 ✔ Utbildad lärare, alternativt lärarstudent under utbildning.
   

  

 ✔ En ledare som intuitivt kan skapa ordning och struktur i klassrummet.
   

  

 ✔ Bra på att samarbeta och bygga goda relationer med elever och kollegor.
   

  

 ✔ Lojal med ett stort hjärta för utbildning och pedagogik.
   

  

 Villkor

* Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse.
* Tjänstgöringsgrad: Vid behov.

title: Customer Journey Orchestration Manager
description:
Do you want to shape how thousands of customers experience a brand – across every touchpoint, every channel, and every moment that matters?
   

  

 In this role, you will own the end-to-end customer journey and turn insight into action, creating experiences that are intuitive, emotionally engaging and truly impactful. If you are passionate about customer-centricity, design thinking and real business impact, this is a role where your work will be felt every day.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Customer Journey Orchestration Manager, you will lead and orchestrate the end-to-end customer journey across channels and lifecycle stages. Your mission is to ensure that every interaction feels coherent, accessible and meaningful – reducing friction and strengthening customer satisfaction.
   

  

 You will define the journey vision, align cross-functional teams and use insights from brand, market and customer data to continuously improve experiences. The role sits at the intersection of strategy, design, insight and collaboration, offering both influence and ownership.
   

  

 You will translate customer insights into concrete journey improvements through wireframes, prototypes and design concepts, and validate solutions through usability testing and user research. Working closely with stakeholders across the organization, you will help embed a truly customer-centric way of working.
   

  

 This role can be located in any of our main offices in Sweden, Finland and Norway.
   

  

*What makes this role exciting:*
* You own the end-to-end customer journey vision
* You influence how experiences are designed across channels
* You work hands-on with journey mapping, prototyping and testing
* You act as a strategic partner to leaders across the business
* You drive initiatives that directly improve customer satisfaction and loyalty


*Key areas of responsibility include:*
* Designing consistent customer experiences across channels and journeys
* Ensuring alignment between internal processes and customer experience
* Translating customer insights into wireframes, mockups and prototypes
* Conducting usability testing and user interviews to validate decisions
* Identifying and quantifying business value opportunities within journeys
* Collaborating with data, MarTech, and analytics teams to operationalize personalization within journey logic
* Service Blueprinting, ensuring that experience design aligns with operational and technical realities


**About You**
 You are a customer experience professional who combines strategic thinking with hands-on execution. You are comfortable navigating complexity, influencing stakeholders and turning insight into practical solutions.
   

  

*We believe you bring:*
* Deep experience in journey design and service design
* Fluency in data, insights and experimentation
* A customer-obsessed mindset
* Experience building and socializing journey frameworks
* Experience in go-to-market environments (B2C, B2B or B2B2C)
* Strong communication skills and the ability to influence without formal authority
* Experience collaborating across functions and leading initiatives
* Fluency in English, and fluency in Swedish, Norwegian or Finnish


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your CV in English by 8th of February 2026 at the latest . We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Pål Gravdahl at pal.gravdahl@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to Swedish union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated
   

  

 emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Digital Channel Manager
description:
Do you want to own and shape the digital storefront across multiple markets – ensuring a seamless, high-quality customer experience every time someone visits the website? In this role, you will be the ultimate owner of the web channel, with real influence over structure, content, governance and commercial performance across markets and languages.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Digital Channel Manager, you will have end-to-end business ownership of the organization’s web presence. Your mission is to ensure that the digital experience is unified, continuously improving and commercially effective across all markets and language versions.
   

  

 You will define the structure, governance and standards for the web, balancing global consistency with local market needs. This is a role with strong ownership, where you both set direction and ensure execution – from roadmap priorities to execution quality.
   

  

 You will work closely with eCommerce, marketing, content creation, product and local teams, acting as the central point of coordination for all web-related decisions.
   

  

 This role can be based in any of our main offices in Sweden, Finland or Norway.
   

  

*What makes this role exciting:*
* You manage our digital channels, like web and apps across markets and languages
* You define standards, structure and governance for the digital experience
* You influence both strategic direction and operational execution
* You drive commercial impact through continuous optimization
* You work at the intersection of CX, content, technology and business


*Key areas of responsibility include:*
* Acting as the business owner of the web and its commercial development
* Defining and coordinating global and local web structure and content
* Prioritizing and owning the roadmap for digital improvements
* Ensuring consistent execution across all markets and languages
* Driving strong web governance, standards and best practices
* Coordinating closely with content creators, product owners and local teams
* Overseeing continuous improvement of user experience and commercial performance


**About You**
 You are structured, confident in ownership, and comfortable making decisions that impact large-scale digital experiences. You enjoy balancing strategic thinking with operational detail and thrive in cross-functional collaboration.
   

  

*We believe you bring:*
* Experience in web governance, digital content management and multi-market web operations
* Strong understanding of personalization and customer experience principles
* Experience working with CMS platforms, like Contentful. Experience from Enoro is considered a strong merit
* Strong decision-making, communication and stakeholder management skills
* A commercial mindset and understanding of how digital channels drive business impact


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest on February 8, 2026. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Mari Silvennoinen at mari.silvennoinen@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: STORAGE & BACKUP ENGINEER TILL BANKGIROT
description:
*Bankgirot söker en Storage & Backup Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.*
*Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Som Storage & Backup Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.*
**Din roll**
 Som Engineer med inriktning mot storage och backup blir du en central del i uppbyggnaden och vidareutvecklingen av Bankgirots lagrings- och backuplösningar. Vi arbetar med moderna och skalbara enterprise-lösningar med fokus på enkelhet, säkerhet och långsiktig hållbarhet.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du arbetar med Bankgirots lagringsplattformar i ett brett infrastruktursammanhang, där du tillsammans med teamet ansvarar för att lösningarna är stabila, redundanta och anpassade för en affärskritisk verksamhet. Eftersom Bankgirot hanterar stora mängder information som behöver lagras under lång tid, arbetar vi främst med robusta och säkra on-prem-lösningar, i kombination med inslag av hybrid- och molnteknik.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Implementation och vidareutveckling av storage- och backuplösningar
* Införande av nya arkiv- och lagringslösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov
* Hantering av block-, objekt- och filbaserad lagring (SAN/NAS)
* Incident- och förändringshantering kopplat till lagringsmiljöer
* Delta i arbete kring återställning och test av lösningar
* Dokumentation av lösningar och arbetssätt


**Vi söker dig som har**
 Vi söker dig som har minst några års erfarenhet av arbete med storage och backup inom infrastruktur i professionella IT-miljöer och som vill fortsätta utvecklas inom området. Det viktigaste för oss är inte exakt hur många år du arbetat, utan att du har jobbat brett med lagrings- och backuplösningar och har förståelse för helheten i en IT-miljö – hur plattformar, drift, säkerhet och tillgänglighet hänger ihop.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna lagrings- och backuplattformar, gärna i miljöer med höga krav på stabilitet och redundans. Du har varit delaktig i implementation, förändring eller migrering av system och har praktisk förståelse för återställning och test av lösningar (restore).
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har ett generalistiskt mindset inom infrastruktur, är nyfiken på automatisering och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera operativt tekniskt arbete med att vara med och påverka hur plattformar utvecklas över tid.
   

  

 Du är också bekväm i en säkerhetsmedveten och affärskritisk miljö där tillgänglighet, stabilitet och kvalitet är avgörande.
   

  

**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner**
 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller 0730821230
   

  

 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
   

  

 Om Bankgirot
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
   

  

 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Sales Executive - Public
description:
Join GlobalConnect’s Public Sales Team
   

  

 Can you sell network solutions, IT security, outsourcing, and data communication to the public sector?
   

  

 GlobalConnect is strengthening its focus on the public market and is now looking for a Sales Executive to join our Public Sales team. In this role, you will both handle existing public portfolio customers and drive proactive outreach in order to build strong relationships with municipalities and other public institutions across Sweden.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Proactively identify, engage and develop new prospects within the public sector
* Plan and execute outreach sales activities
* Actively participate in bid and tender processes, incl. EU tenders
* Secure high customer satisfaction throughout the sales process
* Collaborate closely with colleagues across the organization
* Work in a strong commercial team with skilled and supportive peers
* Stay updated on market and technology developments — and share your knowledge


**Your professional profile**
 There are several paths into this role. You may already have industry experience and be ready to operate independently from day one.
   

  

 Alternatively, you have a solid background in solution sales of complex products or services, preferably to the public sector or in environments where you sell bundled solutions.
   

  

 You understand how modern technology and digital infrastructure create value for public customers — and you can communicate that value clearly, convincingly and with impact.
   

  

**Your personal qualities**
* Proactive with a high level of energy
* Strong commercial mindset and a clear “can-do” attitude
* Curious about customer needs and market opportunities
* Skilled in building and maintaining long-term relationships
* Results-oriented and motivated by winning new business
* A true team player
* Enjoys a Nordic work culture with social events and an informal tone


**Why join us?**
 At GlobalConnect, you become part of a Nordic challenger shaping the future of digital infrastructure. You will join a team that values collaboration, professionalism and empowerment — and where your efforts have direct business impact.
   

  

 If this sounds like the right match, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Apply now**
 We are looking for a Sales Executive who thrives in customer-facing roles and loves bringing in new business.
   

  

 If you are eager to make a difference in the public market, don’t hesitate to apply — we look forward to meeting you.
   

  

**No need for a personal letter** 
 – just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Back End (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 5+ years of experience developing performance-critical applications in a production environment using Scala, Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or relevant modern programming languages.
* Strong RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or other).
* Ability to design and implement scalable architectures
* Deeply involved in hands-on coding, developing and maintaining high-quality software solutions on a daily basis
* Good command of the English language.
* Engages in cross-team collaborations to ensure cohesive solutions
* Implement advanced CI/CD pipelines and robust testing strategies to ensure seamless integration, deployment, and high code quality.
* Passion for software development and continuous improvement of your knowledge and skills.


**It’s Great if You Have**
* Knowledge in NoSQL, Queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), and Play framework.


 #newdelhi #Pune #Hyderabad #Bangalore #Mumbai #Bengaluru #Chennai #Kolkata #Lucknow #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #mexico #sydney #melbourne #toronto #vancouver #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen#estonia #paris #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #kualalumpur #dublin #berlin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #moscow #saintpetersburg #capetown #johannesburg #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #bangkok #chiangmai #phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #kiev #hcmc #hanoi #hochimin #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #dhaka #islamabad #IT #ENG #4
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Business Development Manager (Gaming)
description:
**Do you have existing sales experience within the localisation services industry serving the Gaming or the Entertainment sector?** 
 Are you looking for a role where you can exhibit the utmost integrity, deliver the highest quality, provide outstanding service, act as if you own it, work with a sense of urgency, treat everyone with respect, operate as a cohesive team, celebrate diversity, be financially responsible, achieve results - then we'd like to hear from you and we're recruiting across all of our European locations.
 



  





 Position Summary: The main focus of the role is to utilise your existing knowledge and experience of the localisation industry to develop new business relationships and new accounts via a direct sales approach, with full responsibility of the process from lead generation through to close and full account ownership.
 



  





 Key position responsibilities:
 


* Create effective approaches to drive new revenue and close new business
* Identify, qualify, develop, and close sales opportunities
* Develop an effective understanding of the capabilities, benefits, and competitive advantages of TransPerfect services
* Identify prospective leads; develop new client relationships via cold calling, internet research, networking events, trade shows and direct marketing
* Promote TransPerfect by educating clients on the company’s various services
* Present TransPerfect solutions via one-on-one, group, online and in-person meetings
* Manage and control pricing and contractual issues by developing a thorough understanding of company procedures
* Provide customer support and manage client expectations
* Quote, manage and bill projects on a daily basis, coordinating with clients and production teams to ensure these run smoothly and profitably



  





**Essential skills required:** 



* Commit to a high level of integrity and service
* Deliver quality work
* Service focused with a desire to exceed clients’ expectations
* Owning your performance and taking responsibility
* Multitask and work with a sense of urgency in a fast-paced environment
* Commit to always treating everyone (from clients to co-workers to vendors to business partners) with the ultimate level of respect
* Work well in a team with people from a variety of different backgrounds and cultures
* Build and maintain strategic relationships with clients and co-workers
* Celebrate diversity and embrace new ideas and differing perspectives
* Be financially responsible and make sound financial decisions
* Take active measures to achieve results and solve problems



  





**Essential experience required:** 



* 2+ years achieving sales targets within the localisation industry
* 1+ years sales experience serving the Gaming or the Entertainment sector
* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent



  





*TransPerfect values equal opportunities. Applicants are therefore considered regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnic origin, skin colour, religion, belief, descent, genes, disabilities, sexual orientation, marital status or other characteristics worthy of protection. Applicants with disabilities are welcome and encouraged. If you experience any issues with your application process or require assistance please contact careers@transperfect.com.* 




  





**By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting**

title: Hotel Manager (m/f/d)
description:
**At Ruby, your personality really matters, your time really matters, and we strongly believe we groove way better** 
**together. At Ruby, we keep breaking new ground.**
 Hey Sunshine,
   

  

 You think travelling is more than just the next summer holiday, but the
 **feeling of being at home anywhere in the world** 
 ? That your workplace should be a place with
 **personality and soul** 
 , where new ideas come to life? Then you are the missing olive in our Martini, the missing melody in our music and the heartbeat of our
 **Ruby Frida** 
 .
   

  

 Our Ruby Frida dances to the rhythm of Stockholm – a city that never stands still, reinventing itself while staying true to its roots. From ABBA’s timeless melodies to the bold grooves born at nearby Cheiron Studios, we’ve blended Sweden’s crisp modernism with playful retro touches and Stockholm’s swinging ’60s pop scene. It’s a place to unwind, tune into the local beat, and feel the city’s cultural pulse. With 187 rooms, Ruby Frida rises in Kungsholmen, just steps from Fridhemsplan station. From here, Stockholm’s Old Town, lively café culture, green parks and glittering waterways are all within easy reach.
   

  

 We are a fast-growing hospitality group with existing hotels and workspaces in some of
 **Europe's most exciting locations** 
 and many more projects under construction. We
 **break new ground** 
 with our
 **Lean Luxury philosophy** 
 , creating a contemporary and affordable form of luxury.
   

  

**Join us and make it your own story**
**Trust Us, You Won't Get Bored, As You**
* represent your hotel as the go-to person for your team, our guests, and external service providers and partners in all matters
* build a strong team by taking charge of recruitment, onboarding, and development while fostering a positive and collaborative working atmosphere
* roll up your sleeves because you’re not just a manager but an active part of the team – leading by example 😉
* keep a sharp eye on the numbers, stick to the set budgets, and manage forecasting and cost control with precision
* spot trends, streamline processes, and stay ahead of the game with strategic planning to keep your hotel moving forward
* make sure everything runs smoothly by ensuring compliance with HACCP, occupational safety, fire protection, and other legal requirements
* bring the Ruby Spirit to life by implementing our internal styles and maintaining quality standards.
* work closely with your Cluster Manager and all relevant departments at the Corporate Office to stay aligned and connected


**We've Been Waiting For You, Since You Have/are**
* completed professional training in the hotel industry and/or hold a degree in hospitality or business administration
* extensive experience in an operational leadership role or a similar position in lifestyle hospitality or gastronomy
* strong knowledge of POS, PMS, and business management.
* a motivating and charismatic leader and with your authentic and loyal nature both team lead and team player
* a warm and welcoming personality and your communication skills allow you to shine in every interaction
* a knack for charming guests, with a hands-on mentality to match
* speaking fluent in Swedish and English


**What's in for you? That's how we groove:**
**Ruby, Ruby, Ruby**
* your style, your smile, your ideas – bring your personality to work. Maybe even with a new tattoo, piercing or hair colour on us?
* better together – at work, during team events or just because it’s Monday 😉


**'Cause I'm having a good time**
* sip, snack, repeat - with your Ruby F&B-Credit
* no more excuses – we support your sports program
* LEGEN...wait for it...DARY staff rates - for you and your travel buddy


**Money, Money, Money**
* no matter how you get to work – a mobility allowance comes on top
* take it to the next level – secure yourself some extra cash through talent scouting, positive reviews and an individual bonus agreement


**Ain't no mountain high enough**
* level up your game – trainings, coaching, and mentoring, you get the chance to grow, just like Ruby does
* innovation is part of our DNA – Lean Luxury, paperless, cashless, … you name it


**Where have you been so long?**
 Whether you’re a
 **social butterfly** 
 with a flair for cocktail-shaking, a creative soul with an eye for design, or a pro at planning and
 **behind-the-scenes magic** 
 - there’s a place for you at Ruby. We’re always looking for
 **friendly faces** 
 and
 **passionate team players** 
 .
   

  

 Not perfect CVs, but
 **great personalities** 
 , who’ll help us create hotels and workspaces with
 **character and soul** 
 . So, whatever makes you tick, join us and start your Ruby story.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We believe that...
   

  

* you can love whoever you want to
* you should decide for yourself whether and with which pronouns you would like to be addressed
* you can be proud of your heritage and culture
* you don't have to justify your religion or world view
* you are good, just as you are and make our team and Ruby's diversity unique


 We can't deal with: isms
   

  

 Racism, sexism, heterosexism, antisemitism, and such kind of isms are not tolerated here.
   

  

 If You Want To Know What To Expect, Listen To Ang From Our Cluster In London. You Can Find Even More Ruby Stories Here
   

  

 www.ruby-hotels.com/stories
   

  

 Get to know our People & Culture Team
   

  

 Any questions about our pitch? Then contact us at jobs@ruby-hotels.com or +49 89 125 095 220.
   

  

 Your Ruby Recruitment Team

title: Digital Marketing Manager, Sweden Lead
description:
Do you want to shape the digital marketing agenda for one of the Nordics’ most recognized brands – and see the direct impact of your work on growth, visibility and business results?
   

  

 In this role, you will own and drive the digital marketing strategy for Sweden, combining strategic thinking with hands-on execution across channels. If you thrive in a role where you get real responsibility, freedom to influence, and the opportunity to build strong stakeholder relationships – this might be your next step.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Digital Marketing Manager, Sweden Lead, you will play a key role in strengthening brand visibility, driving targeted web traffic, and increasing online sales and lead generation across the Nordic markets – with a specific responsibility for Sweden.
   

  

 You will develop and execute digital marketing initiatives across multiple channels, continuously monitor performance, and refine campaigns to maximize impact. The role combines strategic ownership with operational execution, giving you both influence and visibility in the organization.
   

  

 You will also act as the main marketing contact for local business units in Sweden, representing marketing in go-to-market discussions and ensuring alignment between global strategy and local market needs.
   

  

 The position is located in any of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg.
   

  

*What makes this role exciting:*
* You own the digital marketing agenda for Sweden
* You influence both strategy and execution
* You work with complex, high-impact campaigns across markets
* You collaborate closely with stakeholders across functions and geographies
* You have real opportunities to develop new methods, tools and approaches in digital marketing


*Key areas of responsibility include:*
* Developing and executing digital marketing strategy across the Nordics
* Driving marketing qualified lead generation in the Nordic markets
* Coordinating and executing marketing activities for Sweden
* Planning, managing and optimizing global and local marketing budgets
* Leading complex campaign planning and stakeholder collaboration
* Driving continuous improvement in tools, methods and performance


**About You**
 You are a strategic yet hands-on digital marketer who enjoys ownership, complexity and collaboration. You combine analytical thinking with creativity, and you feel confident influencing stakeholders at different levels.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* Proven experience in creating impactful digital marketing results
* At least 3 years experience from similar roles
* Strong track record in lead generation using segmented and personalized online marketing
* Experience from large scale MQL generation
* Experience working with modern digital marketing tools, platforms and tactics
* Experience from implementing large-scale A/B testing processes (strong advantage)
* A relevant university degree and at least five years of experience within digital marketing
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build trust across cross-functional teams
* A proactive, structured and solution-oriented mindset


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your CV in English by 8th of February 2026 at the latest. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Jonas Levin at jonas.levin@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated
   

  

 emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Teknisk testare till Folksam
description:
Vill du arbeta i ett agilt team där kvalitet, samarbete och moderna arbetssätt står i centrum? Hos oss på Folksam får du en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av våra systemlösningar för tjänste- och avtalspension – där du tillsammans med dina kollegor skapar trygghet för miljoner kunder. Här kan du vara med och bidra till att göra skillnad!
 



  





**Det här gör du som senior testare på Folksam** 




 Du blir en central person i teamet som arbetar med Folksams målsystem för premiebestämda produkter – Lumera, ett av marknadens ledande försäkringssystem. Tillsammans med vår applikations- och driftleverantör säkerställer du att våra lösningar håller hög kvalitet genom hela livscykeln.
 



  





 Som senior testare kommer du bland annat att:
 


* Skriva och vidareutveckla testfall samt ta fram körplaner.
* Leda och delta i möten kopplade till testdesign, planering och genomförande.
* Genomföra tester av nya releaser från Lumera, integrationer och förändringar i våra system.
* Arbeta med testmiljöer, körscheman, testdata och testrapporter.
* Bidra i större förändringsprojekt som migreringar och systemförflyttningar.
* Vara en viktig del av teamets dagliga arbete och stötta där det behövs – även utanför det traditionella testområdet.



  





 Planering, koordinering och genomförande av test är en naturlig del av din vardag, där du rör dig obehindrat mellan tekniska och mer verksamhetsnära frågor.
 



  





 Har du den personlighet och professionella kapacitet vi söker? Då erbjuder vi många karriärmöjligheter i ett ansvarstagande företag. Vi på avdelningen IT Liv & Pension ansvarar bl.a. för utveckling och drift av Folksams och dotterbolagens IT-system. Arbetet bedrivs i mycket nära samarbete med affärsverksamheten.
 



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vi söker dig som är en trygg och erfaren testare – van vid att arbeta strukturerat, driva testfrågor och koordinera både kollegor, testdata och testmiljöer. Du trivs i en miljö där du får kombinera noggrannhet med samarbete och problemlösning.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att
 


* skriva testfall, ta fram körplaner, ladda testmiljöer, strukturera och genomföra tester
* samordna test och driva testarbete (kollegor, testdata och testmiljöer)
* arbeta nära verksamheten men även med externa leverantörer
* erfarenhet av tjänste- och avtalspension eller liknande område.



 Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med systemet Lumera och med migrering av försäkringssystem.
 



  





 Du har en stark drivkraft, tar ansvar och har lätt för att både ge och be om stöd när det behövs. Du är prestigelös, flexibel och uppskattar att arbeta i ett tvärfunktionellt team med nära kontakt med verksamheten och våra externa leverantörer.
 



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på
 
 folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 




  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast 11 februari 2026.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Olof Nilsson 070-580 00 98.
 



  





 Fackliga kontaktpersoner: Forena Mari Leppioja 070-831 54 29, Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.

title: Sales Manager - Europe
description:
**Sales Manager – Europe: Floor-care, air-care, Small Domestic Appliances & Consumables & Accessories**
**Shape the future. Bring your potential to life.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 The European Sales Manager is responsible for driving profitable growth and market share across Europe within the “Wellbeing” (floorcare/vacuum cleaning, air conditioners, air purification), Small Domestic Appliances and the Consumables & Accessories segment. The role ensures consistent strategic alignment with central category objectives, local commercial execution, and key customer partnerships.
