title: Mobile App Platform Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of banks, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*

**In brief**  

  

At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.

 **This is part of the role**  

  

Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a week.  

  

**This is you**


To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our mobile technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.

**As a mobile app platform engineer, you:**

* Are confident in mobile development. Our tech stack includes JavaScript/TypeScript, React Native, Redux, RTK Query, Testing library, MSW, React Navigation, GitHub actions and Expo
* Have a birds eye perspective when setting the architecture for the future
* Are motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Are eager to automate things

**A bonus is if you:**

* Are knowledgeable in Java and Terraform
* Are interested or have experience with the rest of the tech stack, which includes GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes and ArgoCD

**Nordnetters**

* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure

**What we offer**

* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)


We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working. Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do. We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on: **www.nordnetab.com**  

  

**Questions & applications**  

  

Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior Sales Specialist - Project Accounting
description:
*At Aceve, we empower the builders of society and transform the construction and skilled trades industry—one of the least digitalized sectors in Europe. As a united SaaS powerhouse, we bring together leading products into a single pioneering platform dedicated to making a difference.*  

  

*With over 900 passionate employees and more than €100 million in revenue, we blend tradition and innovation to reshape our industry’s future. Our cloud-based, AI-driven software solutions deliver actionable insights and drive improvements for construction companies and skilled tradespeople, enhancing project management, installations, maintenance, and services.*  

  

*On our ambitious growth journey, we are committed to winning together and accelerating digital transformation. With Aceve’s tools, our customers can boost their performance, productivity, and profitability, ensuring they thrive in a rapidly changing landscape.*  

  

*Join us in revolutionizing the industry and building a brighter future together!*

  

Är du en målinriktad och affärsdriven person med ekonomierfarenhet inom bygg som vill ta steget in i en säljroll och helhetsansvar för kunder? Då är detta rätt roll för dig. Bli en del av framtidens affärer!


Vi söker en strategisk och affärsdriven Senior Sales Specialist, som vill vara en nyckelspelare i att utveckla affären för vår produkt Tracked. Här får du möjlighet att både utveckla befintliga kunder och bidra till nya affärsmöjligheter, samtidigt som du blir en nyckelspelare i ett expansivt och innovativt bolag.

**Om Tracked**


Tracked är en innovativ lösning för att hantera projektredovisning inom bygg- och entreprenad. Produktens funktioner stödjer kunder i att effektivisera sina affärsprocesser och säkerställa framgångsrik användning av systemet. Genom Tracked kan företag optimera sina projekt och projektuppföljning genom prognoser och SVA beräkningar, vilket hjälper dem att spara tid och resurser.

 **Vad kommer du att göra?**

* Driva hela säljprocessen från leadsgenerering och behovsanalys till affärsavslut och uppföljning.
* Arbeta med både befintliga kunder och nykundsbearbetning, där du skapar och utvecklar långsiktiga affärsrelationer.
* Bli specialist på Tracked och dess produkter för att stötta interna säljare och befintliga kunder i att integrera och optimera användningen av systemet.
* Stötta andra affärsområden inom Aceve , vilket ger dig möjligheten att arbeta tvärfunktionellt med flera marknadsledande produkter.
* Samarbeta med Aceve övriga affärsområden för att skapa synergier och affärsmöjligheter.  

Arbeta med implementering av Tracked i kundens affärsprocesser.
* Konsultera kunder i redovisnings- och processfrågor relaterade till Tracked.

 **Vi söker dig som har:**

* Gedigen erfarenhet av ekonomiarbete inom byggsektorn. Gärna som controller eller byggprojektledare.
* En strategisk och rådgivande inställning som främjar långsiktiga kundrelationer.
* En hungrig och drivande personlighet med vilja att träda in i en säljroll.
* Starka självledarskapsförmågor och förmåga att leda affärer från början till slut.

**Not ticking every box?** No worries! We value potential and drive, so apply anyway or connect with us- you might be just what we're looking for in our growing organisation! Join Aceve and take your expertise to the next level, together we are redefining what’s possible in craft and construction solutions!

 *Aceve is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our selection process is conducted continuously and without discrimination, ensuring an equal opportunity for all candidates.*

title: Field Marketing Manager – Norden
description:
**Plats:** Stockholm (Hybrid/On-site)  

**Team:** Nordisk organisation – nära samarbete med säljteamet och globala marketingteamet

**Erfarenhet:** 5+ år inom B2B-marknadsföring

 **Om TP,** **www.tp.com**


TP är platsen där globala varumärken växer – och där kundupplevelser förvandlas till konkurrensfördelar. TP Norden är vi en del av ett internationellt tech- och tjänsteekosystem som hjälper företag att skapa starkare kundrelationer genom digital innovation, dataintelligens och service i världsklass. Vi arbetar med några av världens mest kända och snabbväxande varumärken inom finans, teknik, retail, media och även med nya start-ups i Sverige som vill expandera internationellt och med företag som etablerar sig i Sverige och övriga nordiska länder. Nu stärker vi vår position och accelererar vår tillväxtresa i Norden och söker därför en Field Marketing Manager som vill vara med och lyfta vår synlighet på marknaden, skärpa vår digitala närvaro och skapa ett starkt avtryck i Sverige och hela Norden – och marknadsföringen spelar en avgörande roll.

**Om rollen**


Som Field Marketing Manager Nordic, blir du den som formar hur TP syns, hörs och upplevs i Norden. Du arbetar nära vårt erfarna säljteam och våra europeiska marknadskollegor, och omsätter globala strategier till lokalt relevanta initiativ som stärker vår närvaro i Sverige, Danmark, Norge och Finland och generera leads till vårt säljteam. Rollen kombinerar kreativitet med affärsdriv och digital spets med lokal marknadskänsla. Här blir du varumärkesbärare i Norden – och dina insatser kommer att synas, märkas och driva resultat, tack vare din hands-on approach och passion för marknadsföring

**Dina ansvarsområden**

* Skapa content och budskap som stärker TP’s, synlighet och thought leadership i Norden
* Ansvara för och uppdatera nordiska webbsidor med relevant och konverterande innehåll
* Optimera digital synlighet (organiskt och paid) genom SEO, SEM, content och konverteringsarbete, inklusive ansvar för TP Nordics LinkedIn-närvaro
* Planera och genomföra kampanjer som driver pipeline, leads och kundengagemang
* Genomföra events, mässor, seminarier, branschaktiviteter och kundevent i Norden
* Skapa och anpassa säljmaterial: case, one-pagers, presentationer, pitch decks och RFP-underlag baserat på material från TP:s globala marknadsorganisation
* Lokalanpassa globala kampanjer till nordiska målgrupper
* Stödja säljteamet i social selling och Sales Navigator
* Driva marknadsaktiviteter i nära samarbete med sälj och europeiska marknadsteam
* Säkerställa att alla aktiviteter skapar engagemang, relationer och konkreta affärsresultat

 **Vi tror att du har:**

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av B2B-marknadsföring i en internationell eller komplex miljö
* God förståelse för det nordiska business-landskapet, särskilt Sverige
* Stark digital kompetens: SEO, SEM, webboptimering, digitala kampanjer och lead generation
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Salesforce/HubSpot, Google Ads, Google Analytics, LinkedIn Campaign Manager och gärna Adobe Creative Cloud
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av LinkedIn-marknadsföring och att bygga närvaro för B2B-varumärken
* Erfarenhet eller god insikt i outsourcing-, tjänste-, kontaktcenter- eller BPO-branschen (meriterande)
* Förmåga att samarbeta nära sälj och omsätta affärsbehov till konkreta marknadsaktiviteter
* Ett drivande, prestigelöst och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt
* En nyfikenhet på att ta ett större ansvar och utveckla din roll som marknadsförare
* Flytande tal och skrift i svenska, engelska och gärna finska, norska eller danska; engelska är vårt koncernspråk. Din svenskakunskap ska vara på copy-nivå

 **Du trivs hos oss om du**

* Vill utveckla både varumärke och affär
* Ser värdet av att sälj och marknad jobbar nära tillsammans
* Gillar att kombinera strategi med praktiskt genomförande; utveckla, göra och följa upp
* Vill ha stort ansvar och korta beslutsvägar i ett litet men erfaret team
* Trivs i en internationell miljö med många kontaktytor
* Motiveras av att skapa synliga, mätbara resultat

 **Vi erbjuder**

* En central roll i vår nordiska organisation och i TP Nordics tillväxtresa
* Tätt samarbete med erfarna säljkollegor och europeiska marknadsteam
* Möjlighet att påverka vår lokala marknadsstrategi och digitala närvaro
* En global och inkluderande företagskultur där innovation och människor står i fokus
* Flexibilitet och konkurrenskraftiga villkor


Redo att göra avtryck i Norden?

**Skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig**


Berätta gärna i din ansökan varför du tycker att TP och rollen är intressant för dig.


Den här rollen är viktig för oss, och därför rekryterar vi själva då relationer är viktiga för oss!


Ansökan redan idag, urval sker löpande! Kontaktperson för denna annons och tjänst är Katarina Zätterström, Head of Employee Experience Nordic.


katarina.zatterstrom@teleperformance.com

**Sista ansökningsdag 6:e februari.**

title: Team Manager - Collaboration
description:
**T E A M M A N A G E R**  

*Collaboration*  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent | Göteborg  

  

***DISCLAIMER: Please do not apply if you do not speak Swedish. This is a hard requirement for this position - thank you!***  



  

**A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and modern work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.  

Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft. (A large portion of this achievement can be attributed to the work of our engineers within our collaboration team, for their focus on Copilot)  

  

  

  

**W H A T W E N E E D**  

We are looking for a talented person within Collaboration services **(Microsoft 365, SharePoint, Teams, Copilot, Identity & Security)** who will take on technical and operational responsibility for the Collaboration Team.
  

We're looking for someone who comes from a background as an Engineer/Consultant, who has either recently taken a step into leadership, or would like to do so now.  

  

The split of management vs. technical delivery is **50/50%** for this position and so although managing your team will take up a sizeable portion of your work, you will still be expected to work as a technical consultant in some part. This is why we need someone who still has a foot into the tech, and really knows the ins and outs of the collaboration sphere  

  

*Note: We would prefer if this person was sitting in Goteborg, in order to be closer to the team.*  

  

**Examples of potential tasks:**  

* **1 to 1s** with your team members
* **Salary reviews/negotiations** each year
* **Recruitment:** Deciding on needs, working closely with our Head of Talent in the recruitment process, interviewing candidates, job offering
* **Pre-sale Engineering:** Providing technical guidance to both business managers and sales teams in customer discussions
* **Responsibility for Service Delivery:** Ensure optimal use of the teams competence into assignments and managed service delivery
* Working closely with Business Manager on strategy, and how best to implement for operational success.
* **Solution Architecture and/or technical implementation** within the collaboration sphere. You will either be in your own assignments part time, or focus on **customer management.**

  

  

**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our next Team Manager has:**  

* **6+ years** within the collaboration sphere (365, SharePoint, Teams, Entra ID, Identity)
* Previous consulting work and good experience with a variety of customers
* Experience with pre-sale, design & architecture
* A confident, senior presence in general

  

**It is a bonus if you have:**  

* Previous management/team leading experience (with positive results, of course!)
* An existing network of customers
* Worked as an Architect
 **We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes **responsibility** for their work
* Wants to get the best out of their team, and focuses on team career development and satisfaction
* Is **available** and **present** for their team members when needed


- Has good communication skills - is open, transparent and direct in their instruction  

* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish AND English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do

  

*Pictured: Jan Frick, Expert Engineer (left) and Victor Nasslander, Team Manager of Workspace (right)*

 **W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.  

  

**Super interesting colleagues**  

With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.  

With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we host **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.  

  

Last year, Xenit was awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

**Read more about Karriar Företagen** **here****.**

title: Head of Application Engineering & Integration Division – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Information Systems Directorate (IS), Business Technology Solutions Department\* (BTS), Application Engineering & Integration Division\* (AEI) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **Head of Application Engineering & Integration Division** 
 \*\*.
   

  

**This is a full-time position at grade 7 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* new name following Directorate reorganisation effective from March 2026
* internal benchmark Division Head IT Applications


***Applicants will receive initial feedback in February/March 2026***
***Assessment Centres for selected applicants would take place in March 2026***
***Panel interviews are anticipated for April 2026***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will take charge of our application engineering and integration capabilities, driving the platforms and practices that power the Bank’s digital transformation. You will also be in charge of a portfolio of bespoke business applications, ensuring they are engineered, maintained, and evolved in line with strategic, technical, and business expectations. You will unite integration operations, engineering enablement, innovation, and bespoke development under one vision, enabling impactful engineering solutions that accelerate the Bank’s digital journey.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of the Business Solutions Department and work closely with the other Heads of Divisions of the Directorate, as well as with business users who participate in projects and initiatives led by the Division.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Define and drive the Bank’s application engineering and integration strategy to support IT and digital transformation.
* Govern, together with EA, Bank‑wide engineering standards and best practices across all application technologies.
* Lead the development and continuous improvement of secure, scalable, and cost‑effective integration platforms.
* Build and run an engineering enablement function that provides frameworks, tools, and expert support.
* Ensure engineering standards are applied in practice by overseeing key bespoke or strategic developments.
* Ensure security, resilience, and risk mitigation across all application engineering and integration activities
* Monitor and manage projects and programmes to deliver expected benefits on time and within budget.
* Propose and maintain an effective structure, operating model, and performance framework for the Division.
* Recruit and develop skilled staff while fostering an inclusive, high‑performance engineering culture.
* Optimise technology and vendor landscapes to ensure value, compliance, and strong performance.
* Ensure reliable day‑to‑day services by promoting automation and DevSecOps across the application lifecycle.
* Represent the Division in cross‑functional initiatives to embed engineering, integration, and innovation perspectives.
* Track technology trends and scale relevant innovations to keep the Bank aligned with industry best practice.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer sciences, software engineering, information technology, or a closely related discipline.
* At least 10 years of progressive professional experience in application engineering, enterprise integration, or software development within large and complex IT environments, ideally in regulated or financial institutions.
* Experience in or proven ability for managing and coaching people ideally in multicultural environments or international organisations (e.g. contribution to: deciding on team resources and skills; establishing objectives; assessing performance; delegating and supervising tasks; guiding, motivating, coaching and providing feedback)
* Proven experience in defining and rolling out engineering standards, guidelines, and enablement frameworks across multiple application domains and technologies.
* Demonstrated experience in managing large-scale programmes, platforms, or portfolios covering application development, integration solutions, and shared engineering services.
* Extensive knowledge of modern application engineering and integration architectures, including APIs, event-driven and service-oriented architectures, middleware platforms, cloud and hybrid environments, and enterprise integration patterns.
* Strong expertise in software engineering best practices, including DevSecOps, CI/CD pipelines, automation, code quality, testing strategies, and lifecycle management across heterogeneous technology stacks would be an advantage.
* Proven experience in engineering enablement and innovation, including the definition of reference architectures, reusable frameworks, accelerators, and developer tooling across key technologies used by the Bank would be ideal.
* Excellent knowledge of English. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage\*\*\*.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core and managerial competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 **16th February 2026**

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


**About The Job**
 Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.
   

  

 As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on your customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development, and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day-to-day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.
   

  

 In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor.
   

  

 You will travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with support, engineers, and site reliability engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Join our team as a Product Marketing Manager at Simployer!
   

  

 Simployer is growing fast, our product portfolio is expanding, and we’re reaching more markets and customers every quarter. That growth comes with a clear need: product marketing that’s sharp, strategic, and rooted in real customer insight. We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager.
   

  

 You’re the kind of marketer who loves the moment when something complex suddenly feels obvious to a customer. You can find the sharp angle, tell the story clearly, and turn launches into real momentum. And here’s a big part of the journey ahead: we’re going all-in on AI.
   

  

 AI is becoming a key part of our products and how we work. That means you’ll have room (and expectation) to experiment, automate, and scale smarter ways of doing product marketing. If you get excited about using AI to move faster and think better, you’ll feel at home here.
   

  

**What We Offer**
**A team you actually enjoy working with:** 
 Collaborative, ambitious colleagues who value trust, learning and shared wins, and who have each other’s backs.
   

  

**Room to grow (for real):** 
 We invest in your craft through close sparring, clear development paths, and the freedom to try, learn and improve.
   

  

**Competitive pay, no guesswork:** 
 A strong salary and benefits package that reflects your skills and contribution.
   

  

**Ownership from day one:** 
 You’ll take responsibility early and help shape how we work, and what we deliver to our customers.
   

  

**An AI-forward way of working:** 
 We actively explore and adopt new AI tools to work smarter, faster and with higher quality, together.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This is a hands-on role for a product marketer who enjoys both strategy and execution. You’ll lead positioning and launches, but also roll up your sleeves to create the copy, visuals, and enablement assets that drive adoption and growth. You thrive in cross-functional collaboration, stay close to the details, and deliver work that’s both strategic and ready to ship.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Own go-to-market for new products and features - From strategy to launch plan to messaging you’ll make sure releases land clearly and create momentum in the market.
* Craft customer-led positioning and narratives - Turn real customer pains into crisp value propositions that differentiate us and make buying (and using) Simployer feel easy.
* Enable Sales and Customer teams to win - Build the essentials: decks, battle cards, demo narratives, and clear “why us / why now” messaging.
* Use insight and competition to keep us ahead - Track market moves, gather customer insight, and translate it into smarter launches and stronger storytelling.
* Build content and campaigns that convert - Create product-led content, web messaging, and campaigns that drive demand and adoption.
* Help scale our AI-powered way of working - Experiment with AI tools, automate where it makes sense, and raise the bar for how efficiently and creatively we market our products.


 What you will bring to the team
   

  

* 3+ years in B2B SaaS product/customer marketing
* A talent for turning complexity into clarity
* English + Swedish or Norwegian
* Comfort in the spotlight: webinars, demos, events
* A maker mindset across copy, visuals, video
* Real curiosity for AI and a drive to use it to raise the bar


**Message From The Hiring Manager**
*If you’re someone who likes turning complexity into clarity, thrives in collaboration, and gets excited about building the future of marketing with AI in the toolkit, I think you’ll love it here. We’re a warm, ambitious team, and we’re ready for you to bring your spark* 
 - Sally Russell, Head of Product Marketing
   

  

 Why join Simployer?
   

  

 By joining Simployer, you'll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You'll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We're building something big, join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we'll change the HR tech game!
   

  

 We can't wait to meet you!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
*We’re looking for passionate, empathetic leaders who have experience both in hands-on coding and in leading teams. If you want to bring out the best in people while driving technical excellence, you’ll thrive in this role. We believe that leadership is about empowering others to grow, collaborating with your team, and leading by example.*
*At Nordnet, we encourage simplicity, inclusivity, and a just-do-it attitude, where every voice is heard, and all team members are empowered to contribute. If you’re driven to make an impact, build strong, diverse teams, and lead with technical expertise, we want to hear from you.*
**As An Engineering Manager, You Will**
* Lead and build collaborative and empowered teams, drawing on your hands-on technical expertise.
* Foster a supportive environment for growth and development, enabling your engineers to excel in both technical skills and leadership.
* Champion Nordnet's tech strategy, contributing to technical decision-making and ensuring we maintain technical excellence in all aspects of our team.
* Lead by example with your coding expertise, guiding your team through technical challenges and hands-on problem-solving.
* Contribute to the evolution of the engineering organization, fostering innovation and continuous learning.
* Collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers to share knowledge, solve challenges, and learn from each other.


**You And Your Skills**
* You have hands-on experience in software development and a strong technical background. You are comfortable reading code and when needed diving into technical discussions.
* You have experience leading and developing product development teams, empowering your engineers to grow in their roles.
* You are curious, open-minded, and always eager to learn, seeing challenges as opportunities to grow and improve.
* You lead with empathy, transparency, and trust, creating an environment where your team feels supported and motivated.
* You are a change leader, brave in pushing through friction and driving technical innovation.
* You hold a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.


**Culture At Nordnet Engineering**
* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work.
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning.
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives.
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**
 At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. As an Engineering Manager, you'll be at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge technology like Google Cloud Platform, React/React Native, and Java to shape our web and mobile experiences. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.
   

  

 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 In 1996, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**Application**
 Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.
   

  

 If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner, Lovisa Malmberg, lovisa.malmberg@nordnet.se.
   

  

 At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to Visa Open Banking - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa.
   

  





 Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analysed. Visa Open Banking handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what VOB engineers are doing.
   

  





 We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Infrastructure team. You will be part of the team responsible for maintaning and improving VOB system reliability, scalability and efficiency. Your primary focus will be on automating our operational activities and creating a bridge between operations and development.
   

  





 What we offer you:
   

  





 A position in the infrastructure team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:
   

  




* Providing VOB engineers with tailored self-service tools and services that enable teams to deliver, operate and observe their services, with low friction.


* Focusing on automation and tooling to enable other engineering teams to focus on core business activities.


* Automate provisioning, monitoring, and scaling using scripting (Python, Go, Bash).


* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


* Being a best practice champion, influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale systems.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  




* Relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR relevant work experience



 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  




* Work experience with a Bachelors Degree, an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or PhD.
* Proven experience in designing, building, and managing large-scale, dependable cloud services in close collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Go or Python.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud or Azure.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible.
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog.
* Experience with GenAI tools for coding and day to day tasks.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work as a part of the team.
* Ability to participate in an on-call rotation.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Development Manager
description:
*At Aceve, we empower the builders of society and transform the construction and skilled trades industry—one of the least digitalized sectors in Europe. As a united SaaS powerhouse, we bring together leading products into a single pioneering platform dedicated to making a difference.
   

  

 With over 900 passionate employees and more than €100 million in revenue, we blend tradition and innovation to reshape our industry’s future. Our cloud-based, AI-driven software solutions deliver actionable insights and drive improvements for construction companies and skilled tradespeople, enhancing project management, installations, maintenance, and services.
   

  

 On our ambitious growth journey, we are committed to winning together and accelerating digital transformation. With Aceve’s tools, our customers can boost their performance, productivity, and profitability, ensuring they thrive in a rapidly changing landscape.
   

  

 Join us in revolutionizing the industry and building a brighter future together!* 
**Role Overview** 




 As a
 **Development Manager** 
 , you will be responsible for leading, developing, and supporting one or more software development teams. Your role combines
 **people leadership** 
 ,
 **delivery ownership** 
 , and
 **process excellence** 
 , ensuring that teams are set up for success while aligning their work with Aceve’s strategic goals.
 



 You will oversee professional development, performance management, team wellbeing, and resource allocation, while also playing a key role in
 **governance, change management, budget planning, and delivery management** 
 . Working closely with senior leadership, you will help drive high-quality software delivery through Agile, DevSecOps, and Lean practices.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 




**People Leadership & Development** 



* Hire, onboard, and integrate new team members, ensuring a smooth start and ongoing support.
* Conduct regular performance reviews, providing clear feedback and development guidance.
* Support individual career growth through mentoring, training opportunities, and continuous learning.
* Promote and uphold company values across the team.
* Address team-related challenges or conflicts in collaboration with HR when needed.



**Team & Resource Management** 



* Ensure teams follow established development processes, standards, and best practices.
* Manage team budgets, including planning, monitoring, and cost control.
* Allocate workloads effectively, balancing delivery needs with individual skills and development goals.
* Ensure teams have the right tools, competencies, and capacity to work efficiently.
* Act as a coach and mentor, helping team members grow in their roles.



**Delivery, Process & Governance** 



* Take ownership of project and delivery management for your team(s).
* Ensure compliance with governance frameworks, policies, and change management processes.
* Monitor and drive progress against Development KPIs and OKRs.
* Ensure accountability for team delivery and outcomes.



**Collaboration & Communication** 



* Manage communication with key internal stakeholders.
* Facilitate regular team meetings to share updates, gather feedback, and address concerns.
* Foster a culture of shared ownership, collaboration, and continuous improvement across teams.



**Process Excellence & Continuous Improvement** 



* Implement and evolve Agile, DevSecOps, and Lean development practices.
* Align development processes across teams to ensure consistency and efficiency.
* Promote a “one-product” mindset and cross-functional collaboration.
* Track and analyze development metrics (including DORA & SPACE metrics) to drive data-informed improvements.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices.



**Success Metrics (KPIs)** 



* Team engagement, performance, and retention
* Quality and timeliness of software delivery
* Improvement in development efficiency and workflows
* Individual skill development and career progression
* Stakeholder satisfaction and cross-team collaboration
* Achievement of KPIs, OKRs, and delivery commitments








**What We Offer** 




 At Aceve, we want you to thrive — both at work and in life. Here’s what you can look forward to:
 



**Health Insurance -** 
 Comprehensive private health coverage to keep you feeling your best.
 



**Coverflex Card -** 
 Enjoy a highly flexible benefits wallet you can use on:
   

 • transport 
   

 • gym & wellbeing services
   

 • childcare
   

 • technology & learning
   

 • and many other perks - you choose how to spend it!
 



**Work-From-Home Allowance -** 
 We help you set up and maintain a comfortable and productive home-office environment.
 



**Meal Allowance -** 
 Provided through Coverflex for maximum flexibility.
 



**Hybrid Work Model**
 A great balance between collaboration and flexibility - we work from the office
 **2 to 3 times per week** 
 .
 







**📍 Our Office** 




 You'll find us at
 **Rua Eloy 8, Lisbon** 
 , just a short walk from the
 **Quinta das Conchas metro station (Yellow Line)** 
 .
 



 We’re a growing and friendly group of around
 **65 team members** 
 in our Lisbon office, spread across several departments; with developers making up the majority of our team. Here in Lisbon, we work on multiple products across the company, from
 **KlarPris to Craftnote** 
 . It’s a team size that’s big enough to create real impact, yet small enough to maintain a familiar, collaborative, and supportive atmosphere.
   





**Not ticking every box?** 
 No worries! We value potential and drive, so apply anyway or connect with us- you might be just what we're looking for in our growing organisation! Join Aceve and take your expertise to the next level, together we are redefining what’s possible in craft and construction solutions!
   

  





  





*Aceve is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our selection process is conducted continuously and without discrimination, ensuring an equal opportunity for all candidates.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer inom GCP – Strategisk roll i modern dataplattform | Stockholm** 




  





 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datalösningar i ett bolag som satsar stort på skalbara plattformar för analys och maskininlärning? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighet för dig. Vi söker nu (på uppdrag av kund) en Data Engineer som vill bidra till att bygga och utveckla en modern dataplattform på Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag som Data Engineer** 




 I denna roll får du en nyckelposition i organisationens pågående förändringsresa, där data och plattformsutveckling spelar en avgörande roll för att möjliggöra innovation och effektivitet. Du ansvarar för att utveckla robusta, skalbara datalösningar som stödjer avancerad analys, BI och ML‑initiativ – från källsystem till analyslager.
 



 Arbetet sker både på konceptuell och logisk nivå, med fokus på att datapipelines och modeller ska vara skalbara, tillgängliga och hållbara över tid.
 



  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Utveckla och optimera ETL/ELT‑pipelines för Data Warehouse och Data Lake
* Designa och implementera datamodeller (Star Schema och Graph)
* Arbeta hands‑on med Python, SQL och GCP‑tjänster, samt teknologier som Kafka och Pub/Sub
* Utnyttja moderna verktyg som dbt, Airflow eller motsvarande
* Säkerställa datakvalitet, governance och plattformsoptimering
* Samarbeta nära med Data Architect, utvecklingsteam, DevOps, marknad och produkt för att leverera end‑to‑end‑lösningar
* Få chansen att ta ägarskap över organisationens Data Platform‑miljöer



  





 IT‑avdelningen består av ett techteam på cirka 10 personer med fokus på egenutvecklade lösningar. Du samarbetar nära både tekniska och verksamhetsnära funktioner.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet som Data Engineer på mid/senior‑nivå, gärna i GCP
* Proven kompetens i att designa och implementera Star Schema‑ och Graph‑modeller
* Praktisk erfarenhet av realtids‑/meddelandesystem som Kafka eller Pub/Sub
* Expertis inom data warehousing och verktyg som dbt, Airflow eller motsvarande
* Stark bakgrund i att bygga skalbara ETL/ELT‑processer
* Förmåga att arbeta effektivt med både tekniska och verksamhetsnära intressenter



  





**Att arbeta hos oss** 




 Här blir du en del av en kunskapsintensiv techmiljö där experter från olika områden samverkar för att skapa lösningar med stor påverkan på affär och innovation. Organisationen bygger en state‑of‑the‑art plattform med microservices och eventdriven arkitektur.
 



 Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö som präglas av omtanke, tillit och professionalism. Du arbetar i moderna lokaler i centrala Stockholm och erbjuds attraktiva anställningsförmåner samt möjlighet till hybridarbete.

title: Regional Team Lead (Stockholm)
description:
**Regional Team Lead**
**Location** 
 : Europe: Sweden, Poland, Slovakia or Romania.
 **Department** 
 : Services Delivery.
   

  

**Join Polystar – Part of Elisa Industriq**
 Polystar, now part of Elisa Industriq, delivers network assurance and automation solutions that help telecommunications operators worldwide turn complex network data into actionable insights. We're looking for a Regional Team Lead to guide a talented team in delivering outstanding customer outcomes across Europe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Regional Team Lead, you will lead and empower a high-performing team to deliver exceptional customer experiences across your allocated region. Your mission: ensure operational excellence, customer satisfaction, and financial efficiency while fostering a culture of collaboration and growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Leadership & People Development**
* Inspire, coach, and build a motivated team of delivery and support professionals.
* Communicate effectively on projects, priorities, and customer needs.
* Forecast resources, plan manpower, and manage team administration.
* Drive performance management: goal setting, reviews, and development plans.
* Lead recruitment, onboarding, and career progression initiatives.


**Operational Control**
* Govern regional delivery and support operations with data-driven decisions.
* Prioritize resources to meet project timelines and SLA commitments.
* Oversee accurate time reporting and expense approvals.
* Act as the operational interface for regional sales and financial matters.


**Customer Success**
* Serve as the primary escalation point for regional customers.
* Continuously improve customer satisfaction within revenue and cost targets.
* Implement structured service reviews and action plans for CSAT/NPS improvement.


**Hands-On Contribution**
* Support projects and services aligned with your core competencies (e.g., project management, configuration, support).


**What We’re Looking For, Must-Have Qualifications**
* Experience: 8+ years in telecom software/services, with 2+ years leading regional delivery/support teams.
* Domain Expertise: Strong telecom or IT engineering background; OSS domains (service assurance, fault/performance management, inventory, provisioning).
* Leadership: Proven ability to build and retain high-performing teams; workforce planning and performance management.
* Operational & Financial Acumen: Project governance, P&L awareness, KPI-driven decision-making.
* Customer Engagement: Skilled in escalation management and improving CSAT/NPS.
* Tools & Processes: Familiarity with PSA/ERP tools (NetSuite/OpenAir, SAP), ITIL practices, and project management tools.
* Communication: Excellent stakeholder management and executive-level reporting.


**Nice-to-Have**
* Certifications: PMP, ITIL, Scrum Master, TM Forum.
* Exposure to cloud-native OSS, public cloud platforms, and observability tools.
* Regional experience in Nordics/EMEA; multilingual skills are a plus.


**Why Polystar?** 
 As part of Elisa Industriq, we combine deep telecom expertise with industrial-grade AI and data science capabilities. We work with over 100 operators in 55 countries, helping them optimize network performance and deliver better customer experiences. Join a team that values collaboration, continuous learning, and measurable impact.
   

  

**Apply now and shape the future of telecom with us!**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 at Coody, you'll dive into technically exciting and intellectually challenging assignments to design and build fully automated data platforms and pipelines that creates real business value. Each assignment is 6–24 months and will give you both broadness and deepness from various industries and companies. As a consultant, you are expected to ramp up fast and deliver value from day one, often in new environments.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Data Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools.
* Professional experience with tools like Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableau, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL.
* A solid understanding of cloud environments; AWS / Google Cloud / Azure
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Salesforce Developers – Multiple Hires (x3)
 



  





 Stockholm (On-site / Hybrid) | Financial Services
 



  





 I’m supporting a Financial Services company based in Stockholm that’s currently expanding their Salesforce capability and is hiring up to three Salesforce Developers as part of a strategic growth phase.
 



  





 They’ve invested heavily in Salesforce, and it’s now one of the core engines of the business. This brings strong leadership backing, real influence over the platform, and clear long-term progression for the right people.
 



  





 As a Salesforce Developer, you will:
 



  




* Design, develop, and maintain Salesforce solutions across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and custom applications
* Build and optimise Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Flows, and integrations
* Collaborate closely with Architects, Product Owners, and business stakeholders
* Contribute to platform enhancements, upgrades, and Salesforce roadmap initiatives
* Ensure best practices around security, performance, and scalability



  





 Required Experience
 



  




* Proven experience working as a Salesforce Developer
* Strong hands-on experience with:
* Apex
* Lightning Web Components (LWC)
* Salesforce APIs & integrations
* Declarative automation (Flows)
* Experience working in Agile delivery environments
* Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Fluent Swedish (spoken and written) – mandatory
