title: Finance Engineer
description:
**Are you our next Finance Engineer**


Are you a finance professional who would rather turn a manual process into code than repeat it one more time? Do you believe finance should be built, not maintained? At Kivra, we’re re-engineering how finance works from the ground up and we’re looking for someone who wants to help build the future version of it.


This role is not about running existing processes more efficiently. It’s about questioning why they exist at all, redesigning them, and automating them end-to-end. You’ll sit at the intersection of finance, data engineering, and applied AI, with a mandate to turn finance into software.


At Kivra, we serve more than 6 million people by providing a secure, trusted digital infrastructure for important communication in Sweden. We replace paper with digital and now we’re doing the same inside our finance function.

**What you’ll be doing**


We are a small finance team with a clear ambition: to build a world-class, automation-first finance function. You’ll work hands-on with data, systems, and stakeholders across the organisation to design scalable, auditable and transparent financial processes.


We work as a team, but you will be responsible for:

* Designing and building automated accounting and consolidation workflows — from raw data to booked transactions.
* Turning manual controls into systematic and code-based controls that run continuously.
* Re-architecting month-end close and consolidation to be faster, more reliable, and less human-dependent.
* Translating financial and operational data into decision-ready insights.
* Exploring and implementing AI/ML-based solutions where they actually add value and not hype.
* Building automated management reporting and profitability models that connect financial and operational data, enabling real-time insight into performance, drivers, and unit economics.


In short: you will help turn finance into an engineered system rather than a collection of spreadsheets and routines.

**Who we’re looking for**


We care less about titles and more about what you have done, what problems you’ve solved and your ability to go into the details. You understand accounting and finance well enough to abstract them into logic, rules, data models and you prefer building systems over running routines.


We think that you:

* Have 5+ years of experience solving complex, data-heavy problems in tech-driven environments, where progress is made by building, testing, and improving systems — not by writing decks.
* Hold at least a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent academic background).
* Have a solid understanding of accounting, consolidation, and financial processes not necessarily as a practitioner, but as someone who can model, automate, and redesign them.
* Advanced SQL skills with an ability to navigate large data sets.
* Have experience using modern AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude) as part of your daily problem-solving and development workflow.
* Have hands-on experience building and using BI solutions (e.g. Tableau, Hex or similar) to automate reporting, analyse performance, and make data accessible to the business.
* Think quantitatively and structurally, with a strong sense for business logic, incentives, and unit economics.
* Can take ambiguous problems from concept to production by starting small, iterating fast, and continuously improving — while ensuring solutions hold up under scrutiny, scale, and audit.
* Are curious, opinionated, and collaborative, with a low tolerance for manual work and a high bar for quality.

**Additional information**


This role is full-time and based in Stockholm. We offer the flexibility that life sometimes requires, but we believe that collaboration and value creation happens best when we sit and work together from our office in central Stockholm. Fluency in English is required and Swedish is a plus. We are unable to sponsor new work permits, but can sponsor/renew existing permits.

**We Offer**


Kivra offers a place in a committed team with the opportunity for a high degree of innovation. You will be involved in influencing Kivra's exciting business and product development of a service that is currently used by more than half of Sweden's population. We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!

**How to apply**


Easy peasy! Send your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have questions about the role or the process, contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com


  
Teams
Finance
Role
Finance Engineer
Locations
Stockholm

title: Software QA Engineer
description:
In an increasingly connected world, the pandemic has highlighted just how essential telecom networks are to keeping society running. The **Network Infrastructure** group is at the heart of a revolution to connectivity, pushing the boundaries to deliver more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise


Join **Optical Networks division** , where innovation meets scale in the AI-driven data center era. With the recent acquisition of Infinera, we’ve united two industry leaders to create an optical networking powerhouse—combining cutting-edge technology with proven leadership to redefine the future of connectivity.


Infinera is now part of the Nokia Corporation and its subsidiaries. When you apply, the information you share will be handled with care and used only for recruitment purposes within the group.
  

  

As a Software QA Engineer at Nokia, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring the quality of our cutting-edge communication technology. You will design and execute automated test cases using Python, collaborating closely with a cross-functional team of developers and product managers during sprint planning and backlog refinements. You'll write detailed reports on test execution and defect analysis, enabling swift issue resolution. You’ll thrive in our dynamic Agile environment, working alongside passionate colleagues who are committed to innovation in optical communications. Your strong communication skills will empower you to collaborate effectively within our global team, driving quality and efficiency in our products.


  
* Design and implement comprehensive test plans, creating and executing automated test cases in Python to meet project specifications.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional software development teams during backlog refinement and sprint planning, ensuring alignment on project goals.
* Generate detailed reports on test execution and defect analysis, improving the reproducibility and resolution of issues to enhance product quality.
* Participate in continuous improvement discussions to promote the adoption of innovative approaches in quality assurance and testing.
* Utilize and integrate version control systems like Git to maintain test scripts and documentation effectively within the agile development workflow.
* Stay updated on optical communication technologies and contribute insights to enhance the team’s approach to testing and quality assurance.

  
* Hands-on experience in automated test development using Python
* Knowledge of optical communication and related technologies
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Effective communication skills for global cross-functional collaboration

It would be nice if you also had:
* Proven knowledge in Agile methodologies and Test Driven Development
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git)
* ISTQB or other software testing certifications

  
**Advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.**Nokia is a global leader in connectivity for the AI era. With expertise across fixed, mobile and transport networks, powered by the innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we’re advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.


Learn more about life at Nokia .  

  

  

**Our recruitment process**

We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Our employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.


If you’re interested in this role but don’t meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences enrich our teams, and you may be just the right candidate for this or another opportunity.


The length of the recruitment process may vary depending on the specific role's requirements. We strive to ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates. Discover more about the recruitment process at Nokia .
company_description: Join Nokia and help create the technology that helps the world act together.

title: HIL-SIL Engineer
description:
The Role
  
Tata Technologies Nordics AB is seeking experienced HIL and SIL Test Engineers to support verification and validation activities for automotive software. You will develop and refine test methods, create test scenarios, perform fault tracing, and execute both manual and automated tests in SIL and HIL environments.
  
Main responsibilities
  
Develop new test methods and refine existing ones based on requirements.
  
Set up and execute test scenarios, define test verdicts, and provide requirement feedback.
  
Perform hands‑on testing in SIL and HIL rigs.
  
Conduct detailed fault tracing in simulations and on the system under test.
  
Maintain and monitor automated regression test suites.
  
Use Python and Pandas for scripting, analysis, and test automation.
  
Create and manage scenarios using OpenSCENARIO/OpenDRIVE frameworks.
  
  

Knowledge / Experience
  
Strong experience with software measurement and fault‑tracing tools.
  
Hands‑on experience in HIL and/or SIL environments.
  
**Proficiency with:** Python scripting, Pandas (e.g., Zenalyser workflows), OpenSCENARIO & OpenDRIVE scenario‑generation tools
  
Solid understanding of test development, execution, and documentation.
  
  

Desirable
  
Knowledge of ADAS/AD functions and scenario-based validation.
  
Experience with automotive simulation platforms or test benches.

title: HIL Rig Engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world's leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a HIL Rig Engineer, to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
The Role
  
The HIL Rig Support & Automation Engineer supports Rig Maintenance and validation across safety-critical vehicle domains including Autonomous Drive, ADAS, Protective Safety, and Vehicle Motion Control. The role focuses on enabling & maintaining Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) test environments that support Continuous Integration (CI)–based development, ensuring high test quality, effective automation, and early fault detection.
  
Main responsibilities
  
Support tester teams with HIL test rig preparation, configuration, and troubleshooting
  
Capture, test environmental requirements from product teams and translate them into technical solutions
  
Update and implement HIL rig solutions aligned with product and CI needs
  
Develop and maintain test automation solutions for product teams
  
Perform fault tracing and root-cause analysis in test rig environments
  
Update and maintain test rigs in terms of hardware, software, and configurations
  
Create and maintain documentation for rigs, setups, and configurations
  
Conduct high-level fault slip-through analysis and support improvements to test strategies
  
  

Knowledge / Experience
  
Automotive industry experience with HIL Systems for 8 years or more.
  
Knowledge of automotive electrical and electronic architectures
  
Experience with embedded systems
  
Strong competence in software verification and fault tracing
  
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI) infrastructure
  
Programming skills in CAPL, C, and Python
  
Hands-on experience with CANoe and Vector tools for development and testing
  
Experience with dSPACE tools for HIL development
  
Knowledge of automotive diagnostics protocols and tools, such as CAN, Ethernet, LIN, and related interfaces
  
Experience with MATLAB/Simulink
  
Proficiency in Git for version control
  
Comfortable working with command-line interfaces
  
Experience using SSH for remote access and system interaction
  
Experience working in an Agile development environment
  
  

If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on then we would love to hear from you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest; each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date, it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Lead Engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world's leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Lead Engineer - Digital key, to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
  

**The role:**  

The team that you will work with are responsible for the hardware development of our Digital key solution and surrounding interface components. Your team is managing the development at the suppliers to ensure our requirements; time plans are met also considering cost efficiency. The digital key platform team develop digital key hardware, verifies and validates the end customer behavior as well as manage our suppliers.
  
Main responsibilities
  
You will primarily be working on next gen digital key hardware.
  
As a Lead Engineer you will continuously work with securing the deliveries for our customer production and aftermarket.
  
A key responsibility is to compile the technical requirements from the various stakeholders and make sure that the supplier has accepted the scope for the development.
  
Later in the development review the test and validations results together with the supplier.
  
You are the project leader in the team that consist of several HW Engineers and SW Responsible and of cause the suppliers that we work closely with.
  
You are responsible for the time plan and for planning the activities and collaborate with our different internal interfaces (attributes, mechanical integration, SW development etc.) and external suppliers.
  
  

Knowledge / Experience
  
We are seeking candidates, with product development experience from automotive industry, who exhibit flexibility, self-drive, reliability, and strong teamwork skills.
  
You probably have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in Electronics, Computer science, Automation or equivalent with relevant experience.
  
Having worked within the automotive industry with diagnostics, integration of software, software testing or managing/owning electronic components for release to production or similar is meritorious.
  
Having an interest in our products and components, and a drive to learn and develop are very important qualifications.
  
You like to meet people and support the roll-out of our new technology.
  
You are engaged with a curious, open-minded and positive approach.
  
You like structure and have things organized and well planned.
  
Fluency in English is mandatory.
  
  

If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects, you work on then we would love to hear from you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest; each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date, it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Research Engineer in Ventilation
description:
Join LKAB and help shape the future of underground mine ventilation. In this role, you will combine on-site measurements, advanced modelling, and cross-functional collaboration to deliver safe, efficient, and forward-looking ventilation solutions.


Ort: Gällivare
Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
Ansök senast: 2026-02-24  


**Shaping the future**
----------------------

At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally. Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?


**Your role**
-------------

As a Research Engineer in Ventilation, you will work hands‑on with mine ventilation performance and support the development of future ventilation solutions across LKAB’s underground operations. The role gives you a broad mix of fieldwork, modelling, analysis, and project participation in one of the world’s most innovative mining environments.



Your main responsibilities will include:



* Conducting mine ventilation measurements underground and on the surface, including air velocity, pressure, humidity, temperature, and contaminant sampling.
* Analysing measurement data and communicating results in a clear and professional manner.
* Developing and maintaining mine ventilation models in Ventsim, including airflow distribution, heat, contaminants, fire safety, and egress studies.
* Contributing to ventilation-related projects across all phases – from literature reviews and early concept studies to detailed system design.
* Planning and driving assigned tasks, ensuring timely delivery, documentation, and quality of results.
* Collaborating with colleagues across engineering, operations, and R&D to support safe and efficient mine ventilation solutions.

**What you bring**
------------------

You have prior experience in mine ventilation, with a focus on underground environmental measurements and ventilation modelling. Experience in mine infrastructure design and project execution is an advantage.



You are proficient in MS Office. Experience in ventilation modelling software is required, with Ventsim as the preferred tool. Experience in Deswik design, statistical analysis tools, and Power BI is considered an asset.



You have a strong interest in safety, new technologies, and continuous learning. You bring strong interpersonal and communication skills and are comfortable working in multicultural and cross-functional environments.



* Bachelor or M.Sc. level education in mining or another relevant field is required
* Have good communication skills and proficiency in English, both spoken and written
* Additional courses or studies in mine ventilation are highly beneficial
* Fluency in Swedish is considered beneficial
* A driver’s license (Swedish B-class minimum) is a requirement for all positions at LKAB

**What we offer**
-----------------

In addition to the general benefits we offer — which you can find a bit further down — we can also offer you, who currently do not live in Sweden, the following:


* Relocation support for you and your family.
* Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
* LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
* The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.

**Additional information**
--------------------------

We strive for a fair and objective recruitment process. Therefore, we usually do not request cover letters. Instead, we ask you to answer questions related to the specific position you are applying for. Your responses help us understand your skills and experience, so please take the time to answer as clearly and thoroughly as possible.



Start: According to agreement



Location: Malmberget



Type of Employment: Permanent, full-time


Contact: For more information about the position, please contact our hiring manager Anu Martikainen on email: anu.martikainen@lkab.com

-------------------------------

* Free access to LKAB:s own gym and our partners´facilities in Norrbotten
* Reward program
* Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities
* Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment)
* Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation
* Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses
* Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children’s studies
* Access to our pension and insurance program with favourable rates

title: Senior Hardware Engineer
description:
**Location City**

 MALMÖ  

**Location Region**

  

**Location Country**

 Sweden  

**Role also available in**

  

**About u-blox**

 u-blox (SIX:UBXN) is a global leader in automotive, industrial, and consumer markets, driving innovation through our cutting-edge positioning and short-range communication technologies. We are the pioneers behind high-precision technologies, providing smart and reliable solutions that enable people, vehicles, and machines to determine their precise position and communicate wirelessly. With headquarters in Thalwil, Switzerland, and offices across Europe, Asia, and the USA, we are making a global impact.  

**Job Description**

**Position**  

We are looking for an experienced HW/RF design engineer for our hardware team in Malmo.  

  

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly motivated and experienced team doing HW and RF designs for our wireless modules. We are looking for a curious, innovative, structured colleague with a wide technical interest. We work both in medium sized product projects and in smaller projects where you should be able to take on new tasks and find your own solutions.  

  

You will be an important part of the hardware development team responsible for designing wireless modules based on various technologies, currently with focus on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, but can be other technologies as well going forward. Apart from designing modules also support products like evaluation boards are part of the development activities. All this to make Internet of Things become reality and make this easy for our customers.  

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design hardware for new wireless modules and evaluation boards
* Integration of wireless transceivers, radio front ends and antennas
* Together with certification manager, develop competence and act as an advisor in the projects, within certification area
* Review and verification of RF designs
* Verify that modules work according to specification
* Write technical documentation
* Design PCB for internal use (e.g. development, characterization and evaluation boards)
* Ensure on-time delivery, performance, and cost as planned
* Select components in cooperation with purchasing team
* Ensure transfer of design to manufacturing partner
* Analyze parts that are returned by customers
* Support specification of new products
* Provide input for and review data sheets, user guides and release notes
* Contribute to improvements of company processes and quality requirements


  

**Skills and experience**
* Master of Science in electrical engineering, potentially Bachelor of Science with appropriate experience
* Minimum 10 years of Hardware Engineering experience
* Experience in Mixed Signal (RF/Digital) System design on Board level. Both drawing schematics and layout routing
* Experience in using board design CAD tools, preferably in Altium
* Experience in using RF 3D simulation tools, preferably in Ansys HFSS
* Know-how in RF-Measurement techniques
* Experience from EMC, standardization and certification
* Used to work independently and precisely
* Enterprise environment
* Knowledge in software programming is an advantage
* Good English skills, skills in other languages are an advantage
* Swedish citizen or holder of a valid work permit for Sweden


  

**Perks**
* Working in an international team with family atmosphere and great spirit
* Innovative environment, where you work independently in a team, but not alone
* An exciting and diversified field of work
* Working with new technologies


  

We are located in a modern building near Dockan, in Malmö’s western harbor, within walking distance of the Central Station.  

Our employees are our most important resource; u-blox is the sum of us all!  

We understand that good health is the foundation for a good life, not only at work. That's why we offer active healthcare and voluntary medical check-ups.  

  

**Learn more about u-blox and its mission by reading** **here** **!**  

We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief  

  

**Applications Close Date**

  

**Contact**

 Are you interested in this challenging position within an international work environment in a successful company? Apply now! You will be working with a motivated team in an exciting technology.
  

  

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

title: Performance & Calibration Engineer - Senior Expert
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.


Professional Galaxy is looking for a **Performance & Calibration Engineer - Senior Expert** on behalf of our client.


We are looking for a Development Engineer, with specific focus on engine calibration. Note that engine calibration experience is required.  

We believe that you have a genuine interest of working within testing and optimization of internal combustion engines and we expect that you have both the knowledge of fundamental combustion theory and experience of developing combustion engines.  

  

**About us:**  

Industrial Development and Calibration within product development is responsible for testing and optimization of both hardware and software regarding performance, emissions and durability of all our industrial combustion engines.  

As a Development Engineer, you will be accountable for delivering test and optimization tasks. You will be a part of a project team within the Industrial Development and Calibration team.  

  

**Main tasks and responsibilities:**  

Optimization tasks can be anything from a sensor linearization to final complete engine software setting for production. You will be responsible for delivering the optimization for a specific engine.  

We use advanced tools such as ENE and DoE for screening and calibration.  

Other tools used are ATI Vision (calibration and data acquisition), DTECS (our specific development tool for embedded control systems) and Concerto (a generic data post-processing and evaluation tool).  

  

We look for a team member who is interested in product development in general, but preferably towards testing and optimization of combustion engines – diesel and alternative fuel powered. Since the job consists of a net of contacts internally and externally, your networking skills are highly valued.  

  

And one last thing, we all spend a significant part of our lives at work, why not make the most of that time by having fun together? We believe that it is a crucial part of getting the job done while enjoying the journey forward!  

  

**Requirements:**  

* Engine calibration experience
* Master of Science or similar relevant technical experience.
* Several years of experience in combustion engine development.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken.
* Driver license for car.
**Other Information :**

**Start Date :** 2026-02-23

**End Date :** 2027-02-22

**Application Deadline** : 2026-01-24


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Integration Systems Specialist
description:
**Who are Benifex?**


We are a fast-moving technology company, and **one of the most successful providers of online reward and benefits solutions in the world.** We believe that everyone deserves an exceptional experience at work, every day, and build **workplace technology** that makes this happen. Benifex’s mission is to **build remarkable experiences that employees love.** Today Benifex supports more than five million employees in over 3,000 organisations across more than 100 countries. To help us on our quest to be the best, **we need brilliant people** on board and that’s where you come in.


**Why should you apply?**  



* **Impact:** you'll be maintaining the operations of our data manipulation platform for customers helping teams get the most out of their data.
* **Variety:** you will be encountering novel situations on a daily basis - no two days are the same!
* **Team:** you'll be part of a lean team of specialists with far reaching impact across multiple departments.
* **Top 10 Employer, Sunday Times Best Places to Work Awards**
* Work for a **profitable, fast-growing** **market leader** in the online reward and benefits space


Please note we are unable to offer visa sponsorship and require to people to be based in Sweden for this position

**Great benefits:**


️ Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid working model


ITP1 pension


️ Lifeplan - a leading financial advisory service that offers personalized advice for maximizing your pension savings


Collective agreement.


Access to our comprehensive benefits portal.


Generous wellness allowance


️ 30 vacation days / year


Referral bonuses


Enhanced parental pay

**Role Overview**

As an Integration Systems Specialist, you will work with a variety of interesting and leading-edge integration components, tools, and setups within our Integration Platforms team. Your workdays will be filled with various, fast-paced, and stimulating tasks in a dynamic and diverse work environment together with motivated people. You will work with internal and external parties and support our customers with new/updated functionality and solve existing challenges in our integration landscape. You will be supporting our development teams with integration expertise.

 **Responsibilities**

* Support development teams and our customer integration teams in integration setup/development, most often as an expert, a sounding board and/or reviewer
* Monitor, manage, update, and improve our technical setup
* Further develop the capabilities of our integration platform
* Participate in overseeing operations and support our internal teams with operational information
* Participate in day-to-day operations of the integration platform, including patches, admin and more
* Participate in managing CI/CD toolchains

**What are we looking for?**

* Software engineer degree, preferably BSc in computer science or equal
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Proficiency in Kubernetes
* Configuration of GitHub CI/CD tools
* Programming experience in JavaScript/TypeScript and Python. Experience in Java and LUA is a plus.


Desirable:

* IdP (Identity provider) tools/systems experience
* Native / Professional proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Any additional languages are welcomed in our global company


Even if you don't meet all of the requirements for this role, we encourage you to apply! We are looking for talented and passionate individuals who are eager to learn and grow. We also offer a variety of other roles, so please check out our careers page to see if there is something else that might be a good fit for you.

**Our interview process**


Benifex understands the need to have a fast and efficient process, the below will all be completed in the shortest time possible.


Initial informal call with the Talent team


Technical Interview - 60 min


Technical Task


Final interview with Senior Director - 45 min

 **We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.**

**We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and respected. We believe that diversity and inclusion are essential to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.**

**We are a proud member of the Disability Confident employer scheme.**

**If you require any reasonable adjustments at any stage during the recruitment process, please let us know with your application.**
company_description: Benefex is the company behind OneHub, the award-winning employee experience platform.

title: Backendutvecklare till Content Experience
description:
***Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens streamingupplevelse?***
*Hos TV4 möts teknik, innovation, nyhetsjournalistik, sport och underhållning. Just nu på en spännande resa för att bygga nästa generations streamingupplevelse, med målet att leverera Sveriges bästa mediaplattform för miljontals användare - varje dag. Nu söker vi flera erfarna backendutvecklare till Content Experience-teamet.*
**Om rollen**
 I Content Experience-teamet fokuserar de på användarupplevelsen hos TV4:s alla kanaler: webb, app och TV. Teamet ser till att användarna får en sömlös användarresa samt skapar en spännande interaktionupplevelse för TV4:s kunder över alla deras plattformar. Vi letar därför efter backendutvecklare med fullstack-ambitioner för att stärka upp teamet.
   

  

**Du kommer bland annat att:**
* Arbeta mot en smidig och rolig användarupplevelse på TV4:s olika kanaler
* Designa skalbara mikrotjänster med fokus på prestanda, säkerhet och drift
* Driva och äga projekt och spännande features tillsammans med kollegor med olika kompetenser
* Komma med nya idéer och förbättringar
* Jobba end-to-end, från idé till implementation


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som brinner för mjukvaruutveckling och vill vara med och driva vårt team framåt. Du har ett starkt engagemang, är nyfiken på att lära dig nytt och ser AI som ett naturligt verktyg för att höja både din egen och teamets leverans.
   

  

 Hos oss får du en inkluderande miljö där mångfald är en styrka och där din nyfikenhet och ditt engagemang får växa i en ständigt föränderlig vardag.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du:**
* Är van att koda backend med erfarenhet eller intresse av fullstackutveckling. Exempel på tekniker vi använder idag är Typescript, Go, Node.js, React och AWS.
* Har en fallenhet för systemtänk, du kan översätta den stora bilden till dess beståndsdelar och tillbaka
* Har vana av att arbeta med hela processen från start till mål
* Har erfarenhet av streaming eller media


**Mer om erbjudandet**
 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm (TV4-huset) med gångavstånd till Gärdets tunnelbana. Kontoret erbjuder eget gym, parkeringsgarage, restaurang samt takterrass. Rollen erbjuder även:
   

  

* Kollektivavtal, med tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag m.m
* Vara en del av TV4s ekosystem och ta del av de tjänster som TV4 erbjuder sina kunder
* Rabatter via Benify
* En genuin kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där du även har chans att växa inom vår organisation
* Arbete i en sann AI-first kultur där du får påverka vår AI-resa framåt
* Arbete i team där vi tillsammans motiverar och driver TV4: till Sveriges bästa mediaplattform


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Denna rekrytering är i samarbete med Safemind. Har du ytterligare frågor om tjänsten, välkommen att kontakta Linnéa Stafferöd via linnea.stafferod@safemind.se.
   

  

 Tjänsten ingår i
 *Unionens/SJF* 
 avtalsområde och fackliga frågor besvaras via mejl till
 *unionen@tv4.se / sjf@tv4.se*

title: Fullstack Developer .NET
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a skilled and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our team. In this role, you’ll be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated software applications. You’ll play a key role in advancing our Financial Crime application services for clients in the UK market.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Design, develop, and maintain web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.
* Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure that the application meets business requirements and is user-friendly.
* Write clean, modular, and well-documented code that is easy to maintain and scale.
* Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and consistency.
* Work in a multicultural team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
* Debug and fix issues as they arise and continuously improve the performance and reliability of the application.
* Stay up to date with new technologies, frameworks, and industry trends to ensure that our applications are built with the latest best practices.


**Who You Are**
 You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, allowing you to work effectively within a team and contribute to the success of projects. You thrive in an environment where you can embrace new challenges, collaborate closely with team members, and deliver high-quality software solutions. You believe open-mindedness and a willingness to learn from others are essential for personal and team growth. You are a Swedish citizen with fluency in English.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of software development experience, focusing on full-stack development.
* Strong experience with programming in C#, .Net Core and Azure functions
* Experience in MySQL and Azure storage accounts
* Experience in modern front-end frameworks, preferably in Blazor with Mudblazor.
* Experience in agile development methodologies.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


****Location****

 Stockholm
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #a

title: Move to New Zealand - Senior Software Developer
description:
Work with our innovative team based in Auckland, New Zealand! We are seeking talented individuals excited about the opportunity to learn, expand their skillset and support our company in its evolution to a Rust code base.
   

  

 We welcome applications from individuals located internationally seeking remote engagements, or those looking to relocate to Auckland, New Zealand.
   

  

 This listing is for applicants interested in relocating to New Zealand, however if you wish to express interest in working with us remotely from outside New Zealand, please apply via any of our remote listings.
   

  

 Propellerhead hires exceptional talent from all around the globe and many of our people have relocated to New Zealand to join our team. We've created this website packed full of information about moving to New Zealand to work for Propellerhead, if you're interested in making the move to our wonderful country.
   

  

 The Role:
   

  

 As a Senior Software Developer in our core delivery team, you'll help craft interesting, challenging systems that are beyond routine feature work, alongside a team of highly skilled peers who value software craftsmanship and autonomy.
   

  

 You’ll work in an environment that prioritises technical excellence, curiosity, and forward-thinking design. We are looking for someone who is excited by emerging technologies and wants to make a tangible difference in the way people interact with digital systems.
   

  

 We offer a culture built on trust, continuous learning, and meaningful impact. You'll join a team that values integrity over ego, and clarity over complexity.
   

  

 Propellerhead operates a hybrid working model (work from our office and from your own home). While we prefer our NZ-based team to be located in Auckland, we are also welcoming applications from international developers who would like to relocate to Auckland.
   

  

 If you are ready to work on real problems with real impact, and help lay the groundwork for what comes next - we would like to hear from you.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities:**
* Active participation in all aspects of software solution design, including code structure, deployment architecture, DevOps, automated testing and integration of third party systems in line with our technical strategies.
* Collaborating with client stakeholders and with fellow Propellerhead Developers, Analysts, and Solution Architects, to create a shared understanding of the solution design and roadmap delivery in line with agreed budgets.
* Constructing software at every layer of the stack, from user interfaces, back end services, data repositories, interoperability, infrastructure-as-code, deployment pipelines, automated testing and system monitoring.
* Providing second-line support of the systems you build and actively seeking ways to keep your software secure, performant and reliable.
* Passing on your learning of new technologies or techniques to the broader organisation as part of our knowledge sharing programme.
* As a core team member you will be responsible for directing the development approach and reviewing components delivered by implementation partners to ensure quality measures such as security, reliability, maintainability, performance and functional fit for purpose.
* Actively moving forward the evolution of our code base from C# to Rust.


**Skills and Experience Required:**
* 7+ years experience as a Software Developer, including experience working with enterprise-level complexity.
* You must have proficiency in TypeScript and at least one modern web application framework, preferably React.
* Must have experience in C# and up-to-date .NET frameworks to the extent you can maintain some existing code.
* Hands-on experience deploying to Azure and/or AWS, including participation in building CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure-as-code using tools such as Terraform.
* You must have experience with asynchronous services and/or stream processing.
* Experience with Kubernetes and container-based deployments.
* Some experience with Rust is desirable. You will be moving heavily towards this programming language with us.
* Previous experience with Go or C++, is a bonus.
* We are particularly looking for developers with experience or demonstrable interest in any of the following: digital identity, verifiable credentials, open banking, AI agent authorization, edge or device-based software deployment.
* Experience using techniques such as user stories to express the work to be done as business outcomes.
* You can produce clear and concise design documents.
* You have excellent written and verbal communication skills to translate between requirements and technical tasks.


**About Propellerhead:**
 Propellerhead is a leading software services company that designs, delivers, and maintains large-scale, custom-built digital platforms across a range of technologies. We place emphasis on producing technology which is meaningful, has value, and can make a difference in the world. We foster long lasting and trusting relationships with all our clients, and we have worked with a diverse range of commercial, non-profit, and government organisations over our 20 years in the market.
   

  

**How We Build Software:**
 We build software by structuring solutions in a product-centric manner and focusing on continuously delivering improvements from a backlog of features. These features are taken from real stakeholder needs linked to clear objectives. As a result, our digital platforms are a mixture of custom components and external services which produce a powerful and engaging experience when combined.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* Contribute to interesting, diverse, and commercially minded work for well-respected clients.
* Join a Developer-led organisation full of world-class colleagues.
* Join a culture of learning and collaboration.
* Fortnightly Developer knowledge sharing session with lunch provided.
* Work both within our beautifully designed office and from the comfort of your home (hybrid work environment)
* Propellerhead is an equal opportunity workplace which is free from discrimination.


**Cover Letter:**
* Please note - only applications with a cover letter will be reviewed.\*


 It's very important to us that you include a cover letter with your application - it's your chance to tell us more about who you are and what you value.
   

  

*At Propellerhead, we use AI thoughtfully as part of our delivery practices - considered integration helps us stay at the forefront of technology and create innovative, valuable solutions for our clients.*
*In recruitment, however, AI isn’t used to assess skills, experience or suitability for a role. Every application is reviewed by a real person to ensure a fair, engaged and thoughtfully human process.*
*Therefore we kindly ask that you refrain from using it in your application. We're excited to learn about your unique experiences and ideas, so please apply as your authentic self!*
**More:**
 Candidates that progress may be asked to agree to a police background check, credit history check, other assessments and provide evidence of qualifications.

title: Senior Developer - AI Enabler
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 På Fortnox bygger vi inte bara lösningar för fler än 600 000 företag - vi bygger branschens mest moderna produkter och för att åstadkomma det bygger vi även branschens bästa utvecklingsplattform.
   

  

 Nu erbjuder vi dig en unik möjlighet att forma hur mjukvara byggs på Sveriges ledande SaaS-bolag. Du får mandatet att experimentera, misslyckas, lära och skala. Du blir en nyckelspelare i vår resa mot 2030 när vi tillsammans bygger en "best-in-class" teknikorganisation.
   

  

**Rollen**
 För att frigöra superkrafter hos hundratals utvecklare söker vi nu flera seniora utvecklare som kommer att arbeta med “AI Enablement”. Tillsammans är vi katalysatorn i den pågående transformation som mjukvarubranschen är i. Du kommer att ligga utanför våra utvecklingsteam, dina kunder är våra utvecklare och din framgång mäts i hur du lyckas att ge våra team verktyg och kunskap att bygga mjukvara i en värld som är under konstant förändring. Du arbetar i gränslandet mellan R&D, teknik, pedagogik och kultur.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att få göra**
* Coacha & Utbilda: Du arbetar "hands-on" med våra produktteam (mob-programmering, workshops) för att införa AI-drivna arbetssätt. Du lär dem att gå från att skriva syntax till att orkestrera lösningar med hjälp av verktyg som t.ex. Copilot, Cursor, ChatGPT och Claude.
* Bygga framtidens verktygslåda: Du är med och utvecklar vår interna plattform. Det kan handla om att sätta upp egna MCP-servrar (Model Context Protocol) som låter AI:n förstå Fortnox arkitektur, databaser och API:er.
* Driva experiment: Du identifierar flaskhalsar i våra flöden och designar experiment för hur AI kan lösa dem. Kan vi automatisera PR-reviews? Kan AI skriva våra migrationstester? Du tar fram hypoteser och mäter effekten.
* Kulturförflyttning: Du är en evangelist för "AI-first". Du hjälper oss att definiera vad "Engineering Excellence" betyder i en värld där AI skriver koden.


**Om dig**
* Du är en erfaren utvecklare med en djup teknisk förståelse för modern mjukvaruutveckling och vet hur "bra kod" ser ut.
* Du är en AI-pionjär som har gått bortom "hello world" med LLM:er. Du förstår RAG, agenter, prompt engineering och begränsningarna i dagens modeller.
* Du är en "Enabler" som brinner för Developer Experience (DX) och att din framgång mäts i andras framgång.
* Du är strategisk och förstår att verktyg utan en plan bara är kostnader. Du arbetar effektdrivet och kan koppla dina initiativ till kund- och affärsvärde.
* Du är ödmjuk och kan framföra dina tankar och idéer på ett pedagogiskt sätt. En klok kollega sa en gång att man ska “hold your strong opinions weakly”. För att lyckas i den här rollen behöver du både ha starka åsikter samtidigt som du är ödmjuk för att vi befinner oss i en värld av snabb förändring.


**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**
*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*
*Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
**Fullstackutvecklare med ledardriv – för dig som vill ta ansvar, inte bara leverera** 




  





 Det här är inte en roll för alla utvecklare, och det är helt medvetet.
 



  





 Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare med ledardriv – en person som är tekniskt stark, producerar själv och samtidigt tar ansvar för kvalitet, helhet och riktning i det dagliga arbetet. Någon som andra lyssnar på, inte för att det står i en titel, utan för att det märks i hur du tänker, prioriterar och agerar.
 



  





 Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av vår EdTech-plattform Kentaur och vår kundportal. Du arbetar nära vår Tech Lead och fungerar som en naturlig förlängning i teamet. Det handlar inte om formellt chefsansvar, utan om att hålla ihop leveransen i praktiken: fånga upp trådar, se samband, säkerställa kvalitet och driva saker hela vägen i mål.
 



  





 Rollen passar dig som har jobbat några år efter utbildningen och som känner att nästa steg inte är “mer kod”, utan mer ansvar – utan att släppa det tekniska. Du vet hur en arbetsplats fungerar på riktigt, inklusive de oskrivna reglerna, och trivs med tempo, förtroende och förväntningar.
 



 Du skriver kod varje vecka, men du tänker också struktur, hållbarhet och användning. Du hjälper andra att bli bättre, ser risker tidigt och ser till att det som byggs faktiskt håller – tekniskt, funktionellt och över tid.
 



  





**I vardagen innebär det bland annat att du:** 




  




* utvecklar och vidareutvecklar funktionalitet i React och Next.js
* arbetar med backend och data i Supabase (PostgreSQL)
* kvalitetssäkrar teamets leveranser och kodstruktur
* återkopplar löpande till Tech Lead kring teknik, beslut och förbättringar
* bidrar med projektledande egenskaper som prioritering, uppföljning och helhetssyn



  





**Vi tror att du:** 




  




* har 2–5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare efter utbildning
* är trygg i vår techstack och snabbt sätter dig in i nya sammanhang
* är en “bäst i klassen”-person: ambitiös, noggrann och ansvarstagande
* har ett tydligt 3D-perspektiv – du ser både detaljer och helhet
* är kommunikativ, pedagogisk och tydlig i samarbeten
* har ett bra minne för sammanhang, beslut och beroenden
* har ett entreprenöriellt driv och gillar att förbättra, förenkla och äga problem



  





 Det här är inte rätt roll om du helst vill få uppgifter serverade, undviker ansvar utanför din egen kod eller söker en renodlad junior- eller förvaltarroll. Däremot är den helt rätt om du vill ha förtroende, synlighet och möjlighet att växa mot större tekniskt och ledande ansvar över tid.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en tydlig nyckelroll i ett mindre team där din insats märks på riktigt, moderna tekniker och verkliga problem att lösa. Rollen är placerad i Stockholm med möjlighet till hybridarbete, och vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider, friskvårdsbidrag och kollektivavtal.
 



  





 Om du känner igen dig i beskrivningen är sannolikheten stor att vi bör prata.
